Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera after loosing mine a few weeks back. I LOVE it! its easy to use and small enough to carry in your evening clutch with your phone lipstick and keys. The features are also really great. I love the color accent and fish eye. I got mine in orange so that I can easily spot it in my bag. Very good investment.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but missing time lapse
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: I had a SD100IS which had time lapse option for video.  This one is supposed to be an upgrade of that, but they dropped the option for time lapse and my inquiries to Canon they have said it doesn't have the option and that "not all options can be included in all cameras" - but WHY TAKE AWAY OPTIONS ? They also said no firmware update would be made for that option.  I thought camera's IMPROVE on newer versions, not take away options.  I might have gone back and bought another SD1100IS but just kept this one.  Be careful with all Canon cameras - the reason I don't have my SD1100 anymore is because literally a few DROPS of water touched it for a few SECONDS and FRIED THE LCD.  The amount of water that touched it equaled the amount in an eye dropper and it was wiped off immediately.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoors and with lots of light..otherwise, not so great camera.
Reviews.Author: Steven J. Stinnett "steve-stinnett"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGD', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGDloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGDpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGDpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/91OM21Kd9mS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGDpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGDcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGDcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2AJKTQD6CSXGDcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:15 MinsThis camera is very small and lightweight and perfect for traveling and keeping close at hand for those special photo opportunities. The camera takes extremely clear photos when outside with bright light. However when indoors with low light, this camera is not that great. And if you plan to use the zoom and take photos or video at a distance don't expect the beautiful sharp quality as that of the non-zoomed photos. The digital zoom is horrible. So horrible that I have turned off the feature so that we can't possibly even use zoom. Overall, the camera will do what we wanted it for and we won't miss the candid shots of our 2 year old. I'll just make sure to bring my Canon XSi when I need the best photos I can get.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD 1400IS
Reviews.Author: DLG "Tree Man"
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, very little delay when you push the shutter button than other point and shoots I have had.  It takes excellent pictures.  Good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: VERY DISAPPOINTED - Defective Design
Reviews.Author: Wild Bull Writer
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't buy this camera because I saw where a buyer had reported a problem with the rubber flap covering the door to the battery/memory chip compartment. The reviewer said the flap is flimsy, could easily break. But I thought, hey, it's a Canon, surely it can't be that bad.Unfortunately, it is that bad. Within two weeks of my camera purchase and usage, the flap broke. And the breakage causes a real headache in using the camera.Here's the deal: The camera has a serious design/manufacturing flaw with the door to its battery/memory chip compartment. To open the compartment, you must lift the rubber flap, slide a hard plastic door to the side, and pop open the door. However, the rubber flap is flimsy and it broke right away. That means a hole in the plastic door is no longer covered by the flap, and dust and dirt can enter that hole and damage the battery and memory chip. (Why the hole is put in the plastic door, I don't know. Another design flaw?)Anyway, right now I have scotch tape over the hole and have contacted the seller for a return of the camera. It's very disappointing that Canon would produce an otherwise fine camera with such a lousy design of the door. In effect, it's putting a one-cent piece-of-junk flap on an otherwise good camera; the whole camera is down the toilet because of that single little production cheat.Who'd have expected that of Canon? Not me. But I will from now on.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed Canon fan
Reviews.Author: A. Mohammed "Mohammed"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an upgrade to my canon SD1000 which I love but doesnot have HD.After extensive research I bought SD1400IS and Unfortunately had to return it due to bad picture quality. The images were either blurred or had too much of ISO boost.The images looked unreal with too much of brightness even in auto mode.Moreover the mini hdmi is pain to connect since the cover does not open completely.The hd videos were grainy indoors even in ample light.My canon SD1000 does a way better job than this camera!

Reviews.Title: Blurry images and videos, poor lighting and noise. Difficulties in focusing at night.
Reviews.Author: supertsik "supertsik"
Reviews.Content: I owned several previous PowerShot models and I loved them all. I have tried lots of other makes too and until now Canon always ranked top in the quality of pictures. However, the SD1400 has difficulties in processing the pictures.Comments:1) AUTO mode is useless. It only works under ideal conditions. Canon tried to improve it by increasing the number of factors it calculates, but this defeated the purpose. Many times, especially at night, it sets the focusing range in "Macro" mode and my pictures get blurry. Generally, I get lots of blurry images, lots of overexposed images and noise. This wasn't the case with similar previous models that their AUTO mode was less complex.2) Similarly, other modes with semi-auto functions result in blurry and noisy images too. To overcome this, I only use it at "P" mode where I set ISO to 100 (or sometimes more), focusing range to 'infinity' and I select whether to use flash or not. Also, almost every time I use a different focusing/lighting point (by pressing the shutter button half-way) in order to achieve better lighting and not "burn" the picture.3) Very nice HD 720p video. However: A. Difficulty focusing at night too, B. Very large files mainly due to uncompressed audio.4) Nice lens, nice screen, fast browsing and very compact. However: Due to its round shape, it is very difficult to balance it on a surface in order to use timer.5) Nice features like 'color accent' and 'long shutter' (15 sec). Also excellent pictures under ideal lighting conditions.My general comment is that with previous Canon models, most of the times I would be satisfied with the picture. With this one, almost every other time I have to retake the picture. Therefore, I would not recommend this camera. I am selling mine and I will buy a different make, at least until Canon improves its compact range.Advice to those who know nothing about cameras:Don't be fooled by Megapixels and other numbers under the camera specifications. It is how well all the features of the camera work together to achieve the best result that matters. If you need proof, take a picture with a mobile phone and then set a compact camera at the same megapixels as your phone and compare the images. You will see a huge difference. Therefore, just read the reviews and buy the camera that has the largest percentage of users satisfied with its pictures.

Reviews.Title: Google 'canon 1400 lens error'
Reviews.Author: Dennis "DTz"
Reviews.Content: The camera is certainly compact and produces some impressive images given good lighting and no movement. Mine was used several times around the yard and some photos are very nice. Zooming in on a subject like a hummingbird will result in a blur. It's first real use was at a concert. Second row of seats and center stage. Expected those shots to be crisp but that wasn't the case. A few days later, it went on vacation with us but by mid-week, the camera had failed. Displaying "Lens Error Will automatically shut down" was all it would do - can't view memory card - nothing. Camera has to be returned for service.After searching for a solution by other users on the Internet, it was clear this is not uncommon and I wasn't going to fix it by tapping the lens and removing the battery as instructed by customer service. Some high ratings from users who have just purchased it but not the case with those who have owned it long enough the gauge reliability.

Reviews.Title: coplaint damaged item was shipped from amazon to customer
Reviews.Author: Sarah Weiss
Reviews.Content: I received a  camera as a wedding gift from my friend who purchased the camera from Amazon to my dismay when I opened up the box I was shocked to see the brand new camera never used had physical damage which was shipped this way from Amazon. we contacted the company Sold by  Senyx LLC and they said  they sold it to Amazon and was shipped from Amazons warehouse. If this doesnt get resolved through amazon I would let people know my experience and discourage them from shopping amazon if they don't stand behind their products and shipped a damaged item to a customer and give them the run arounds. I will give them one more chance to resolve this matter and fully refund for this productbefore I take any action.

Reviews.Title: Design Flaw on Battery Cover
Reviews.Author: Steve Chadwick
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon PowerShot as a quick point and shoot (carry in pocket).  The picture quality is decent and it is certainly small enough.  However, when I went to charge the battery, the rubber cover that seals the battery and flash card compartment from external elements became detached.  There are small holes in the plate that are protected by this rubber piece - this is what protects the battery and flash card.  I thought this wasn't a huge issue, I would just reattach the rubber - it is fitted with little rubber dimples.  Imaage the surprise when after 15 minutes of trying to reattach...  The seal was broken and getting a nice flush surface was no longer possible.  I could attach one end or another, but not flush for the length of the seal.This brings me to my question of why in the world would Canon build a protective cover that should never get removed from the case and then make it removable?  Why would Canon not just permabond this rubber to the hinge?  The purpose of this rubber appears to provide a non-slip surface to allow this compartment to be opened - it doesn't have to be removable.  It seems that it would be far cheaper to manufacture without all the precision of dipples, fitting, etc...At this point I grabbed a bottle of super glue and fixed it - which works - but since it isn't flush, it really looks quite poor.  However, without this cover, any sort of dirt/debris would enter the camera and potentially damage it - so I see this super glue approach as the lesser of two evils.  Anyways, given what I would consider a design flaw, I would not recommend this product, no matter how nicely it performs.

Reviews.Title: Fast pictures, great quality
Reviews.Author: JBFL
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It's more compact than my past cameras, but takes higher quality pictures. One important thing that I especially love is that there is hardly any delay from powering on the camera to actually shooting the photo!

Reviews.Title: great camera with few minor problems
Reviews.Author: GinJo
Reviews.Content: An overall GREAT camera! I am very picky and had been doing camera research for quite some time before I found this online and made the purchase. It's been a month now, and this is what I have concluded so far.I love how it can fit in my pocket and go with me ANY where without taking up much space. Before buying this, my biggest concern was owning a large camera that was too bulky. This camera is what some might say "too small" but for me, it is perfect. Very thin width, and easy to tuck into your pocket or purse for on-the-go moments. One great feature is the ability to change the type of photography setting; I have loved using the Kids/Pets function to take pictures of moving objects because it can easily capture a still shot of a moment that would have otherwise been blurry. I recently went to my cousins wedding and got a great snapshot of my parents dancing, and it came out fabulous. The battery life is great, but definitely won't last as long when you take videos. It can also get annoying to see the "Busy" signal after taking a photo, but that doesn't stay on the screen for very long.The two main things I definitely do NOT like: the bottom of the camera is not very flat, so it is hard to set the camera down on a surface and have it balance if you want to set up the 10 second timer. Also, the plastic piece that covers the spot to plug in the camera cord does not open well for me. I'm not sure if this is common on all of this version of the camera or if my particular camera has this malfunction. However, every time I open mine, I feel as though the plastic covering piece might snap off. I have started removing my SD card and putting it directly into an SD slot that is on the side of my computer to load my pictures (without ever having to open the camera cord compartment) so it doesn't bother me anymore. Besides these few minor details, it is WONDERFUL, and I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a compact camera that takes amazing pictures! Best of luck choosing a camera that works well for you :)Summary: takes great photos; small and lightweight; easy to use; few minor technical problems but still highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Can't stand it anymore, going to get a different camera
Reviews.Author: D. Morris
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera so I would have something small to throw in my pocket.  The fact is, this camera is too slow to take a good picture.  I would rather have something a bit larger that actually takes good pictures (The S95 comes to mind).  I just got back from a wedding and I was shocked at how many pictures were just crap.  Low light ones were the worst, but overall, the slowness of this camera, in terms of focusing and FINALLY taking a picture, is what has driven me to get rid of it (countless shots were missed and the others tended to often be bad).Yes, I have a S95 and it ROCKS.  It costs $400 but consistently takes amazing pictures (as opposed to the 1400 consistently taking BAD pictures).  I suspect the SX210 might actually be a decent replacement for this camera as well.So in short, to me, the small size of this camera is not worth the trade-offs.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: pezzy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last June to take to Hawaii the following month. I bought a large SD card and it was more than enough for over 1000 pictures at the highest resolution. The flash worked great and night and during the day the pictures are crisp and high quality. My only minor complaint is that the audio is weak when doing a video, but that's expected for this price. I would recommend this camera to anyone who needs something compact for family trips. If you want to be a serious photographer, get an SLR.

Reviews.Title: DURABLE! Great for the clumsy like me.
Reviews.Author: S. Bates
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera! Best of all it's DURABLE!--Perfect for travel, I take it everywhere I go. At first I stupidly put it in my purse next to keys and other hard objects and the LCD screen cracked (completely my fault), but it still works perfectly with a huge crack in the screen! I also have dropped it on cement multiple times (I'm clumsy...) battery flying out and everything, and now have all kinds of scratches on the corners, and the shutter button is a little looser than it originally was, but it STILL works PERFECTLY!! Very Durable!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price
Reviews.Author: A. Neil
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty happy with this little camera. I bought another brand for about $100 more and returned it. If you're expecting a DSLR, you will be sorely disappointed. For a small point and shoot that fits well in a purse, it great!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Robert T. Mize
Reviews.Content: Completely satisfied. Much better then my last camera. No out-of-focus shots, auto-flash means all bad light shots turn out ok, and color is fabulous. Highly recommend this product to anyone. Also, battery lasts quite a while before needing recharging.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: J. Daniel "JD"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera after reading all the reviews, this thig is so tiny so it is so easy to carry.  I carry this in my pocket everywhere you go!  The HD videos are amazing, you can pick color differences etc.  Lots of things you can do with this camera, like fish-eye lens etc.  Videos are in .mov so if you are a apple user this is the best. For me I have to convert it before editing.

Reviews.Title: I like It
Reviews.Author: jdbroadley
Reviews.Content: After reading all the rewiews, I was a little hesitant on purchasing this camera...but I am glad that I did.Just got it last week, but I already like it eventhough there are still things to figure out.We recorded a video on it, and it captured what we wanted it to. It does fit right in my pocket.I like the button size, but my husband has trouble because he has big fingers.You definately have to make sure that you hold the button half way down so that the camera has time to focus before pushing it all the way down, or your pictures will come out blurry.  I will update after I have had more time to use it.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Maxine Quigley
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small compact camera that takes good pictures. This camera is perfect.It fits in my pocket yet has a zoom that takes great close ups. I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: small camera, big features
Reviews.Author: Dale Crass
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of big features for such a small camera. I originally bought a Nikon s8100 for my wife because of the Consumer Reports reviews. I wanted a camera that would take good low light pictures and video. The Nikon took excellent low light photos but the HD 1080p video was not as good. I bought this Canon for my son to take pictures of our new granddaughter. This camera wasn't rated as well as the Nikon but the low light photos were as good and the low light video was superior to the Nikon. The Canon HD video was 720p compared to the 1080p of the Nikon but is also $150+ cheaper than the Nikon. I sent the Nikon back and bought another Canon sd1400 for my wife. Outdoor picture and video quality is good with excellent accurate color retention. The automatic functions are simple, straightforward, and adequate. The only problem I have with this camera is the manual program functions are a bit awkward and slow to maneuver. I am used to my DSLR functions which are a little more straight forward.If low light photos and video are important to you, then I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera
Reviews.Author: MGreen64
Reviews.Content: I searched for the right camera for about 3 months.  I finally found everything I wanted in this extremely compact camera.  I have had the camera for about 2 months now.First off it is very small.  It fits in my pocket with no problem.Second, it takes GREAT low-light pics.  I needed a camera to take clear bright pics in places like a bowling alley, bar, or at a wedding where the light is no where near bright enough.The last thing I was looking for is hd video.  The video this camera shoots is very clear.  And you can zoom in while recording.I would def recommend this camera too my friends.

Reviews.Title: One of the best & easiest Camera to enjoy everyday photography
Reviews.Author: A. Pirzadeh
Reviews.Content: I love photgraphy and I have complete set of Nikon CD 40 w 4 lenses, however I always dreams to have a small, cariable camera w fast, speed shot that produce good pictuers.I bought this camera on Black Friday only for great price of $149.99 and so far took many good pics.p.s not the best quality in night or nightly photography but then again this not a pro camera and it is good for its price :>

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Raymond Gomez "Raymond"
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera that i have ever owned but man does this baby do the job. Not only does it take crystal clear high quality pictures it even shoots video in HD. I Have a class 6 8 GB card it and runs smooth and it has about an hour of vid in HD to record. I Also like the zoom its pretty clear, my gf has a kodak 14. mp camera and we compared video and picture quality and the canon dominated it. The video is standard definition is pretty good but its even clearer in hd. I would definitely recommend this camera to anyone who wants a small but powerful device.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for my wife who is not very tech savvy.  She has taken right to it and love the easiness of the camera all together.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: nobodys.Angel
Reviews.Content: I purcashd this camera for my younger sister this past Christmas and she is in love with it! it by far surpasses her previous Samsung.  I've used it myself for a couple pics and videos.  Quality is great, very crisp&clean.; Fairly simple menu options.  Face detection, 4x zoom, self-timer, etc. I have no complaints. It's tha perfect gift for any begginners who love photography and would like to experiment with an exceptional point-and-shoot. I will definitely stick with Canon brand for my nxt cam purchase!

Reviews.Title: nice camera but small
Reviews.Author: Sprint180
Reviews.Content: First I want to say the camera is a really nice  camera and takes great photos but, it is small.  I don't have large hands but these buttons are smaller then my last canon.  The zoom button is the one by the picture button on top that sticks up.  But it is hard to use i think.  I did not realize that the camera was so small and thin.  I probably would have gotten a different model.  This one is easy to drop, gonna have to use that wrist strap.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Conor
Reviews.Content: Very affordable, small camera. Takes decent pics. Zoom function is a little awkwardly placed at the top of the camera as a switch, instead of the typical rotating control around the shoot button.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Sandra J. Ryan
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it.  It takes wonderful pics and so easy to use.  Plus it's so compact that she carries it in her purse everywhere she goes.  Perfect camera for everyday use!

Reviews.Title: Mostly Positive Experience
Reviews.Author: Nathan Waack
Reviews.Content: This is a very small and capable camera which, for the most part, works very well with everything I've tried to use it for.  I do have two issues with it though:1. The camera is almost too small and it's rounded edges make it somewhat difficult to hold.  If your hands aren't that big this won't be a problem, but if you have big hands make sure to go to a store and try it out first.2. In low light situations the camera tends to either up the ISO level too high and leave the shutter open too long, leading to fuzzy or blurry pictures OR the flash goes off and it overexposes the picture slightly.Overall though, for a small relatively cheap camera, this does a good job.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Syracuse Pete
Reviews.Content: No Complaints at all.  Very thin and great design.  Works well.  Photos are very good quality.  Would but again for sure

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: stanyoy
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera perfect to be carried to the clubs or restaurants< it takes the same space as a blackberry> I am a Canon customer> for the money I paid for it GREAT DEAL!

Reviews.Title: Not up to snuff
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Smith "coffee guy"
Reviews.Content: I have used Canon P&S; cameras for years and have always been pleased with them - excellent images, easy to use and the price is right. I have an SD1000 and wanted something small with IS so selected the SD1400IS. So far, I have been less than impressed with the camera. The SD1000 was a nice piece of stainless steel - the newer model seems flimsy by comparison. Smaller, yes - better quality, no. The images at 14MP are actually worse than the previous camera (not unexpected since the sensor size didn't change) but should have been of equal quality. The metering is also worse, producing many shots that are either under or over exposed. The IS on the camera really makes little difference in overall image quality. I would really not recommend this camera to anyone - there are much better small cameras on the market. I gave my SD1400IS to a friend.I also have a Canon SX200 and it is a superb camera in all respects (as was the SD1000). Canon "can" make really good cameras - but they don't always.

Reviews.Title: most awesome
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Howells
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd pocket size canon digital camera... sometimes I prefer using this camera to my Nikon d5000 ...because it is light, pocket size and sometimes the pictures even come out better...i like the zoom feature...trimming and icontrast..video with zoom..My pictures look great!!!  .....can't go wrong with this or any canon point and shoot camera ....

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Danilo
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera that you can practically bring everywhere. The quality of photos are great for the price of this thing. The features are extensive and extremely fun to use. I really love the face and smile detection technology. The only downside is the short battery life so I suggest buying an extra battery pack.

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera: very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Gloria
Reviews.Content: I am a grandma and this is my very first digital camera. I was really nervous that I wouldn't be able to figure out how to use it and that I wouldn't know what buttons to push, but it is extremely easy to figure out! The pictures have turned out well, and they should get even better as I continue to practice. Very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: NICE LITTLE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: rb "rb"
Reviews.Content: A GREAT LITTLE POCKET CAMERA.  ITS GREATEST FEATURE IS ITS PETIT SIZE.  COMBINE THIS WITH EASE OF USE AND DECENT PICTURE QUALITY AND YOU HAVE A CAMERA YOU WILL TAKE WITH YOU AND USE.

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it, love it.
Reviews.Author: A. Carolan "Ct Yankee"
Reviews.Content: The SD1400IS is my 3rd Canon power shot, so I am obviously a huge fan.  Each time I decide to upgrade, I am instantly impressed with the improvements and wonder why I waited so long.  This camera continues Canon's history of excellent performance and ease of use.  It would take someone completely unfamiliar with a Canon about ten minutes to figure out how to use all the features.  What I especially like are the 14.1 MP's, the size (very small) and the weight (extremely light).  Oddly, the viewing area is huge, so the size has not affected the ability to frame pictures clearly and easily.  This Canon is perfect to take on trips, to sporting events, anywhere that you want to be ready to take picture but don't want to lug anything heavy or cumbersome.  It easily fits in a pocket.This is also a great camera for the technologically challenged.  The camera does all the figuring for you -- unless you want to put the controls on manual and figure things for yourself.

Reviews.Title: Very Awesome!  Highly Recommend.
Reviews.Author: maddie
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new camera as my old one was outdated and I wanted something with better picture quality.  A friend who swears by Canon picked this camera out for me as it was in my price range.  I couldn't be happier.  Picture quality is awesome.  The different picture taking features are awesome too.  It's easy to use, even if you're a beginner like me, but lets you take pictures like you're a professional.  I love this camera and have actually had a couple of friends buy it too after using mine.  Highly, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Naiyue Qiu
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my grandpa who is over 80 years old.So far he loves it and he is able to manage to navigate the screen with minimal instructions. To him, his favorite part is to shoot 720P movies and share with the family through youtube.I played with the camera for one afternoon.  My favorite part is the Fisheye effect. It is the lens you probably won't get with your DSLR. It's truly lots fun with the fisheye effect with different objects, especially to shoot my cat in the fisheye mode.  Another great point to mention is the 28mm wide angle. Again, this is something you have to pay extra for on a DSLR camera.With my limited testing, I can say this is great camera packed with lots fun features. If you have a DSLR, this is a perfect carry around camera to compensate for the extra lenses you don't have to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but...
Reviews.Author: JR "gasgasgas"
Reviews.Content: I have owned several Canons. The sd700is was the camera I dropped in my pocket and took anywhere. When it broke, I bought the sd1400is. It is a nice point and shoot camera. One of the reasons I liked the sd700 so much was the choice between the led screen and an optical viewfinder. I find it much easier to compose a snapshot in bright sunlight throught the optical viewfinder. Alas, the sd1400 lacks one. I am still thinking about finding an sd700.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Watsh Rajneesh
Reviews.Content: Great on image stabilization and the picture quality is great too. Taking snaps of my kid while he was seated in a car ride in an amusement park was amazing with this camera - thats when we realized the image stabilization is too good with this camera. The fiber casing of camera body is just ok and i wish it were stainless steel or some metal. Other than that camera is compact, easy to use and carry.

Reviews.Title: Replaced my Flip Ultra HD for vids
Reviews.Author: C. P. Vasquez
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to replace my Flip Ultra HD with a point and shoot that does HD video because i wanted the capability of snap shots without carrying two devices. This camera does the job. The video looks amazing, much better in low light than the Flip. The one drawback is the sound is not as clear as the flip, and there is a noticeable high pitch whine in the recordings.

Reviews.Title: Cheap Quality
Reviews.Author: cameramom
Reviews.Content: I have owned 3 powershot models and this was by far the cheapest quality of them all. I have had the camera for less than a year and sent the camera in because an E32 restart message was randomly appearing on my screen. They charged me even though the camera was still under warranty even though there was no physical damage to the camera. The agent on the phone said that just like old cars were made, older models were made more sturdy, even though newer models were more expensive. I think that Canon's quality is decreasing and the customer service is nowhere near as good as it used to be, its a shame because I used to be a Canon advocate, but things have changed as far as quality is concerned. SAVE YOURSELF the money, this is not made well!

Reviews.Title: 2 months for $200!
Reviews.Author: James HA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from Adorama Camera at Amazon in April 2011.  In June (2 months later), the camera stopped working - lens stuck open.  Adorama Camera refuse to exchange this faulty camera stating their 14 day return policy!!!!!!  They also did not return any of my e-mail to them!!!!  Amazon were also unhelpful.  The moral of the story: be careful what you buy and read the small print.  Adorama Camera have a very poor return policy and Amazon won't help you.  Go to a real "big box" store ie; Best Buy.  This will be probably be my last purchase from Amazon :(

Reviews.Title: Love/Hate the Powershot
Reviews.Author: Anita
Reviews.Content: My husband bought the Cannon Powershot 1400 for me for Christmas.  Exactly what I wanted:  a little point and shoot that I could carry with me without the bulk.  I loved it. Absolutely LOVED it.  Took it everywhere (in the case) and got some rather good pictures.  Then, last night, we taking pictures and the screen at times went black.  Then, Error 32 (dead without being able to be resussitated).  Apparently this is a fatal flaw of this camera.  I read reviews and this seems to be a common occurrence.  I am very disappointed as I thought this was a perfect camera.  Now it is dead.  Not a cheap experience.  Just wanted to warn others, while this is a wonderful camera, one never knows when it is going to "die" way before its time.  (My old Pentax lasted over 5 years...way longer than the 7 months of the cannon.)

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Camera!
Reviews.Author: TheEconomist
Reviews.Content: First, the picture quality is poor, and the video quality is wretched.  Next, the controls are arranged in the clumsiest possible way.  If you want to see a focused picture, you must push the shutter button down half-way, but to operate the zoom you must take your finger off the shutter button and move the zoom slide, which is very sticky and you end jerking the camara around and off-picture.  In other words, you can zoom a blurry picture or you can see a good picture wherever the zoom happens to be set.  On other cameras you can do both at the same time.  Finally, the camera is just too small for adult (at least male) hands.  It is, in its own way, a marvel of miniaturization, but unless you have miniature hands you are out of luck.Secondly, there is a problem with the Amazon return policy, which is stated as 30 days for cameras.  However, even if you buy it from Amazon and pay your money to Amazon, if they ship it from one of their associates (say 17th Street Photo) you are stuck with the return policy of that associate, which happens to be 7 days.  After giving it a couple of tries over 10-12 days, I tried returning it to Amazon, who forwarded me to 17th Street Photo, who told me I was past the return date.  I complained to Amazon who told me I actually bought it from 17th Street Photo, that they had nothing to do with the sale, and while they would think about it, I was basically stuck.  The next day, Walmart's had the same model on display for exactly the same price, and you could actually try it out before you bought it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for great price.
Reviews.Author: Lavere F. Stewart II
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for under $180 which is an unbelievable deal for the quality and features you get.  If you want a no frills get the job done camera with HD video and good picture quality, this is your camera.  If however, you want something with tons of features and settings for tweaking, this is not for you.  It is perfect for someone who wants something that is super easy to use and will auto adjust for just about any environment without having to mess with anything.  It is a true point and shoot camera that is really compact but don't expect the same quality you would get from one that is $500+.  My only issue is that the little door to access the usb and hdmi ports totally sucks.  It makes it really difficult to plug in the usb cable and I can't even get the hdmi cable in there because I'm afraid the hinge is going to break off.  This maybe just a defect on my camera though.

Reviews.Title: Not as perfect as I'd hoped for
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: This camera is very pocketable and takes good pictures most of the time - exactly what I was looking for, for a "social" camera.Only major complaint is the camera majorly underexposes shots in outdoor lighting about 20-30% of the time.  When taking a picture, the preview screen looks correctly exposed, but then when the shutter is half-pressed the camera focuses and the preview goes very dark.  Happens in "P" and "Auto" modes.  I've only used the camera for a couple of weeks, and hopefully I can work around this by adjusting the E/V compensation, but for a point-and-shoot I shouldn't have to.  Expected better from Canon.

Reviews.Title: Very versatile, excellent value, great pictures
Reviews.Author: T. Acar "Tolginator"
Reviews.Content: I love this thing. I boight this for our trip to France, and it served us wonderfully.This is the fourth digital camera I bought, including a few P&S; and SLR Nikons, but the first Canon after my venerable T60 (yeah, that is an old one). I did a lot of research before buying this one, knowing that I did not want to lug my digital SLR with me while touristing around under the sun. So, I was set on a second P&S; anyhow. I bought a 16G SD card, and it worked beatifully. I have not tested the video, yet. But, the pictures are excellent. No, this is not a touch screen camera, and in fact, I am glad that it is not. I don't want to accidentally touch the screen and change something - I'd rather be in control.Pros: Very small size, bunch of options you can pick, or just switch the dial to "Green" and let the camera auto-pick the setting for you.  Very light, great LCD screen, auto rotate in the LCD viewer. Its integration with Windows 7 is remarkable - I love it. The battery that comes with it lasted for about 200 images, including some with flashes. It falls short of the claimed 220 (or so), but they always do since they don't assume flash and on/off cycles in-between the shots.Cons: Special battery - but I almost hesitate to put this in as a con. I also ordered a 3-pack battery set for less than $10, and found out that the replacement 3rd party battery has a higher mAh than the one that comes with the camera. Well, that's good, because I hate to run out of battery. Mind you, the fill-in flash for portraits on a sunny day does not always automatically kick in. So, I had to switch the dial to portrait and enable the flash manually. No big deal, though.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Lisa Ashley
Reviews.Content: I read about this camera and ended up purchasing it. It takes great pictures! Have been using it for a month now and no problems. Really easy to use too. I have had numerous cameras but always go back to Canon... It is GREAT! I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Sleek and powerful, nice HD
Reviews.Author: J. Pinn
Reviews.Content: For $250, I'm satisfied with the SD1400. It's small and simple enough not to intimidate my wife which now means that Daddy can actually appear in a couple of family photos.  The picture and video quality are excellent too.  The only criticism that I have is that zoom is unavailable when shooting video and that the shutter is a bit slow to respond (as is the case with most of the cameras in this class irrespective of manufacturer).

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Camera Model
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh Dolan
Reviews.Content: I have the same camera in a different color, and have had it for about three years. I love this model and decided to buy a second one as a backup!

Reviews.Title: Good value!
Reviews.Author: Sachin Airani
Reviews.Content: Sleek, compact, takes great pictures and fits in anywhere- for those who like smaller stuff to handle unlike the baggage of SLRs. The flash is good too...gives a decent low light picture.

Reviews.Title: Excellent photos can come in small cameras!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before a trip. It was kind of an impulse purchase. I needed a camera but didn't want anything really bulky to have to carry around. I have 2 other cameras that I bring on trips but they are bigger, professional ones. I figured Canon has always had a good name so I'd try it out.It's am amazing camera. It takes great pictures. Most people thought they were post cards because the quality was so sharp. It's small and compact so I usually could put it in my pocket if I didn't want to carry it around.There are also some cool features like color swap and color accent. I also had fun with the miniature effect and fisheye lense.If you are just getting into photography or you are needing a small backup, this is the camera for you!

Reviews.Title: A Great Buy! :)
Reviews.Author: estie kushner
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed this camara. i got it about three, four years ago and it still works great! the settings are easy to chnage and help the pictures come out really clear. The only thing that doesnt work perfectly is when you zoom sometimes the picture wont be crystal clear (but most of the time it works- and I've had this camera for awhile!!!)It was worth purchasing!Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Paul J. Lynch
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these literally hours before travelling to London.  We took over 7,000 pictures on that trip alone.  Easy to use.  Clear pictures.  Battery life is awesome and easy to charge in a hotel room.  Really love them!

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: R. Ludwig
Reviews.Content: I purchased camera so I could have a small camera with me when my DSLR was not. I take this camera everywhere. This camera takes great photos. It is small but packed with features. It's a 14MP camera, that does movies as well, and has a nice set of controls. It also does a really nice job of close ups for things like flowers (the close up focus distance is something like about 3/4-1"). The camera is nicely rounded and feels comfortable in the hand. The battery also lasts quite a long time. However, you can purchase a 3-pack of batteries quite cheaply so, I'd recommend that so you have a backup in case you need it. My only possible complaint about this camera is that it is small and so are the buttons, so it can be a bit hard to use if you have large hands (but, I did want a small camera).

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: David P. Micalchuck
Reviews.Content: Compact easy to use excellent sharp pictures great zoom, fast focus, easy to shift modes.  Battery last long time without recharging.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't Do Without It
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera once before.  Loved it then, love it now.  My husband broke the first one by dropping it on its lens.  He replaced it for me with the same exact model since I liked it so much and was used to its controls.When you take a photograph it shows up right away on the viewing screen.  I took off the auto-review.  There is a pause between the picture you just snapped and the ability to take the next photo.  It never bothered me before, until I read the reviews.  Now I notice.  But I'm pretty sure it has an option to take  several photos in quick succession, I just haven't tried it yet.Lightweight, looks slick, takes nice photographs, fun to use... couldn't ask for too much more from a digital point and shoot!

Reviews.Title: A great portable camera - takes photos well in lots of situations
Reviews.Author: Barn
Reviews.Content: First, you have to realize this is not a $700 canon SLR with a $700 lens. This is a really compact and handy camera that takes really great pictures. I've used mine for 2.5 years and while one of my brothers and one of my sisters have very nice SLR digital cameras, those are bulky and hard to carry around. Those expensive cameras take professional quality photos, but this little camera comes close enough. I take a lot of photos of family events and work projects. The situations carry from dim light in basements, to dusk scenes, to the sunny outdoors, to indoor lighting and flourescent lighting. In all these situations the camera does a very good job! I've been excited to have it, and excited is the right word. It carries so easily in jeans or  shirt pocket, it has many modes of photo taking, and I've gotten several people asking me for information on my camera when they see my photos.The portability of this tool, and the quality of the movies and photos it takes - these are what I'm still excited about after 2.5 years. I love this camera. I also recommend buying this charger, http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0026O57BA/ "Brand New Nb-4l Battery Home Travel Rapid Charger with Car Adapter for Canon PowerShot SD780 IS" for keeping a spare battery charged for fast replacement. On 5-7-2013 this charger costs $5.07. A spare battery, a NB-4L, costs another $5 or so. The battery last a pretty long time, though - for most people the extra charger won't be needed.

Reviews.Title: 2nd Camera that I purchased
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Goodman
Reviews.Content: Good point and shoot Camera.  Bought one for my daughter a few years ago, and now I bought one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Jael
Reviews.Content: I'm so happy I bought this camera. It's one of the best cameras I have owned. I'm sure new technology moves fast, but this camera can even shoot in the dark. Pretty amazing in my book :)

Reviews.Title: nice camera but too slow and too slim profile
Reviews.Author: JPX925
Reviews.Content: My first digital camera was a Canon SD700 from 7-8 years ago and had been very pleased with its performance and durability. I was looking to update it and was choosing between a few Canon models. I had at home with me for comparison an ELPH110 HS and an SX260 HS but I thought of trying another SD and got this SD1400. This takes sharp pictures on still though still a bit slow and not quite clear when taking pictures of my fast-moving dogs. What I didn't like about it too is that it is so slim that, as one reviewer pointed out, it's like holding a slippery bar of soap in your hand. I cannot lay it upright because it is so narrow and it just felt so unsecure in my hands when I use it. Like him, I also didn't like the tab control for the zoom. It also has only 720p video recording when there are already 1080p available in a number of different models. I also didn't like that it is made in China. I ended up returning it and settled for the SX260 and ELPH310 as my point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great image
Reviews.Author: Dharmesh K. Gnansivam "Dharmesh"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my friend,, and i have used it too.. this is very handy and great picture quality..... I recommend this product

Reviews.Title: Yay!
Reviews.Author: Monica Mingo
Reviews.Content: Fun camera and takes very good pictures. I am a foodie and like to take pictures of food so the macro on this camera is very good.  Simple to use and I really like the size of the screen.

Reviews.Title: would recommend to look elsewhere
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Got the camera based on good reviews and since it was the newer model from the SD1000 (which was amazing camera). This one (1400) is quite a disaster. The only good pics i can get out of it is during perfect light conditions. Over wise the quality is pretty bad. some times look like there is filter installed to make photos to make paint like looking.I would definitively skip this one and look for something else.

Reviews.Title: Profection
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: The Power Shot SD 1400 IS...is easy to use, compact and takes great pictures. Anyone wanting a camera that's user friendly this one's for you.

Reviews.Title: Also an improvement. Best Camera Line.
Reviews.Author: Omar Mrva "Designer"
Reviews.Content: I've been buying the Canon Power shot line for the past 10 years and ever model is an improvement over the previousmodel. The controls and on Screen Menus are the most user intuitive of any other manufacturer (and I've also own(ed) a Nikon,Olympus and the Sony Cybershot) My only negative review of this product and it's a small one -literally; is that that camera's aregetting significantly smaller, which makes them easier to misplace and mishandle. But this is small size is handy if your taking thison the road or to parties and don't want a lot of bulk but a lot of photographic muscle. Great camera line. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Never again
Reviews.Author: travelbunny "travelbunny"
Reviews.Content: 3 months out of warranty and I get the dreaded lens error... AGAIN. This sis the third camera this has happened to, always just out of warranty. Wake up Canon. There is no point making a great product and not addressing a serious issue. I bought this camera as a gift and while it was a great camera, it is the last Canon point and shoot I am buying. It will be replaced with a Ricoh

Reviews.Title: A good option when travelling light
Reviews.Author: Ken Ku-Chih
Reviews.Content: I like to think of myself as a bit of a snapper. All things being equal (i.e. superfluous luggage allowance, generous cabin space and possibly a team of Sherpas to carry it around for me when I get there...) I prefer to travel with my SLR.Often though, on short trips and/or small regional-travel planes it's just not practical to cart around my SLR paraphernalia on the off chance I'll see something I might want to take a picture of. My SLR is a (work) travel luxury not a travel essential.And so this sleek little raven beauty is the ideal trade-off. Known as the Powershot SD1400IS in North America (and the "Ixus 130" in civilised countries [joke!]). The photos are good for a compact and the video is passable too. It's not a patch on the SLR as I say, but then it's about the same size and weight as the battery cover so it's a pretty good option overall.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1400IS (Pink)
Reviews.Author: Size16
Reviews.Content: I bought a Black Canon SD1400IS before purchasing the same model in Pink for my wife.  They both perform similarly.  The SD1400IS is a really decent point and shoot camera and produces great pictures for scenes where there is not a lot of fast movement and there is adequate light.  I love it for outdoor shots.  When the flash is disabled pictures can be taken about once every two seconds.  It has good adjustments for White Balance.  Typical for point and shoots with this size sensor, it shows some grain compared with a DSLR as the ISO value goes above 80-100 - this isn't a hit against the camera though as pictures are still very good.  Focus is generally good in Auto and Program modes but the camera may decide to focus on something other than what you expect.  Pressing the shutter button half way re-focuses so it just takes a small movement of the camera to put what you want in the green focus box.  Shooting indoors with compact fluorescent lighting often produces pictures with a yellowish hue.  This is typical with many digital cameras but it can be overcome by using the Custom White balance setting.  Video is good at all video resolutions.  Optical Zoom works well with pictures or video.  A word of caution: You can change the zoom level while videoing but only up or back to the level you start with.  If you are partially zoomed in you can increase the zoom level but you can't go below the zoom level you started with.  All in all a great little camera which I can easily recommend.

Reviews.Title: Okay at First - Disappointing in the End
Reviews.Author: Earl Wilkerson
Reviews.Content: I admit when I first purchased the 1400IS, I was immediately excited to have an ultra-portable, lightweight and effective alternative to my beloved - albeit bulky - dSLR.  That opinion changed, however, after the first five or six outings.I own and regularly use a dSLR, and understand the features they offer, so I will preface this review with the notion that a point and shoot can never really replace an SLR, digital or otherwise.  Many of the features present on the "big boy" SLR cameras absolutely cannot compare to the simpler-built point-and-shoots.  That's not a slight towards point-and-shoots; it is a fact.I have used my wife's Canon point-and-shoot and love it (an earlier PowerShot model).  The image quality is outstanding, and color accuracy is quite good.  Additional, it features a limited amount of shutter lag, low flash recycle time, and a rather good battery life.Still, I maintain a not-so-warm-and-fuzzy feeling towards the 1400IS.  Although it possesses a decent battery life, and a wealth of handy features (like video mode), I found the image quality is less than optimal, even in the best of lighting scenarios.  A sunny, mid-afternoon photo in "auto mode" should not require the camera be stabilized on a tripod to avoid motion blur (due to a very low shutter speed).  Technically, in some cases it shouldn't even necessitate the use of the flash.  Yet the photo is either underexposed or blurry because the sensor built into this camera experiences a dramatic and catastrophic lapse in "judgment" when determining the proper balance of shutter speed, aperture, and ISO speed.  As was the case in nearly every environment, I put the camera in.Other than the nagging element of sketchy picture quality, the camera was everything I read about prior to purchasing:  very small/lightweight, had good battery life, bright LCD screen, fast shutter response, excellent range of automatic modes (such as night, sport, etc.), etc.A vast majority of the camera gear I've purchased in the past has carried the Canon badge, but this is the only I've encountered so far that leaves me regretting the purchase.  Perhaps I bought a defective copy?  Perhaps I simply bought a bad camera?  I cannot really decide.  However, I urge you to visit a local store and at least take this for a test spin to see for yourself how it works.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot SD1400is
Reviews.Author: Johnny
Reviews.Content: Camera Worked Great why it worked. This camera has a defect in the power system.Once it is off Warranty they want a minimum of $130 just to look at camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Alliegator
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera! It is the smallest camera ever, it is very slim. the picture quality is great on the screen and on the computer, but I am not sure how they print off. And got to love the color :)

Reviews.Title: Best small cam around if you use AUTO a lot
Reviews.Author: P. Wojtkiewicz "WOJO"
Reviews.Content: Did lot of review E homework to see what is the best small compact camera that using AUTO mode takes best pictures and this is the one. Always get great pictures. VERY HAPPY

Reviews.Title: The lens of this camera is way too delicate
Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: I bought this in Nov 2010 and used it with no issue until Sept 2011 when, without dropping it or putting it near water or getting it dirty, it stopped working and would display 'Lens Error, will shut down automatically' which essentially rendered my camera useless. Very disappointing after only 10 months of use for this to happen.After googling a bit, I found out that a lot of Canon point and shoot cameras frequently get Lens errors. It's something that Canon refuses to address, apparently.This camera's functionality is good enough, but I wouldn't go so far as to say that it's great. The lens is also highly delicate and easily susceptible to damage.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Bocachic
Reviews.Content: I always go with Canon for digital cameras and this new, little version did not disappoint. It takes great (and quick!) pictures and the display screen is pretty sizable. It has neat features to play around with and is user-friendly. Also, the small size makes it easy to fit in any little pouch and carry around with you! No complaints at all- I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Often doesn't select the best settings.
Reviews.Author: D. Oscarson "Domestic Diva"
Reviews.Content: Selected this camera based on its compact size and 'super smart' processor for selecting the best settings for the picture you are trying to take. Also liked the nice wide angle lens and fast F2.8 lens. The 720p video was outdated but fine for my needs.The good is that I find the camera very easy to use and am very satisfied with the video and audio that it records. 720p looks fine when viewing on my computer or TV.Also good is when the camera selects the right settings for a still picture, it takes a very nice picture. Sharp, well saturated (sometimes a little too saturated).But the bad is that the camera often selects settings that do not seem correct for the picture I'm trying to take, and there are not options to get control of the camera so that I can force the correct settings.Some examples are pictures where I want more of a landscape affect. Even though bright out the camera selected a wide open aperture (f2.8) resulting in a very shallow depth of field and secondary subjects being blurry. I also find in lower light conditions the camera will often select shutter speeds that I am can not hold without blurring (1/10) even with IS on, but will use an ISO of 120. I would much rather have the picture with an ISO 200 and a shutter speed closer to 1/20. The result is a lot more disappointing pictures that I had hoped for, and me researching ways to get around some of these issues.

Reviews.Title: Everything i hoped for and more!
Reviews.Author: Justina
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera purchase ever!!!I was attracted to Canon because of the sleek design, multiple function modes and becuase all of my friends own Canon's and they love them.This camera takes excellent pictures and videos w/ great sound as well.Its small and slim, very easy to use and gives me so many options that i can grow into as i continue to learn how to use all of its functions.I highly recommend this camera, i haven't been this satisfied with any purchase in a long time!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: hurtsdonut
Reviews.Content: Outstanding pint-n-shoot for the price (I paid $149). Tons of options available in the program menu, but all the most common functions are readily accessible (flash/video/etc). You can pick it up & take great pictures right out of the box.VERY easy to move through the menus once you download the full manual. Great image quality for a camera this size. It has many features that most users don't even know about unless they read the full manual.The CCD sensor is supposed to use more battery power than a CMOS, but I have not used enough to tell yet. Not crazy about the battery compartment or wall charger and I wish I could charge the battery in the camera, but that is a minor issue compared to the ease of use and the image quality.

Reviews.Title: Love it, Love it, Love it!!!
Reviews.Author: JuJu
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It does what I want it to do.  I'm no professional, but sometimes this little camera makes my pictures look professional.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jenn P "Jenn P"
Reviews.Content: After returning a Lumix FH20 camera from Amazon because of blurry pics, I started my search again for a camera with CRISP CLEAR pics.  I new that in 2011 they had to be out there without spending a fortune on a point and shoot.  I was replacing an older Canon SD450 elf which was a great camera and I still have as well.  I finally resorted to going to Best Buy to pick up a camera as the online thing just took too long and I hate returning stuff.  I have to say I love this little camera!  At first I was worried it was too small for me, but after using it, I love it.  Just make sure you always use that wrist strap!  The pictures come out crystal clear, which is really all I wanted, and the indoor photos are spectacular.  I started out with photos of my two dogs, and the pet/child setting had flash and some of the pics came with red eye, so I turned off the flash, used the indoor setting the pics came out flawless.  The outdoor shots came out crystal clear and sharp as well.  The zoom takes some getting used to, but it's pretty easy.  I have to figure out how to use the neat settings where you only get one color in the pics and the rest black and white.  Such a neat feature.  This little gem blows away the Lumix I previously purchased.  If you want clear sharp pics every time you take a shot, try the SD1400is!  And the pink color is awesome too!

Reviews.Title: Manual switch from photo to video plus an extra "program" setting is awesome
Reviews.Author: EFS
Reviews.Content: I recently went shopping for a new digital camera for myself.  I'd previously been using a Minolta DiMage, but some screws had popped out requiring it to be held together with a rubber band.  It was time to get a new one.  What I hadn't realized is that most newer cameras require you to go into an on screen menu to switch from photo to video mode.  I first tried out a Kodak EasyShare thinking that the button with the camera/video picture next to it would just let you switch back and forth by just hitting the button again.  One afternoon of hitting the button, looking at the screen, using small buttons to scroll down one, hitting the select button, and then focusing the camera on what you wanted to photograph/snap a video of was just waaaaay too annoying.  And by the time I'd complete the switch the moment would have passed.  Also every time I turned the camera off to put it in my pocket, I'd have to go through the selection time again when I wanted to take another video.  So I took it back to the store, paid the 15% restocking fee, and then came home with a Canon Powershoot SD1400IS.All I knew about the Canon Powershoot SD1400IS was that 1) it had a manual button to switch between photo and video, and 2) it was on sale (close out).  I hadn't done much research.  I just wanted a camera that would be no hassle for taking pictures and videos of my two kids and for on trips.I couldn't be more pleased and believe that I've found *MY* camera.  It has all of the functions I could wish for in a small point and shoot camera.Pros1)  amazingly small - smaller than my iPod touch2)  intuitive, if necessarily small, switches3)  manual switch goes up and down (not a twist knob) and has three positions:  photo, program, video with the auto photo and video options being at the two extremes, making it easy to switch between the two without looking.4)  microphone on the video seems to have the right level of sensitivity -- not much residual hissing, and yet it seems to pick up voices easily from about 20 feet away (the Kodak EasyShare would only pick up extremely loud noises or those within about 5 feet of the camera).5)  photo quality is fine - decent flash and low and bright light6)  The view screen is surprisingly bright even in bright light7)  Battery charger is small and plugs into the wall flush -- I like this option vs. plugging the camera in and having the battery charge in the camera, since I'm one who likes to have a spare battery charging so that I can swap them out.  And I hate long cords on charging stuff -- they get tangled.8)  The best part is the program switch.  You can set it up to do all sorts of odd things - fish eye, multiple shots by just holding down the button, focusing in on only one color (you focus, say, on a red t-shirt and then any shots you take will show only the red things in color and the rest go to black and white -- you can also do this with your video...), and more.  Once you've programmed it, it'll stay with those settings until you program it to do something else -- even if you've turned off the camera in the meantime.  And you can always just switch it over to auto to take "normal" photos and then back to program and take the "funny" ones.Cons1) I'd love to have been able to get one in candy-apple green.  I'd have preferred a brighter color to make it easier to find since it is so small and my favorite color is green.  (Hot pink was also available on sale when I bought mine, but I'm just not a fuchsia kind of girl).2)  If you have thick fingers, you will not likely enjoy the size of the camera or its buttons.3)  The A/V out has a stiff cover that doesn't open all the way, so it's awkward plugging in the cord to download your pics

Reviews.Title: it's ok but not amazing.
Reviews.Author: QF Jane
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little point & shoot.  If I didn't have anything else to compare it to I might really like it.But [unfortunately for me] a family member has a Canon PowerShot SD1200IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Dark Gray) that I have used many times.  It's basically what I was hoping for with this newer edition.  However, the sd1200is far outshines the sd1400 as far as speed, pic quality, options, usability, etc.I now have the sd1400is, I'll keep it, but am just not overly impressed.  I agree with many reviews that I have read -- Canon quality is not what it was even a few years ago.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: Rahul Tyagi
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for about a week and am so far very pleased with the results.  Due to its 14.1 MP image the file size is between 2.5 and 3.0 MB so make sure you get at least a 4 GB SD card to store your photos and videos.  The night and low light shots are excellent as the flash literally lights up the entire background.  The camera feels a little small to hold and will need some getting used to.  Also the card/battery door appears a little flimsy but only time will tell how it holds up.  The LCD screen is nice and I especially like the feature in which the camera detects and zooms in on a face.  Haven't tried the HDMI output yet but the videos I transferred to the PC left me more than satisfied.  Overall, a great camera for the price and I would recommend this for anyone who is not into very serious photography.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Alexander Chemerys
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my wife to keep in her purse to always have a camera on hand.  My reviews are always short but to the point.  It is light, thin and takes excellent pictures.  The charging doc is better than others. just a quick fold.  love it.  I bought a hard case to go with it so that it doesn't get scratched.  Have had it for about 8 months now. Always ready and has been used for some great pix and video.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera!!
Reviews.Author: NYSKIBUM
Reviews.Content: I have a Canon EOS T2i and purchased the Canon PowerShot SD1400IS as a simple "in your pocket" type camera when I did not feel like lugging around my more robust camera. This camera has really been handy when going skiing as I can easliy pull it out of my jacket to snap a few pictures and do not have to carry a backpack as I do with my DSLR. And the camera is CRAZY small but packs a punch image quality wise. Lots of cool features that let someone like me who likes to play with the settings a level of creativity.Overall a fantastic camera for the price and takes very good clear pictures. If you need an "on the go" camera and do not want to spend over $200....this is the one to buy!

Reviews.Title: Granny's new Canon SD1400IS from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Granny Lu
Reviews.Content: This is our second canon power shot camera.  I liked the first one but the clarity of this one is even better than the previous model.  I really like the kids/pet setting which makes it easier to get pictures of my grand-kids. The whole camera is small and lite-weight. The buttons are very small and I am having to get used to them.  Otherwise, I like it and would recommend it for those who want lite-weight, easy to use, sharp pictures from a point and shoot camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: Pluses:Great camera for the price.Easy to take anywhere.Stellar photos, especially if you JUST KEEP IT ON THE VIVID setting. Honestly, DO THIS.Easy to transfer to computer.Very decent low-light photos despite what other reviewers say.Lots of options for individually preferred settings; explore beyond the "automatic" setting and you will find this camera does quite a lot.No. 1 on a lot of lists of "best cameras" in this price range.Minuses:Half a second lag time between when you take the photo and when it actually snaps.It would be nice if it had one of those reverse screens where you can see yourself while taking a photo, ala Facebook shots, but that's rare to find on any camera of this quality.Had to buy a memory card separately.Worth noting:See "Vivid Setting" note above.Buy memory card at the same time, again, see note above.Don't like hot pink? It also comes in Black and Orange and maybe Silver, I forget.Buy an extra battery so you're never caught without. Each battery is good for about 250 photos.A professional rock 'n' roll photographer recommended this camera to me. He uses one for his around town, everyday shots.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: brookec
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to take with me on a trip to Disneyland.  My Canon Rebel XSi seemed too big to be carrying around, combined with a lens (17-55mm f2.8, 70-200 f4L...) it would have been cumbersome.  I needed something compact and this camera was a great choice.  For a point and shoot it takes fantastic photos.  I left it on auto mode for the entire trip, and while some shots were blurred (due to quick movement, no fault of camera) I'd say the image quality was better than I anticipated. It's a bit hard to handle and I did drop it twice, thankfully with no damage less a few scratches.  Perhaps I am too used to my XSi with a battery grip? ;-)  Overall, this camera suits my needs perfectly and I will be using anytime my SLR is not appropriate.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've Ever Owned!
Reviews.Author: ElleBelle
Reviews.Content: This is by far, the best camera I've ever owned! This camera was to replace a Sony Cybershot that I really liked but broke. The pictures from this camera come out clear and vivid! With my old Sony, my pictures would sometimes appear a bit fuzzy or not as clear when I would display them on a big screen. With the SD1400IS, the pictures are amazing and some people comment that they look like HD. There are so many great options to use also. Most of the time, I just leave it on AUTO which does all the work of finding the perfect mode for you. My favorite special feature is the color-picker mode which picks one color to accent and makes the rest of the photo black and white. The only thing about the camera that is a little different to me is the macro setting. With my old sony, the macro took really sharp close-ups. This camera takes macro pictures, but just not as sharp as the sony.Overall, the Canon SD1400IS was the best electronic investment I've ever made!

Reviews.Title: This camera packs a punch!
Reviews.Author: Visionary
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera!Ok so ill tell you my little story as to why I chose this camera out of all of the other ones.So originally I wanted just a camcorder just to do reviews on some products for Youtube and to send videos to my brother who's serving over seas.  Well that quickly changed when I came across a CTFXC (Charles Trippy) video log.  I absolutely loved the video quality in his videos and I wanted to know what camcorder he had.  I was shocked to find out he was using a Cannon Powershot CAMERA!  I had no idea that a small powershot could make anything you film look so crisp and clear.  I was browsing around the market just for a camcorder but when I saw this baby... and boy my mind changed quick.  My first intention was to buy something like the flip hd or a sony bloggie, but after I saw some of the quality of the videos I was displeased.  Now Charles Trippy (youtube user) actually used a different powershot (I forgot which one) but they all have great video quality. So after watching a lot of vlogs (video logs) I decided to go a head and buy one of these powershots.  Now here are the Pros that this camera has.1. The price for a durable camera/camcorder. I actually bought mine for $125 off of amazon. :P2. The 14.1 MP.  Yes I know that there are other cameras that have a higher MP but i'm not using this camera just for picture taking which is why it doesn't matter to me.3. The size of the camera.  This puppy is SMALL in size and weight.  There are times where Ive put it in my pocket and forgot it was even there!4. Durability.  This thing is pretty durable to me.  Ive dropped it a couple of times and no scratches or marks on it.5. Shutter time.  This thing can take pictures pretty fast.6. Ease of use.  This is very easy to use and have no trouble what so ever.7. Video quality.  Man this is the reason why I wanted this camera and all I can say is im completely blown away at what this little camera can do.8. This camera does take good pictures as well.9. I love the sound quality on this camera!10. The color distinction is great.  Now the cons.1. The little plastic cover on the corner (the cover for the connectors) seems very fragile.2. Every now and then it bugs out when trying to take a picture in macro mode in sunlight.3. The zoom rocker can be pretty loud when taking a video but it doesn't bother me much.4. Sometimes after taking one macro photo it'll switch back to normal mode.  It doesn't bother me too much but I hate taking another photo expecting it to be a macro and it isn't.5. This is more personal, as I wish it had more settings to toggle with.Overall I give this camera 5 stars even with the 5 cons I have with it.I strongly recommend this powershot if you need a point and shoot camera!Ive had mine for three months and i'm loving every time I use it.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Miller
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a second camera, for when we didn't want to carry around a larger one.  It's a very nice little camera.  It takes good pictures and crams a lot of functionality into a tiny little package.  It can be a little confusing to learn all of the functions.  Canon does not include a printed copy of the manual.  You get a printed quick start guide, but the manual is a PDF file.  The full manual is on the CD that is included, but it would have been better to include a printed manual.You do want to read the full user guide.  Otherwise you'll miss out on all of the features available on this camera.  Like blink detection, slow synchro, how to reset the settinga back to default, camera effects, etc. The smile detection feature is great for taking snapshots of small children.The HD video quality is OK.  It's great in a pinch, but it's not going to replace a dedicated video camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Canon always has good products and they have done it again.You get a lot of camera for the money. Well worth it

Reviews.Title: My Disneyland camera
Reviews.Author: Tom W. Peterson "Sneakers"
Reviews.Content: I call this my Disneyland camera because of the "in my pocket" size. Very compact and better than my iPhone camera.It's not anywhere near my Canon t2i  DSLR quality, but the fact I can zoom in and out fast, and that it fits in my pocket ismy reason for buying this...............PS: don't be in a hurry to get any continuous shots, it's on the slow side shot to shot.

Reviews.Title: camera-on-the-spot
Reviews.Author: David "Geothermal"
Reviews.Content: Like many Canon or Nikon owners, I have a DSLR for serious pictures. What I wanted was something small, always in my jacket and ready to email. Also, if it breaks I needn't worry  about repair....just buy a new updated model.  The SD1400 is exactly what I wanted for under $200. What's the beef with some buyers?  It's like comparing the Sizzler with Morton's Steak House.

Reviews.Title: another great Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Amazonian101
Reviews.Content: Bought to replace 1st generation digital Canon (which still works great), as a Christmas present for my husband.  He loves it!.  It is so small that it fits in a pocket easily.  Nice to take with you while Nordic skiing.

Reviews.Title: A Great Point and Shoot from Canon
Reviews.Author: katieknoch
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera from Canon. I had actually owned the previous model and lost it within a of owning it, which just broke my heart. As a quick replacement, I purchased a Samsung that I ended up being incredibly disappointed with. As Christmas rolled around, I decided to replace the Samsung with the camera that I really wanted, which was this Canon. It has not let me down. I keep it in a case in my purse so it is always with me to capture the moment. A few photos have come out blurry but for the most part, every picture has been flawless.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: John Blomquist
Reviews.Content: My wife loves the small size and pink color of the camera.  We both have been pleased with this order.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: mom
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for our daughter for Christmas.  We love Cannon PowerShot cameras.  I have an older version, my older daughter has a newer version and now my other daughter has this newer version.  Takes great pictures.  My daughter loves it, just as we all do.  Awesome cameras.........

Reviews.Title: Great camera in a small package.
Reviews.Author: D. Davenport
Reviews.Content: Lots of features in a small package. Shutter speed is excellent (the main reason I purchased this camera). Better than I had hope it would be. I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Starter camera
Reviews.Author: Valerie Oz
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my mom as a first digital camera.  Small size, about the size of a cell phone, and easy to just pick up and use.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for a great price
Reviews.Author: Laney Bright
Reviews.Content: Great camera! Takes great photos and have a an ability to take multiple shots fairly quickly one after the other. The features are great. I bought it for the size, and feel like I got my moneys worth, if not more. A great point and shoot camera, that is easy to use. Great for anyone wanting a simple camera or one with intermediate level features.

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Andres E
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent camera. i have compared with other compact camera and this is the most easy to use and the better features.

Reviews.Title: No more sony cameras-canon rocks
Reviews.Author: jllo19970
Reviews.Content: I have been buying Sony CyberShots for a few years and borrowed a friends canon 1400 and was shocked by the improved difference in quality of pictures...I ended up buying my own canon sd1400 IS.  Great, sleek camera that takes excellent pictures.  The only downside is the door that needs to be popped open to access the plug to download photos's is a little strange.  Other, than this...highly recommend it for the price... go to wal-mart though...it is only $150 instead of at target and amazon.  cheers.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: krissymiss
Reviews.Content: I have had this Canon Power Shot SD 1400 IS for a little over a month now & have taken many pictures over the holidays.
