I am very pleased with the photo quality, the pictures are always very clear.  The only thing I'm not 100% satisfied with is the shutter speed, but in researching I did find that I can adjust this.  I'm still "playing" with the different settings, but am very pleased with the auto mode. This is an awesome camera for the price & it's a great starter for someone wanting to dabble in photography.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: C. Norris "afishionado"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera to replace a Sony point and shoot that disappeared (one of the only downsides to having a small camera).  I am very pleased with this camera, especially compared to the Sony.  Minimal delay once the shutter is pressed, especially in comparison.  The features are very easy to use, and taking HD video is just as easy as taking regular pictures.  The camera is so small that it easily fits in my pocket.  I also have a iphone that takes great pictures, but does not have the same array of features.  I always have my phone with me, so it is readily available, but does not have the same range of capabilities of this camera.  I also have a Canon 7D that I love, but it is not a convenient walk-around camera like this one.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Smiley
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING camera. My 20 year old is very picky and was thrilled with this gift and all its features.  Very versatile, compact and stylish. Its advanced features make it more than just a camera, but it is still easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Flint
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently went on a vacation with another couple. They brought this camera with them and it put ours to shame. The pictures were so detailed, the colors were so vivid, and the camera used natural lighting so well. I had recently been looking to upgrade our camera, and was starting to look at other models in the $300 to $400 range, figuring that's what I would need to spend to get some good quality pics. When I saw the pictures that this camera took, I realized I was wrong. First day back from vacation I jumped on to Amazon and ordered the camera. If you're looking to buy/replace a Point and Shoot camera then you can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Quite amazing
Reviews.Author: jPaulM
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my grandfather for Christmas. It weighs half what his old one did, and somehow manages to take better pictures and display them on a bigger screen. Even an old fella like him can figure this camera out, and he's loving it so far.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: jan
Reviews.Content: This item was a gift for my husband.  He really likes it, and finds that it is one of the easiest cameras he has ever owned.  The transaction was perfect, the product is perfect, and we are both very pleased with it.  Would order again from this seller.

Reviews.Title: Loves canon
Reviews.Author: Muhammad Ajmal
Reviews.Content: This is my second canon camera within  a year and so far I have great experince. The picture quality is great compare to other cameras. I had Nikon in the past but didn't like the picture at all.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: vamazon
Reviews.Content: Does what it's supposed to do at a great price. We are not pro photographers and rarely use any modes other than Auto. Both indoor (including low light) and outdoor pictures were great.Videos are not super quality, are somewhat grainy, but I have a Camcorder so no worries there.

Reviews.Title: Good and fashionable camera
Reviews.Author: Cin
Reviews.Content: The camera is good and I love its functions so much. The color is sharp that it is very fashionable. It is also really light and small that it is easy to carry around.The only problem is the buttons. They are too small to press. It would be easier to press the buttons if you have nails. The quality of the pictures taken by this camera is high. I can project the pictures on my 42" TV and enjoy the high-definition pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: cannon powershot 1400
Reviews.Author: Dorie Lustig
Reviews.Content: this is a wonderful camera-- small enought for a pocket-- takes great pics and easy to use once you read the directions-- has lots of capabilities!

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied with Camera
Reviews.Author: Austin Camera
Reviews.Content: This is my second Cannon camera and I am extremely satisfied with this one.  It is very easy to switch between camera and video mode; downloading to the computer is fast and easy; I have received several comments on the pink color - it's great!  The pictures and video are excellent.  I don't have any complaints so far over the quality.  My only comment would be the cover on the AV plug is tricky to open and get the plug in.  I also worry that it may fall off over time.  That's the only reason I rated the product 4 instead of 5.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: savvy shopper
Reviews.Content: Great product. Great clarity of pictures. User friendly. Didn't come with a card so you need one when you order or you can't take any pictures.

Reviews.Title: perfect for what she needs
Reviews.Author: Lynn Marie Hunter
Reviews.Content: My daughter had this exact camera...but, recently dropped it in the atlantic ocean...while on vaca to savannahgeorgia.  :( this is the replacement... the exact camera.she loves it ! It works perfectly for her needs. She is 19 and has quite an eye for photography.At a later date...we will invest in something a bit more fancy...but, for now? its great. (atlantic ocean incident also tells me shes not quite ready for anything a bit more fancy)  :)Give it a try. easy to use.... and great shots.thanks amazon and seller !~

Reviews.Title: Canon SD 1400 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Edgar G. Underwood "Underdog"
Reviews.Content: Excellent small camera.  It is so small that it is easy for your finger to cover the flash on the front.

Reviews.Title: Prefect camera for a girlfriend gift
Reviews.Author: Zac90k
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in black for christmas for my girlfriend and she loves it. its extremely small and "cute" takes great shots of people. very good and not technical so its perfect for someone who doesn't really mess with advance settings and stuff. would highly recommend as a gift for a girlfriend or mom or anybody really.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Wesmann
Reviews.Content: Easy camera to operate. Pictures come out nicely as the camera seems to adjust to different light situations well. Camera is a good value although there may be other options available that are priced slighty better. Only gripe, and this comes from my family members is that the circle buttons on the back are hard to operate.  Would recommend this camera

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Kelli Stott
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera because we were taking a mini-vacation, and needed a new camera.  Not only does this camera take great pictures in low-light (we went to a concert and the quality of the pictures was amazing--even from far away)but also takes great pics outdoors/indoors in regular light as well.  I am not a camera guru, so I wanted something that didn't require an additional degree to operate.  This camera takes high-quality pictures without being overly complicated.  We are very happy with our purchase!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: L. Day
Reviews.Content: Santa got this for my daughter. It's very thin, nice looking, easy to figure out and takes amazingly good shots. A big step up from my old point-and-shoot; not the caliber of my SLR, but I wouldn't expect that. Does quite well in lower light. A great value. Canon always made a good camera and this one doesn't disappoint--and it's so inexpensive there's practically no risk in buying one.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Delime
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an affordable camera that would easily fit in my purse or even my pocket and this is it.  I love everything about it, from the color to the size to all the features.  The camera is no bigger than my cell phone yet it is very high quality.  And believe me, I did my research when it came to which brand of camera to buy and everything I read said Canon was the best, and it's true.  Not only was it affordable but it had all the features we wanted, and some extras; it has the large LCD screen, the smile detection, wink detection, color accenting, panaromic shooting, video recording and so much more.  I'd recommend this to anyone who's looking for a high quality camera without paying the high price.  It's great for your average picture taker, like me!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael Grimes "Jesus Freak"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our daughter and it's been a gem.  Very intuitive with great features.  Great photo quality.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera when it was on sale for a substantial discount.  We have owned Canons for many years and they always perform well as does this one.  Excellent clarity, easy to use but the buttons are a little small for bigger hands.  That is really the only drawback to this camera.  I would recommend it for anyone looking for a good point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Brett D Stoler
Reviews.Content: For such a small camera it is packed with the features of my larger SLR camera.  We bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she has not put it down since.  The compact size is great because we can take it with us for times when we want quality pictures but do not want to take our larger camera.

Reviews.Title: Good solid camera
Reviews.Author: Jelly Donut
Reviews.Content: I've only used this camera for a few days but I really like the auto mode and how easy it is to take pictures. I'm a little disappointed in the shutter speed as it is slower than expected. Otherwise, this camera is a thin, beautiful piece of work. I was originally going to get the Canon SD780 but then I saw how thin this one was and really wanted to get it.

Reviews.Title: I wanted to like it but...
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: We have a Canon SD 600 that's about 4-5 years old and the images that come out of the SD 1400 look the same as the camera we already have!  The low light performance is horrible with lots of noise.  Pretty much with every picture you need to use the flash to keep the noise down in anything but bright day light which makes the pictures look really fake.  There are tons of options to play with and we did have a couple laughs with the fish eye setting but that wasn't enough to justify the money spent on this.  I bought this for my wife as a Christmas gift and after about 5 or so hours playing with it she got frustrated.  I decided to do side by side comparisons with the SD 1400 and our old SD 600 and believe it or not they were the same clarity wise.  The colors on the 1400 were a little more vibrant i'll give it that but I/we fully expected more. We have a baby on the way so the idea was to get something for the wife to capture the special moments that we really couldn't get with our older camera but after testing the 1400 on multiple subjects in various lighting the conclusion was what a waste of money if we kept it.  I generally don't write reviews but this camera was such a let down I felt I had to say something.  I did give it a couple stars since the screen is nice and all the built in functions were cool but that's about it sorry.

Reviews.Title: Battery Cover Falls Off
Reviews.Author: Michael F. Herman "mig"
Reviews.Content: Hey, this is a nice camera, but the battery cover fell off of it within 10 seconds of unwrapping it from under the Christmas tree.  What gives Canon?  I already had an older Canon Powershot and wanted another one.  This really upset me.  I like the camera, but should not be gluing parts of it back on the first day.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: JoeyBoots
Reviews.Content: I like it. Images of the camera on Amazon just didn't prepare me for how small the thing is though. I'm 6'2" and my hands dwarf this thing. When I shoot with two hands, its quite easy to block the flash with one of the fingers on my left hand. I've grown accustomed to using it one handed as a result. I can easily have one finger on the zoom slider and another on the shutter button. Regardless of how I hold it though, I'm sure to have the my hand through the strap. I've already fumbled and caught it twice, I wouldn't want it to hit the ground with that big screen on the back.It shoots HD video very well and I was pleased to find the small end of an HDMI cable I already have fits the camera. The little flap that covers the USB and HDMI ports is kind of annoying. I've never liked those kinds of covers. Its a piece of hard plastic with a flexible anchor that goes into the camera. The cover snaps in place and the fit is pretty seamless, but you have to bend it uncomfortably far to use the HDMI port. These kinds of small covers are common on cell phones and I see them broken all the time. I've never actually broken one myself, but I can see that being a possibility with the stress it'll go through from using the HDMI port. The location of the mini USB port, which will be used much more often, isn't as much of a concern, though.All of the buttons are tiny but not too much of a concern and, given the form factor, its to be expected. I've yet to make a mistaken button press. The zoom seems to operate too quickly though.Pictures are generally great. Its easy to get blurry images if you rush the auto focus though. All in all, its a decent little point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: So nice, I bought it TWICE!!!
Reviews.Author: OptimusPrime1906
Reviews.Content: This is simply the best camera I've ever had.  I look for point and shoot cameras that take great pictures and are compact enough to slip in my pocket.  This one definitely fit the profile.  I lost it the first time on a trip to Vegas (go figure lol).  I liked it so much I purchased the exact same one.  Takes great pictures and the widescreen feature is amazing!  It also has a feature where you can select one color to show up in the picture, and the rest of the picture to be black and white.  The orange color is stylish and very distinctive.  I've recommended this camera to ALL MY FRIENDS!  Three of them have purchased it so far and love it as well!Pros: EVERYTHINGCons: I wouldn't say it's a con, but the zoom button is a bit different compared to many cameras.  Rather than a dial or a button, it's more of a lever.  Again, not necessarily bad, but different.

Reviews.Title: lovely little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from an older elph and I prefer this one immensely, someone sat down and made smart improvements. Notably: you can see how much battery you have left & you can tell how many remaining photos you have space for according to different photo sizes. And it's an elph so it takes great photos. It's small and beautiful. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: A. Sayre "lone ranger"
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I wanted a waterproof case for SCUBA diving and figured I should upgrade to a new camera first. This was a replacement for the SD1000I love this camera, it's extremely portable and takes great pictures. I got a LowePro Santiago 20 case for it and the camera fits in it with plenty of room for extra memory cards and even a wrist strap.So far I have been very happy with the pictures although with the weather being terrible I haven't taken it outside yet.I would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a nice point and shoot at a reasonable price. I don't expect this camera to be perfect 100% of the time, but I do know that 99% of the blurry pictures it takes will be because of my error, not the camera's.

Reviews.Title: canon continues to impress
Reviews.Author: vp pilot
Reviews.Content: All of my cameras I use on my trips are canon so I can interchange the batteries. Very happy with this camera. Low light and image stabilization are outstanding. Oh yes, pictures are great .......

Reviews.Title: Mini Camera - Good Photos If You Work Hard
Reviews.Author: Alan  Houston
Reviews.Content: I like to have a camera with me all of the time, and I'm not satisfied with the quality of photos from a phone camera.  The SD1400 is the size of a deck of cards, and light enough that it can sit in a bag clipped to your belt all day without being noticed.  Although the SD1400 will fit into your jean's pocket, do NOT keep it in a pocket.  The lens drive is VERY fragile and can be damaged by pressure or a bit of dirt or grit.  It is a delicate precision instrument...keep it in a well padded bag when it is not in your hand.The "auto" mode on this camera does not work well.  It often selects too high an ISO and the selects the wrong focus point, and it over exposes photos.  The result is grainy photos that are in soft focus with washed out colors.Put the camera in "Program mode" and "lock" the ISO at ISO 200 or 100 for best results.  Use the "center" focus mode and select the primary subject and lock the focus before composing the photo.  Set exposure at minus 1/3 stop to get richer, warmer colors.The very small flash works best with the primary subject at a distance of three feet to seven feet and ISO locked at ISO 200.If you are using the flash heavily, the battery will last less than 200 photos.  If you take more than 200 photos per day, consider buying a backup battery.  The battery charger is tiny, so it is easy to bring it along on trips.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great features, great quality
Reviews.Author: T. Currens
Reviews.Content: This camera is very lightweight, easy to carry in your pocket. Shoots quickly, which is a must for me, and the opposite of the last Canon I bought just months before this one. LCD screen is amazing, the quality is good and it takes far less blurry pics. I would say I had a 7.1 megapixel Canon that shot quicker, far fewer blurry pics than any of the newer models, but this one is still very good. Lots of great picture shooting modes, which are great for getting creative with some shots on the fly. It's sharp looking, zoom is decent. Definitely recommend this camera for any amateur that likes to take pictures and wants a decent camera.

Reviews.Title: Slim and Portable
Reviews.Author: Kasey G. Nguyen "kaseyn617"
Reviews.Content: Good buy. The camera is slim, light and easy to use. I bought it for portability, look and features, especially HDMI connectivity.

Reviews.Title: So far so good! :)
Reviews.Author: allyghee "AM"
Reviews.Content: Well,I have just had this comera for about 1hr before this review and i must say the pictures taken so far are very impressive. The camera is easy to use the menu's are just straight foward and intuitive. I just changed the setting to auto and hola! i started taking excellent pictures. the pictures hardly blur out too.Also, i was very suprised at the size fof the camera because its acually smaller than what i exprected. I will update this review with anything useful i find out later but simply put, i am very happy with my purchase.After about a month with the new camera, i am very pleased with the picture quality. However, i found it a little bit difficult adjusting the size of the pictures. Figured that out later and the hard way (i did not read the manual).All in all, the camera is excellent.PSi bought an extra battery just in case the one that ships with the camera runs out of juice. I also got a nice case logic carry case and a 8GB kingston memory card.I also need to mention amazons impressive delivery.Hope you enjoy your purchase too.

Reviews.Title: VERY good quality especially for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Oh
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a high quality camera at an affordable price. There was a review I came across that said something like: takes pictures like a $500 camera. It's pretty darn close to that description! The Canon Powershot SD1400 offers a wide variety of features, including my favorite (drumroll please) the Macro. Lots of light settings and options!! I'm so happy :)

Reviews.Title: couldn't be happier for $200
Reviews.Author: Kenzie
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to spend more than $200 on a camera and this one is great. The picture quality is great, up close detail was awesome for showing texture and colors, and the auto setting makes things really easy!

Reviews.Title: Fragile camera
Reviews.Author: Lola
Reviews.Content: Camera is super fragile! Haven't had it for 6 months and it's already broken. A little bit of water got on it at a pool party in Vegas, and the camera is rendered completely useless. I had a Nikon previously that my friend completely dropped into a bowl of alcohol...it SURVIVED. WIth my luck, my next camera purchase will be a waterproof one.If you don't plan to use it anywhere near water, then this camera is perfect. It's super tiny, the color is gorgeous and vibrant, the screen is huge and it does everything I ask for. Pictures are so sharp and clear and the video quality is good for a camera like this (though of course, slightly grainy when you put it on the big screen). Thing I loved the most about this camera is the battery life. I can use it to take several hundred pictures over the course of a few days, only on one charge. I don't know how they do it!

Reviews.Title: excellent camera!!!
Reviews.Author: FRANCISCO ARZATE
Reviews.Content: I'm really satisfied with this camera, i like the sharpness of the pictures on the screen, is amazing. It is not so complicated to use if you follow directions. The only thing is that Im afraid to drop it because is so small and you have to use your pinky finger to hit the little buttons. The battery lasts for at least a week even if it is turned off. I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "lupchong"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera as a replacement for an older casio camera.  Easy to operate and navigate through the menu options.  Picture quality is good and sharp.  Price on Amazon is about $30 less than you can get it in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: Super slim, stylish camera that works!
Reviews.Author: Kingmonkey
Reviews.Content: This is THE slimmest and one of THE stylish cameras I have ever bought; I usually buy Sony and they are usually stylish too. My Sony I bought in 2006 is about 1/2" thicker in width) so you can imagine how much smaller and compact this Canon is. The ease of set up and use is excellent, in 10 minutes I was done setting it up and ready to take photos, the image quality is excellent. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Very Handy, excellent choice for most occasions
Reviews.Author: Fullbrigades
Reviews.Content: I must confess that I am not an expert. I would consider myself just something more than entry level Point and shoot..I already have a canon powershot SX20IS which I am pretty happy about. However, I wanted something lightweight that I can carry with me all the time, almost like a phone.Used it for a trip outdoors. My friend has an old SLR which I kind of used to compare my photos with.Pros: Very very handy. In fact, I bought a cell phone holder to hook it up to my belt as the camera bags, even the smallest pouch was too big. This itself is worth buying this gizmo. Photo qualities are excellent over various light conditions. Obviously, as light falls down, outdoor shots outside the range of the flash do not come out very well. There is a auto mode and then there is a video HD mode, pretty standard. The manual mode allows various standard options.  Tried almost all options, the photos looked almost identical to my untrained eye. Even long range shots came out very well.Battery life decent, however, annoyingly, the transition from half full indicator to almost empty was very quick..My friends were uniformly impressed by its looks and performance too, it's that petite.Cons: 4 x zoom, may not be enough for some.Hardcore geeks may find the options limitedOn the whole, very very happy with this purchase. Definitely recommend it for entry level customers and more. Often find the reviews for cameras very technical and detailed. Please consider this review as coming from a lay person, who just wants decent shots without spending thousands of dollars on lenses or carrying them around instead of enjoying the trip.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal!!
Reviews.Author: Nursing student
Reviews.Content: I am so impressed with this camera!! Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good deal!!

Reviews.Title: best point&shoot;/ pocket camera
Reviews.Author: angelheart
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Pink)It really was everything I hoped this camera would be. It's both portable and functional! I've researched for about a month reading reviews after reviews before I decided on this camera. It was actually between its sister in the SD series :Canon SD980IS. One of the reasons I picked this instead of the other is because it was just simple to use. If you've ever had a canon camera it was a no-brainer. This Canon SD1400 gave me crisp shots of pictures where I can zoom in to even my frickles ( I sometimes did not like--haha). Another quality was its battery life; It had not failed me during my trips to the beach. Don't forget the vibrant color of the camera itself! But if pink is not one of the colors you like, you might not love this camera as much as I do.In conclusion, I absolutely love this camera for its looks, functions, and also the quality of the pictures. Many people say that there's no need for a high megapixel camera, but I say: "if you can captured an amazing billboard going 85 MPH on the other side of the road, why not get a great camera for the great price"

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: J. Corbett
Reviews.Content: This is the first digital camera I have ever owned.  After years of Polaroid 600 film, I thought it would be time to purchase something a little more cost effective.  I did weeks of research and wanted to keep my price range within $200.00 - $300.00.My wish list:1. High resolution2. Easy to use with an auto feature3. Possible HD video recording4. LightweightThis camera is everything and more.  Because I'm still working out the settings, I basically use everything in auto mode.  There are enough feature on here to confuse someone who knows absolutely nothing about digital photography.My only minor complaint is that on auto, the pictures it takes during night aren't very good.  This could be easily resolved if I look up the different settings for taking better night time pictures.  I want to use this while I go on road trips and watch bands play, so it has to do well at night.It states that it has 14.1 MP, and I believe it.  I took a picture of myself, and I was disappointed.  The camera did so well that I could see every blemish, pore, and freckle.  It was amazing.If you need something that is compact, takes amazing pictures, and continually delivers great features, this is a camera for you.  The great part of this camera is the functionality and the ease of use.  You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: get it in red
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: i always had cannon cameras and i love this one.picture taking is fast.picture quality is great. small and fits anywhere

Reviews.Title: Great compact Canon camera
Reviews.Author: J. Perovich
Reviews.Content: I have always used Canon cameras- loved them all and this one is no exception. I love the color of the camera, image quality, ease of use, and best of all the HD movie function. The cameras image quality is very good and has good low light performance with the added bonus of the Image Stabilization. The startup time is fast, and time from shot to shot is fast as well. The camera is easy to use, but the smaller buttons take some getting used to. In addition, I find myself holding the camera a little awkwardly because of my big hands and the cameras small size- but I chose a small camera! Overall, great!

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, is really small, and have great quality pics and also the HD video works great....

Reviews.Title: Many Features but lacks Pocket User Guide
Reviews.Author: P. J. Murray
Reviews.Content: I have had 3 Canon Point and shoot cameras before.  My last camera was a SD630 and broke when is was dropped.I ordered the Canon SD1400IS based on Consumer Reports review.  The camera has many more functions than the Sd630.With so mant functions,  I need to refer to the User Guide for instructions on how to set up the features.The bad news is the 170 page user guide is in pdf format and you need a computer handy to read the guide.You can print it but it is 170 pagers in 8 x 10 pages.  I don't carry a PC on vacation and absolutelywill not carry 170 8x10 pages either.  What is the use of making a very small camera but have the UG so large?I understand Canon is cutting costs but had I known about the lack of handy pocket user guide, I would havechosen another model or brand.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, nice pics
Reviews.Author: J.M.
Reviews.Content: This camera was perfect for taking on vacation, it fit right in my pocket, or when in the case, it was attached to my belt.  I was able to take it everywhere, and the pics are very nice, the zoom works well, particularly up to 4X, but gets slightly grainy after that.  Very nice camera for the price, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Review
Reviews.Author: Andre G. De Cruz
Reviews.Content: Great Point & Shoot! Clear pictures, great flash, awesome display screen. Great portable camera as an addition to my Canon DSLR.

Reviews.Title: just right
Reviews.Author: P. Perez
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a slim but feature rich quality camera. I have had canon's in the past but wanted to try something different. At first I bought a Samsung but it proved to be a bit too bulky. So far we love the canon my only complaint is that sometimes when shooting video it goes out of focus. no idea why.

Reviews.Title: I love the camera
Reviews.Author: Roberta K. Maher
Reviews.Content: This is my second Cannon and I love the product. Takes wonderful photos, the zoom does a nice job.  I only wish it had a viewfinder.  When the sun is really bright it is difficult to see the screen sometimes.

Reviews.Title: So far it's great
Reviews.Author: Clicker "Am Photog"
Reviews.Content: I lost my SD1100 in Vegas and needed a replacement.  The main problem with the SD1100, which I basically loved, was that some pictures were grainy when I cropped them -- a MP problem.  The 14 MP of the SD1400 virtually eliminates this issue for my purposes.  The camera is also quite small and lite making it a go anywhere, any pocket, camera.  It focuses well in good light but takes just a little coaxing in lower light.  Not unlike the SD1100.  Good screen size.  I also like the push-button toggle from view to shoot.  I'm still learning all the features but am quite happy so far.  Some might not like the lack of a view-finder but I never used it on my SD1100 (used the screen) so I don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: great little camera and takes super shots
Reviews.Author: Louise Olson "Weasie Olson"
Reviews.Content: so far I am glad I got this camera  very small great shots have thoroughly enjoyed it....

Reviews.Title: You Won't Be Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Tony N "Tony"
Reviews.Content: I've owned my SD1400 for about a week now and have used it extensively. Overall, I'm very impressed. Low light capability is great and the macro shots I've done are clear and sharp. I'd recommend this camera to anyone looking for a high quality take everywhere camera. It is what it is, and if you shoot within it's capability you'll end up with some excellent quality images. I love it's small size and light weight. Sure beats dragging my 5D and a few pounds of glass around when I'm traveling light and shooting for fun.

Reviews.Title: CANON Does NOT Honor Warranty
Reviews.Author: Garth O. Bruen "KnujOn.com"
Reviews.Content: Avoid buying CANON cameras, especially this model. The LCD screen broke during normal use, apparently a known issue, and the lens motor also died within one year of purchase. We were quoted a zero-cost repair since the camera was less than a year old, and that the repaired camera would be returned in 7 days. Instead, two weeks later we received a bill for $136.00 for "labor charges." When we contacted the repair center they claimed the broken LCD was not covered by warranty yet they could not explain why it was billed as "labor charge." Their warranty is deceptive. We're going to replace this camera with a different brand and never buying CANON products again.

Reviews.Title: DISAPPOINTED TOO!
Reviews.Author: Nardsbaby "Connoisseur of the written word™"
Reviews.Content: This Canon was to replace a Canon I've had for a couple of years that was broken at the bachelorette party.  So the first thing was the memory card.  I shot a few photos and then I couldn't upload them to the computer.  Not a problem, cause a memory card can be replaced.  Okay so then I put a different memory card in, the screen fusses up and the memory card can't be read in the computer and I can't shut the camera OFF.  Go back to Best Buy, we try a new camera, and it's the same thing.  So glad that I've only had this camera two weeks.  I refuse to get stuck with some junk.  Wanted to stay with the Canon family, but I may be going to Nikon or back to Kodak.

Reviews.Title: awesome buy
Reviews.Author: lmz
Reviews.Content: Though I typically use my slr when taking pictures, I like to have a little point and shoot to keep in my pocket for the times I can't/ don't want to carry around my slr. I am pleasantly surprised by this camera. It was easy to learn how to use, and all of the functions are great. When looking for a small point and shoot definitely consider this one. If you have butter fingers beware- the camera is tiny and slippery. When I read that it was slippery on other reviews I didn't believe it until I got the camera in my hands. It really is slippery, and will slide out of your hand if you're not careful! But don't let that discourage you- this camera really is awesome.

Reviews.Title: CUTE SMALL AND PINK! COULD IT GET ANY BETTER?!
Reviews.Author: MaggieMoo
Reviews.Content: I just got my camera this week, but I already love it! My last camera was one of the first Nikon CoolPix and it was quite the downer! It wouldn't take pictures inside, at night, and only seemed to like to be on black and white. This camera is heaven compared to that one! It's small, it's pink, and it works! It's 1000x clearer than my other camera and is much more detailed. I was playing with it and taking pictures of my pets and they came out so great! This camera will be great for my major too, when going out and sourcing materials and furniture and just need some quick shots. As much as I want an SLR camera, this is great for every day and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Improves on everything but image quality...
Reviews.Author: T. Clark
Reviews.Content: I have had many of these Canon ELPH cameras and am a huge fan of them.  My most recent was the SD750 that we lost in a move.  If you don't believe me on the MP argument and market forces, just search Amazon.com for the SD750 and look what a camera I paid $200 for years ago costs today.  The new ones are in the $300 range (yes I undersand demand but that is in effect my point).The ELPH series has always been a great line of cameras in my opinion.  Having lost our SD750 and having a trip to Maui, we needed a new digital camera that would fit in a pocket.  I assumed that I could not go wrong with a Canon ELPH so I grabbed the SD1400 IS and took it straight to Maui.  We shot about 200 photos of the beach, restaurants, sailing trip, round of golf (including Kapalua Plantation).  I have taken older Canon ELPHs on many (many) trips and have always come home and enjoyed the pictures we have taken.  I have also enjoyed the Auto mode of those cameras.  Let me first say something positive.  The build quality of this camera may be the best I have seen from a Canon ELPH or any other point-and-shoot for that matter.  Very, very nice build quality.  However, early into using this SD1400 IS I saw that something was up with Auto mode as pictures in all sorts of situations just didn't look right... from color to lighting, etc.  It got to the point where I would take a picture in Auto mode AND then take in Program mode hoping for a good result from either.  It's like the camera was so smart it was trying to pick a "mode" in Auto yet the mode it chose was far from optimal. Far.With that said, I just reviewed about 200 photos from this camera from our trip to Maui and I would have to say I am highly unimpressed with the results in comparison to my old 3MP and 7MP Canon ELPHs.  I am very dissatisfied with what this camera produced. There are even pictures I took that looked amazing on the screen only to be OK-but-nothing-special when looked at on my Mac.  How do you make Kapalua look average?  If Canon wants to claim I have a defective unit and send me another one I would be more than glad to try again but at this point I just bit the bullet and bought the SD1300 IS hoping that 2 less megapixels will help.Like I said, I have always loved this line of cameras and I have never had to "work" to take great pictures.  Not only did I have to work to do so with this camera but even the results were less satisfying than what I am used to from a Canon ELPH product.  Canon needs to take their own advice like they are doing in  another line of cameras and exit the MP war and go back to what is important in a point-and-shoot.. easy and thoughtless picture taking with excellent image quality.

Reviews.Title: don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Daniel Head
Reviews.Content: I've now bought this camera twice and have had to send it back both times due to malfunctions within the first week. The features are great, but the problem is the quality of the camera is such crap that it can't withstand anything...including the shipping to get to me! When I bought this camera through Amazon this time, it arrived with punctures all over the front as if someone had hammered it, and the lens would not even open. The previous time it malfunctioned the first time I took it outside. My Aunt bought the same camera through Best Buy recently and also had to send it back the first time she took it outside, as the lens would not open any more.Good camera, but buy something else if you want to use it for longer than 1 day.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Bev
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas and have stopped using it, going back to my 5 year old 5MP camera.the LCD screen on the back has cracked and Canon won't repair it citing user damage.  I don't do anything unusual with my cameras, if it shouldn't go into my purse/pocket, it shouldn't be small enough to.  I haven't dropped it or anything that would be considered unusual use.Regardless of the body, the pictures are not the quality I would expect of a new camera, especially a Canon, you pay a good premium to use their cameras.  The Auto setting is horrible, the camera can't focus quick enough to catch most of his smiles before he's off doing something else.  The regialr setting is better, but now I'm constantly changing the program buttons.Really more of a pain than it's worth, buy a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Highly Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I am a professional portrait photographer. I use a Nikon D300 and D700 in my studio and for my outdoor sessions and shoot solely in Manual mode . I was in need of something for random everyday shots in my personal life. Having 2 kids I want to take pictures of them playing and what not. I had been using my professional cameras but it has become a hassle to tote around a 4 month old, her belongings AND a big bulky camera - Not to mention the extra shutter clicks I'm putting on my studio camera by taking a million and one pictures of my new baby!I did A LOT of research on Point and Shoots before purchasing this camera (at my local Best Buy). I am very very disappointed with the performance. I went Canon over Nikon because Canon P&S;'s are typically higher rated than Nikons. This camera seemed to pack a lot of neat little features into a pocket size device. As soon as I got to my vehicle after purchasing this camera I opened the box, threw the battery and memory card in and fired off a picture. It was VERY soft, not crisp or clear at all. I got home and played with it some more, taking a little over 100 images in different modes inside and outside my house. The outdoor images, taken without any zoom came out OK, once I started to zoom in they became very soft and dark. I adjusted the ISO, the exposure compensation and the setting and it didn't seem to help. Indoors - forget about it. The pictures are terrible, not only are they soft but the color is WAY off, not matter how many times I adjust the white balance or change the settings. The flash is just ridiculous, too. The red eye function barely even works, every shot I've taken I've had to edit out red eye. If there is the slightest bit of darkness or low light the flash automatically kicks on (when using Auto Flash). I had a little more luck shutting the flash off, bumping up the ISO and compensating the exposure +1 - however, doing this, again causes very soft pictures. I've taken a total of 400 images in 6 days on this camera and maybe one or two came out well. That's not a very good ration, in my opinion!I expected with a 14MP camera to be getting nice sharp clear images. I KNOW I'm not going to get the quality of what my DSLR's would produce, however, I was expecting better images from this camera than what the little camera on my iPhone takes! I'm seriously better off using my iPhone OR just lugging my DSLR around.I'll be returning this camera tomorrow for a full refund as I'm still within my 14 days and my research and hunt begins again!

Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations
Reviews.Author: J. Gross "Every picture tells a story"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon 1400IS as an upgrade from our "older" Canon and for an upcoming trip to Haiti.  I was extremely pleased with the images and video that I captured.  The Canon 1400IS is very easy to use and has great features i.e. Fish eye effect and recording in HD.The only negative comment I have is the poor quality of video when using the zoom feature.  Other than that, I highly recommend this and all Canon products.  I look forward to reliving my experience in Haiti with clear, vibrant photos!

Reviews.Title: Two Canon PowerShot SD1400IS cameras failed within two months of purchase
Reviews.Author: Kirkwall
Reviews.Content: I buy at least one or two compact cameras per year for my work which involves 6 months of international travel. Typically, I lose one camera per year, on rare occasions I have had a couple stolen or in the case of the Canon SD1400IS it's apparently poorly designed unit.I have been with Lumix (Panasonic)for my last 5 cameras (2 1/2 year) but a trusted salesman convinced me to go with Canon. The first SD1400IS I bought was in August, 2010 and lasted until September......software malfunction and would shut down unexpectedly. The second I bought as a replacement just before my China trip in October, 2010. I arrived in China October 12 and the camera worked well for about 10 days. I now get messages on the LCD that there is a malfunction and I have not been able to take an in focused since. The good news is my business partner carries a compact and we have been using his.Maybe I just happened to buy two bad SD1400IS's. I really don't know. I do know that this is the end of the line for me and Canon and will be buying a Lumix when I return to the US next week.

Reviews.Title: The Little Orange Camera that Could
Reviews.Author: Mark Soprano "fuggedaboudid"
Reviews.Content: During the first few weeks I got this for my wife, I felt like I made a mistake.I've been shooting with a Nikon D90 DSLR for a couple of years now, and once you go in that direction, any P&S; will pale in comparison.  In fact I believe most P&S; shooters are just a tad better than the shooter you find in your camera phone.  Through recommendations, I use a Panasonic LX3 as a sidekick, which is a huge disappointment if you are shooting kids in motion.  Still life and bright daylight scenery is fine, but LX3 really sucks at shooting living breathing subjects indoors.Because she needed one that would fit in her purse, or more truthfully, one that she wouldn't mind carrying for me in her purse on a daily basis, I picked the smallest Canon I could find at the time.  And this being freshly released then, and believing the specs, I bought one.The pictures as expected, were camera-phone like at first.  But after getting to know how or when to use it after several months, the photos now look passable and really not bad for such a tiny camera that's smaller than my iPhone.For the size, I must say the pictures are acceptable.  BUT what saves this thing from becoming a paper weight or doorstop, is the video.  Why buy those one-trick pony HD videocams bricks when you can shoot wonderful HD videos with this?  I think people tend to take this feature for granted, but I happen to believe VIDEO is this camera's saving grace.

Reviews.Title: Image quality hugely disappointing
Reviews.Author: JX
Reviews.Content: I have long been a fan of Canon products, with experience ranging from film camera to S50 to 5D. The image quality of my new SD1400 is just a huge let-down. Here I am not comparing it to Canon SLRs such as 5D. I am comparing the SD1400 photos to some snapshots I took many years ago with the old S50. The result is shockingly in favor of S50. Despite its much lower pixel sizes (5M) and ancient technology (in terms of digital camera), the S50 images look way better than those of SD1400, which is set at its highest picture size/quality and lowest ISO 80. And yes, I used tripod.With so many 5-star reviews on Amazon, it made me wonder maybe it is just my camera that is bad. But I am not going to bother to find out.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed by Image & Video Quality
Reviews.Author: Tiffany J. Morisue
Reviews.Content: First of all, I'm a professional photographer - I say that so those who read this review will know that I understand what a camera should do compared to its stated features.I purchased this camera right before Christmas as an "upgrade" to my Canon SD1000 (7.1 MP) that I purchased just over three years ago as a small point-and-shoot that I could just keep in my purse or pocket to have handy when out and about for personal snapshots (by no means for professional or artistic work).  I just loved my SD1000, but due to extensive use, it's having some intermittent problems with autofocus and image quality - still produces great images, just down to around 75% of the time.  I thought that the SD1400IS, after reviewing its specs and other reviews, would be a great upgrade/replacement.As for the issues with the SD1400IS that I experienced:** Images not always crisp - many slightly out of focus or worse (with IS, image stabilization, this should virtually not happen unless there is a little more than slight camera shake and I hold a non-IS pro camera that weighs considerably more and I don't have problems with out of focus images).** Many images "grainy", noted even at ISO 100 (should not be grainy at a low ISO with decent or better lighting)** Video pretty decent, but only in very good lighting.  In lighting that only a little low, the video looks pretty grainy.  I expected more for HD video.  My non-HD videos from my SD1000 are much better.** Illumination by the flash very limited - my SD1000 much better than the SD1400ISNow, I tried many of the modes and settings on the camera to make sure it was not a problem with one of them.  No difference in the issues noted.Maybe these issues were only with the SD1400IS that I tried out, though unlikely.  I returned it to the seller (Cameta Camera) via priority mail, insured, which cost me around $15.  I must say that they gave me no problems with the return (just followed the "return instructions" provided by Amazon) and they even refunded the shipping charge for getting it to me (not all sellers will do this).  So, one way to look at it is that I paid around $15 to try it out for a week.  I did get a few nice family snapshots and a few cute little videos of the kids.I absolutely love Canon.  I just think there are some issues with this particular model.  I would not hesitate to try out another one of models in the SD ("Digital Elf") line as the size is perfect (and the images great based on my SD1000 7.1 MP model).  I'm actually going to do so once I have a little extra time as I do want to upgrade and retire my SD1000.  Another series that's a little larger to try out is the Canon Powershot A series - I know people that have those and they produce very nice images.A few examples of non-snapshot images taken with my old Canon SD1000 (the one I want to upgrade from):[...] - abstract generated from shot taken with my SD1000[...] - panoramic landscape created from five shots taken with my SD1000Other images on my website are taken primarily with a Canon 40D (some with a Canon Rebel XT - I love the Rebel series for an affordable small digital SLR).One last word of advice - please try out more than the "full auto" mode when trying out a camera!  This way, you can identify problems you might not have otherwise known about and be able to return it within the seller's return period.  Also, you'll discover that you can take even better pictures!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing loss of faith with Canon
Reviews.Author: E. Vesey
Reviews.Content: This is the third Canon digital camera I've purchased.  Less than six months in my possession and it's shutting down with strange errors requiring restarts, and lately the viewfinder is completely black and takes black images, which is obviously USELESS.  If you google these symptoms you can find out that Canon is denying this issue, blaming the customer for "lint in their pockets," and is basically giving the proverbial finger to its loyal customers.  Guess I'll choose another brand.  So much for customer loyalty, Canon.  Once burned, twice shy.

Reviews.Title: DISAPPOINTED (will not purchase items from this seller again)
Reviews.Author: DeeGee
Reviews.Content: I received my camera just yesterday and was ecstatic as I had been waiting for it to arrive. When I opened the box I was so excited to use it and then noticed the charger was missing and so was the USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU. It was a red flag. Then I tried taking a very basic portrait picture and it was completely blurry. Another Flag. I attempted to fix the settings and the camera froze and said it was shutting down due to an error. I tried again and several times it said the same thing. I tried the zoom on the camera and it got stuck in the process. It also made a clicking noise during the zooming that was not suppose to be there. I must stress that this was all discovered seconds after I opened the package. When I bought this item, I knew I wasn't receiving a brand spanking new camera but when a product reads Good, you expect the basic functions to be good, or for the charger to come with your camera. I'm very disappointed. I will not purchase anymore items.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera. The esthetics are as sharp as any mini camera on the market. Both the orange and black look fantastic. It is also shockingly small. It is light but has a reassuring heft and solidity to it as well. When you first see it and pick it up, one can only be impressed by what seems to be a stunning engineering feat.Now, this is where things go downhill. I have medium sized hands. The buttons are tiny. They are frustratingly small, to the point where you are advised to use your fingernails rather than fingers to operate the tiny, recessed controls. The beauty of flushed controls gives way to the reality of fumbling with them when you actually want to operate the camera.Second, the picture quality, at least in moderate to low light situations, seems uniformly poor. I had pretty high hopes, since it is 14 mp, and has solid reviews on websites which have reviewed numerous cameras. Nonetheless, personally speaking, I am underwhelmed by picture quality. Even with what seems like an extremely powerful flash, moderate to low light photos wind up looking very washed out.The menu is a source of frustration as well. Part of this as I mentioned, is due to the small buttons. However, the menu system icons and arrangement of functions on-screen is nowhere close to intuitive. If you can keep trying through trial and error, you'll figure things out, but it is by no means simple or intuitive.The video. The 720 hd video is my favorite feature. I think video quality is pretty darn good. It is by far the most useful feature, since the photos themselves are of only average quality. There is a significant downside. The hd video clips top out at 10 minutes and you must re-start with a new recording at that point. You can shot in standard def, and there is a 4 gb limit there as well. This is fine for making brief clips, but if you want to record a sports event or speech, it's really pointless trying to use this camera as a video recorder.The documentation. The manual is very bare bones. It gives you just enough information to get started, and that is it. You are on your own in figuring out how to shoot non-automatic photos. That you discover strictly through trial and error. The manual now has been downgraded in paper quality. It used to be printed on glassy paper, and came in a slim, clear, re-sealable plastic wrapper, which allowed you to tote around the manual and keep it in more or less pristine condition. Now, the manual comes printed on low quality paper and a bag that you cannot reseal.The covering for the usb cable is also poorly designed. Perhaps they were unable to solve the conundrum of how to create a functional hinge on a camera with such tight dimensions. Nonetheless, you cannnot open this cover beyond 45 degrees without feeling like you will break it off.Once you get past the attractive exterior, you realize that the camera does not take very good photos and while the video recording quality is good, the 10 minute limit makes this feature much less useful and appealing than it could be.In other words, aside from esthetics, size and weight, the quality of the camera's actual functions is far from impressive. Once Canon starts to invest some money in actually producing a camera that takes excellent pictures and videos longer than a music video, they will have a winner here. So far, that's not the case.Finally, I see that a lot of the recent reviews are not very positive. This likely reflects the fact that the price has now gone up significantly from around $150 to $180-200. This is probably enough of an increase to get reviewers grading it according to the criteria of a significantly more expensive camera. Even if it were being sold at the old holiday promotion price, I still could not recommend it. Unfortunately, it looks as though I will be returning this one.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera with wide angle lens
Reviews.Author: Em
Reviews.Content: Pro:  My favorite feature of this camera is the wide angle lens that I have never had before.  Being a real estate broker, I am constantly taking pictures of the inside of homes.  This camera offers me the chance to get much better and appealing views of rooms than I have ever had.Con:  I often get the symbol showing the camera is shaking.  The only suggestion given by Canon is to put the camera on a tripod.  I don't want to use a tripod.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: theGraduateStudent
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera around thanksgiving. What primarily appeals to me:1. Contours: Its slim and easy to slip into a pocket. Very easy to carry around. Also looks very good. However the shape can be a problem for big hands/fingers as it makes it a little tough to hold and not block the screen/flash etc. The price of small size i suppose.2. The 'easy' mode takes pretty good pictures in most lighting conditions.3. Durability: This is an indirect assessment...I carried it in my pockets for about 3 months and there is no visible scratching etc, though watch out for lint around the optical moving parts.4. Battery life: Very good (at least initially). Used a bit judiciously (~75 snaps,3 vids of 30 sec each a day, ) I have managed to take photos/videos for about 5 days worth of vacations.5. HD video: This is great to have on a small camera. Just be prepared for the disk space its going to swallow.Now I will actually see how much serious photography it is capable of. Though for a camera of this class, I dont have any high expectations.Conclusion: Great point and shoot for the casual snapperDisclaimer: I marked 'metering' as 4 stars, but i have not tested how well it works. Just gave it benefit of the doubt since i was happy with it otherwise

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Paula Meach
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Originally, I purchased the SD210IS but it was too complicated for me. This has some of the same features and the same quality pics. Lots of pictures with little noise. I am getting rid of mine, but only because I've learned to use all the features and I'm upgrading to the original one I bought and I'm giving this one to my fave sister. BTW, don't waste money on extra batteries from Best Buy or locally, you can order an extra battery on Amazon for about $3.00 and stores have them for about $35!

Reviews.Title: NICE POCKET SIZED CAMERA
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA BECAUSE OF ITS SIZE.  MY HUSBAND AND I GO ON MOTORCYCLE TRIPS SO PACKING SPACE IS LIMITED.  IT TAKES GREAT PICTURES.  I AM JUST TRYING TO GET USED TO THE ZOOM BUTTON AS IT IS NOT IN THE SAME LOCATION AS MY OTHER CANON CAMERAS.Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Pink)

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: JC.Soto
Reviews.Content: Amazing photos, incredible features (Fisheye effect, very very cool feature), best point and shoot camera I've ever bought! This camera is LOADED with features and I tell you, takes very nice photos. "Color accent", takes amazing photos!You would NOT regret buying these.The orange on this camera its unvelievable!... Very cool camera color to own!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: BOB
Reviews.Content: I have an Olympus E-500 that is so big I get tired of carrying it on hikes and while biking even with its own carrying case, so I thought I would try this small canon and was totally amazed at the quality a $200 camera had!  I paid over $1400 for the E-500 and all the extras I got with it a few years ago, and I am sure that the SD1400IS takes just as good of a picture.  I carry the canon almost every place I go and use it almost every day as my wife and I are retired and full time RVers now.

Reviews.Title: Canon 770 vs. 1400
Reviews.Author: Gaba Hey "Gaba Hey"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an upgrade for the 770 IS, which I bought about 2 years ago. They have improved the auto focus. The LCD now shows you what it's focusing on with little green boxes on the LCD screen. It's more auto than ever. The 770, you had to switch to "close-up" mode for any close-up shots. With this one, it's all auto. Also, it's easier to view the photos you've already taken with the play button. The camera is slightly smaller, and looks more stylish with the rounded corners. And I like the orange! The 770 only came in blah silver. It's a shallow reason to like a camera, I know, but the color options are nice. As far as I can see, the picture quality is not much different than the 10 MP SD770. I've seen the pictures on a 60" LCD screen, and I don't see any difference in quality. But the extra 4 MP is an impressive status symbol none-the-less! Ha ha - my car has more horse-power, and my camera has 4 more mega pixels, so there.I would recommend this for anyone who wants to get decent quality pictures without the hassle of carrying around a bulky camera. It's the same size or smaller than a cell phone, and we all know cell phones take bad pictures. With this camera you can easily take it with you everywhere.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: S. Love "Summer Love"
Reviews.Content: I had the SD1100IS that lasted me a few years and recently broke.  I got this SD1400IS and don't like it as much as the SD1100IS.  It is nice that you can edit the videos straight from the camera, but the zoom button is quite hard to use.  This camera just seems a bit more difficult to use and the zoom button is tiny.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing camera : (
Reviews.Author: Katie's Mommy
Reviews.Content: I read tons of reviews before purchasing this camera.  I was looking for good low light performance and it does have that.  I took pictures out with friends in low light that were surprisingly good.  The problem is in bright or normal light.  The camera can't seem to focus and the images are blurry.  The camera seems to highlight the subject and turn the background black.  I would call the majority of the pictures I took "terrible".  I returned this camera and bought the S90 for another $150.  If it is not better I am returning it too and abandoning Canon altogether.I gave it 3 stars because the almost no light performance was remarkable.I didn't realize how good my Fuji F30 was until it was gone...

Reviews.Title: buyer Beware one speck of dirt and your camera is toast
Reviews.Author: Roux Laflame
Reviews.Content: the pop out lens is so fragile just handling it can stop it from working and one speck of dirt will close the lens permanently.  It costs more to fix then replace.  All these pop out lens models are useless so expect it to last only a few onths like mine did before having to replace it.

Reviews.Title: Favorite Camera
Reviews.Author: Salmon River Dreamer "Salmon River Dreamer"
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite cameras I have ever owned. The last three camera's I have bought have been this same model. It takes great pictures and I think is the smallest camera made by cannon. It is slimmer than any of the ones currently available, and for someone whom travels a lot retaining good picture quality while being smaller than others is better. The problems that I have had with this camera are due to being kind of hard on them because I use it for work in adverse conditions and travel a lot. I had my first one for three years with no problems until I dropped it face down into the sand and then the lens started malfunctioning.  My second and third ones were dropped on cobblestone and concrete while the lens was extended and had the same lens malfunction issues. They all survived being dropped on their sides while turned off and stuffed into pockets of jackets and backpacks but because the lens housing extends out, I had some problems. I am hard on my equipment sometimes, these sorts of things probably wouldn't be an issue for most folks. After my third Cannon SD1400IS broke while on the job, I found the Panasonic Lumix that offers comparable size, weight, picture quality, MP, and is waterproof, freeze-proof, drop-proof, and me-proof (so far) that is my new go to that I have had for almost a year now.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot SD1400is
Reviews.Author: S. Nims
Reviews.Content: I had one of these before and loved it for its great pictures and handy slim size.  My old one got damaged by a rock when it was in my back pocket, so had to get another.  I tried a different, bulkier one with bigger lens, but the lens stopped opening.

Reviews.Title: Excellent mini camera
Reviews.Author: EDay
Reviews.Content: Bought this a few years ago and have taken many pictures.  Family, Close ups, Fishing trips, Ball games, landscapes and work photos of machined parts and photos to communicate issues with quality.  Almost as good as a professional. Very Happy with this purchase.  Battery life is great. Quick to recharge flash.  Only down side is using it in wet or very cold weather.

Reviews.Title: not that great
Reviews.Author: Mr. A
Reviews.Content: I found good reviews about it and bought itBut found its not that greatreason I did not like- auto focus is not quick to focus- you really need stable hands else it does not give sharp image^ i have found this to be a huge problem

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: P. Mulloy
Reviews.Content: This replaces an old Olympus 2 MP digital camera and obviously does a much better job while being a fraction of the size.

Reviews.Title: Had to replace it- it broke twice in the same fashion
Reviews.Author: genissimo "giovanna"
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is great- easy to use, slick and small, takes great photos.Luckily I bought the 1 year warranty, because within a few months, the camera would not turn on, saying the battery was dead even though it was not. I bought new batteries, and a new charger, but that didn't fix anything. Sometimes it would turn on and take a few pictures, but then would unexpectedly shut down and not turn on again for several days. This was highly disappointing because I bought the camera a couple months before a big trip to Europe, and could not use it on my trip.So I took it in to Geek Squad at the Best Buy I purchased it at, and they replaced it with a new one, since they were unable to fix it. I bought the 1 year warranty again. Unfortunately, the exact same malfunction occurred just OVER a year after that. Either I was unlucky enough to get two duds in a row, or I live in some type of magnetic vortex that destroys Canon PowerShots. :(

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Jade L Orr
Reviews.Content: This works better then most Smartphone camera's and it works great as a video camera also. Very easy to use and a great product.

Reviews.Title: Horribly inconsistent quality and very poor low light
Reviews.Author: pen name
Reviews.Content: I have owned many cameras and this is by far the worst. After using it for an entire year, this is my experience. The focus and quality of pictures is horribly inconsistent. I take every picture at least 3-4 times in hopes of getting the correct lighting, flash, and focus in auto mode. Sorry I paid so much money for a product that gave me no satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: One of the best compact point and shoot cameras out there
Reviews.Author: Alecheverry "alecheverry"
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for almost 4 years, took more thank 45000 pictures without any problem in more than 10 countries. Very portable, fits in your jeans and is ready whenever you need it. The quality of the pictures is amazing, I have made enlargements up to  36" x 48" and they look great. 7 months ago it was damaged pretty badly after it felt (with the lens out) from a 3rd floor .... I decided to buy a Nikon to replace this camera (Nikon Coolpix  S3500) and I was very disappointed  at both the quality of the pictures and the whole system in general...(the lens didn't shut off after  1 month). I gave away the Nikon and decided to buy the Canon Powershot SD 1400 AGAIN one month ago...it was used but it hasn't give me any problem....I will buy again in a hearbeat if I have to, and even  if it is a second hand camera...it is the best!

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Brooke Noelle May
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me when I went backpacking through Central America, and it was perfect for what I needed.  I was able to take cool pictures of many different scenes, and it was small and light enough that it wasn't cumbersome in any way.  Definitely recommended for traveling light!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Mark A.
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted the newest version of an already great little camera that she had!  Will probably want the newest version of the same camera in a few years

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: Thomas M Thomas
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot works very well. It is handy and the accompanying case is appreciated to keep the camera safe.

Reviews.Title: Cann PowerShot SD1400 IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Opcal
Reviews.Author: lue kue
Reviews.Content: wil it's last only 3 to 4 month because the shuter doesn't shut all the way in it got stock halfway, that why I bought another one from you again.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Ravinder Saron
Reviews.Content: I can say good battery life, SD card is cheap now, so good picture. Batter than any other product similar

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this camera.  It just plain takes good pictures.  Easy to operate.  This is my second Canon and if I ever need another camera I would go with Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Not good for low light
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: This is a nice compact camera, but it is poor in low light.  I have lots of blurry pictures of my kids.  I bought this after my other Canon super zoom died.  It was not a worthy replacement.  The lens system is way too small to collect adequate light for anythin but bright outdoor shots. You can use the flash, but it washes everything out.

Reviews.Title: Lens broke twice
Reviews.Author: Kim Peters
Reviews.Content: The lens broke two times within two years, first time under warranty.  They sent new camera and then that one also failed.  Liked my other canon sd 600 way more, it's 7 years old ,still works, takes better pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love orange
Reviews.Author: Joseph Accardo
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. And the color.  Didn't really like cameras but this camera was amazing and took great pics and light weight

Reviews.Title: Very Nice camera. Easy to operate.
Reviews.Author: Candy
Reviews.Content: I like the color. This camera ia very automatic, point and shoot. Very easy to use. Automatically sets for micro and macro which is a big plus.Manual was helpful and easy to understand. I am going to love this camera. I bought a navy blue case for it which looks very nice.

Reviews.Title: The culmination of the SD line.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: I had seen and heard great things about the Canon SD1000, which was 4 years old by the time of the SD1400's release.  But about the same time, Canon released an even smaller yet full-featured camera, the SD780 (still the smallest Elf to date).  I wavered between the two, and finally went with the SD780.  It was unique in the Canon line and, despite being the smallest Canon ever, it had HD video and even a tunnel vision viewfinder.  The professional reviews weren't especially kind to photo quality, but the camera was selected one of the ten best new products of the year by Macworld magazine and received higher ratings from Amazon reviewers than most other Canon cameras (4 1-2 stars vs. 4).Then I lost my SD780. This time I purchased a like-new SD1400.  It has more surface area to grasp, a bigger screen, slightly better zoom, a few additional settings and innovations, and it fits into the same Canon case as the SD780.  I have noticed a few quirks--the buttons on the back aren't as accessible (they're flush and even recessed with the camera's back), the zoom control is small and not as intuitive to operate, the auto setting tends to give me overly warm exposures.Then I found my SD780. Recently, I took it to the county fair on an especially bright and hot day.  I would have had to guess while aiming each shot and video were it not for the tunnel-vision viewfinder the Canon managed to squeeze into its tiniest of all Elphs!  Returning from the fair, I was amazed at the quality of the photos--whether outside in the blazing, high sun or inside the livestock barns, the auto settings were perfect, the colors accurate, the pictures sharp.  And the movies plus sound played great on my Sony flat screen.I almost forgot that this started out as a review of the SD1400.  It's a fine camera, with slightly larger dimensions than the SD780, and the bigger screen is bound to appeal to many users, especially those for whom a viewfinder is gratuitous. Moreover, it has written prompts that show on the screen, frequently making unnecessary another review of the manual (most of which is on line). Still, it doesn't strike me as anything like a "grand finale" to the Canon SD line of Elve (more likely Canon was anxious to begin their next line, beginning in 2011--no more SD initials to decode: simply Canon Elph 100, Elph 300, etc.From now on, the SD780 travels with me, too small to make a leather case especially practical: the 780 simply slips into any convenient pocket and is always ready to go if you can remember which pocket.  As for this SD1400, it stays home, always charged and ready for action the moment the cats come up with their latest crazy stunt.  (For nature shooting, or recording the action at your son's Little League or your daughter's soccer game, you can't beat the sharp and fast (outdoors) telephoto lens of the Canon SX230 telephoto lens--which I would have never added to my collection were it not for a visit to the Canon site, where the camera was being phased out at a price almost a 3rd that of either a new SD780 or SD1400.  Sometimes there's something to be said about the free market system--but also about consumers who mpulsively buy more "stuff" than they need, all the while rationalizing they "saved money."

Reviews.Title: complete package
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Lum
Reviews.Content: big performance from such a small package.  So easy to carry, yet so versatile.  The seller was great.  He included a charger, usb cable AND case w/ strap.  It has a convenient download package that let's me circumvent the many fences on my work computer so I can download and delete photos easily.  It a great overall package.  You just have to be aware of its susceptibility to flare.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera!
Reviews.Author: LINDA in LONGVIEW
Reviews.Content: I have carried this on several outings and two trips, and I love it.  It's easy to use and takes high quality pictures.  Great for amateurs like me, but has also been valuable to my artist friend who borrowed it and to my granddaughter who also used it when she forgot her own.

Reviews.Title: Nice shots!
Reviews.Author: NIEMEYER S BARBOSA
Reviews.Content: Nice shots, small, very good! Im happy with the acquisition! If you are looking for a small and good camera go for it!

Reviews.Title: Loved it until now
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this little gem a few years ago. It has been wonderful. However, It now gives me a 'lens error' message. I have used air spray to clean it but can't get past it.One thing I have never liked is the non instant shutter.  I hope that has been resolved for all these digital camera's. If I see something I want a picture of...I want it now! I was surprised when I looked to see that a replacement camera would be over $250!  I imagine repair may be about the same, so I will shop and compare prices now for a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Jon Schultz
Reviews.Content: I already have one of these cameras and loved it for it's ability to shoot in low light, so I purchased a second.  While it can't shoot in as low of light as I would like, for the price, it is a very good trade off.  The size makes it great for a lady's purse or a guy's pocket, for those spur of the moment memory shots.  I have a DSLR but this is the camera I use more by far.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: I had the same one but I dropped it by accident and my choice was to get the same one because it's a great camera, easy to use, great quality pictures.....just love it.

Reviews.Title: just what i was looking for
Reviews.Author: christine grundmeyer
Reviews.Content: small and compact, good photos.  quick snap. easy to use.  very reasonably priced.  i would highly recommend it, had done some research prior to purchase.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my BF
Reviews.Author: Jasmine McCants
Reviews.Content: My bf had recently lost his phone with great pictures he had been eyeing this phone for a long time. It takes fantastic pictures and he is happy about the camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: Johnsgirl O'reilly
Reviews.Content: Love this little thing.  I agree with other comments that it is a little hard to hang onto at times but I have had no other problems and it is easy to carry around.  I also bought the Juicy Box carrier which works well with each otherClear pictures. Slight delay when pushing the button but not a real hinderence. Nice size viewing screen.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Shelly J. Healey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son to take with him to a foreign country for two years. It has held up very well, taken great pictures, and is easy to bring along. I'm very happy with this purchase, and with the photos he sends home. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Patton
Reviews.Content: This small camera fits just about anywhere, including a shirt pocket. It has many features and a good zoom capability. The pixils provide for good clarity especially in the macro mode.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: conley carlton
Reviews.Content: after carefully comparing others in this class there was too many options to pass on. would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Ann Marzi
Reviews.Content: It takes nice pictures and video. It's small and easy to carry around. The battery lasts a long time. Recommended  very satisfied with camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Robin Thompson
Reviews.Content: This is a great little point and click camera. I was looking for something very small and compact.  This camera has worked flawlessly every time.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: Carol L McManus
Reviews.Content: Bought it to take pictures for my eBay store and it works very well for that purpose.  Hard to change settings - kind of complicated, I think.

Reviews.Title: Cute camera
Reviews.Author: donttellmewhat2do
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a couple years ago and have enjoyed it ever since. It takes excellent pictures if you have a steady hand, a tripod, or something steady to sit it on. The zoom, unfortunately, is not good at all. That was one of my first complaints about the camera. If you zoom in much at all, the picture becomes grainy and dark. With minimal zooming or no zoom at all, however, the pictures tend to be great! Also, when taking videos particularly, the camera seems to take a while to focus. So if you are trying quickly to get a video started, sometimes the result can be blurry. The size of the camera is a huge plus. It is very small and compact. Overall I would recommend it while noting those few flaws.
