Reviews.Title: Adequate but not exceptional
Reviews.Author: Michael Roof
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera, which came highly rated, when my old one wore out. It works well, but not exceptionally. It is quite slow on the rebound between pictures, even with an upgraded high speed photo disk. The pictures are average or better. This camera works reasonably and has decent ergonomics, but I think there are better choices available.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: Drew Sells Homes "Andrew"
Reviews.Content: Bought for my mother ... she loves it and it is not to complex for her to use (she is 74)

Reviews.Title: AWEFUL
Reviews.Author: ELIZABETH
Reviews.Content: the lens got stuck after 3 months... the retailer did not helpped in anything. And the repairing cost is almost the same price than the camera is. They steel my money.

Reviews.Title: Size and quality are why I bought this camera...
Reviews.Author: Lightning
Reviews.Content: This is a great pocket camera.  I've had it over a year and have only one complaint: it is very slow.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, solid pictures, small and easy to use
Reviews.Author: The Grammiers "With 2 rambunctious boys"
Reviews.Content: This camera has served us well.  Generally it stays in my wife's purse since I would never remember to bring it with us.  It's easy to carry and easy to turn on and off.  Good but not great zoom.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Usable
Reviews.Author: Rivky Stern
Reviews.Content: Very simple and usable camera for people who don't need lots of complicated tricks. Probably one of the best I've owned.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Dimples 22
Reviews.Content: Once I learned how to use all the functions, I will thrilled to own it.  I just wish they would include an instruction manual with the camera rather than my having to print it all.  It becomes quite cumbersome when printed on 8x11" paper.

Reviews.Title: EASY TO USE CAMERA & VIDEO CAMERA/TAKES GREAT PHOTOS
Reviews.Author: Paula C. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I HAVE NEVER BEEN HAPPIER WITH A CAMERA IN ALL MY LIFE.  (I AM 48 YEARS OLD)  ELECTRONICS ARE USUALLY VERY HARD FOR ME TO OPERATE.  THIS WAS IS A BREEZE FROM PLUGGING INTO MY COMPUTER TO DOWN LOAD PICTURES AND VIDEOS, TO USING THE CAMERA AND TAKE VIDEOS.  I HAVE HAD MY CAMERA ABOUT 2 OR 3 YEARS AND HAVE TAKEN THOUSANDS OF PHOTOS.  I SELL ANGEL TRUMPET FLOWERS AND TAKES THOUSANDS OF MY PLANTS AND MY DOGS TO POST ON FACE BOOK.  LOVE IT.  GREAT CAMERA.  PICTURES ARE REALLY AMAZING.  ALSO TAKES GREAT SHOTS AT NIGHT.  TRULY AMAZED AT BEING ABLE TO TAKE SHOTS AT NIGHT OF MY PLANTS AND THEY COME OUT BETTER THEN MANY OF MY DAY TIME PHOTOS.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: deeglick01
Reviews.Content: I had this camera in pink, unfortunately it was dropped on ceramic tile and didn't make it. I bought this and it's just as great, only complaint is that the zoom in button you really have to push hard to get it to work. But this camera is awesome and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: A Happy Fathers Day!!
Reviews.Author: Jean Martorella
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera 2 years ago and was so happy with it.  He went fishing and his friend accidentally dropped it and broke it.  I searched for this camera in 3 stores to replace it, but it had been discontinued, until I searched amazon.com and found it by this seller.  The camera is great and my husband was so happy I replaced it.  Thank you so much!!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot - Big bang for small buck
Reviews.Author: Rdebisu
Reviews.Content: This is the second of these cameras that I have purchased.  First camera showed a lens error after about three years of use, but it takes such good photos and videos and is so versatile that I did not even consider another camera.  Love the size and utility of the camera and hope that I can get at least as much use out of this one as the last.  Two European trips and some Japanese trips under its belt.

Reviews.Title: It's a great point-and-shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: Liz
Reviews.Content: I don't consider point-and-shot cameras professional, but this little camera is really nice for shooting events in every day life! It's very compact and fits in your pocket so easily!

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: klundquist
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant to be ordering a camera from Amazon, but I had one exactly like this and it broke.  I wanted to replace it with the same camera because I really liked it, and am very happy with my purchase here.  Everything works great!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jay8064
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera I had one in orange for 2 years and loved it so much that now I bought it in pink

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: Dead Spot Shots
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to mess around with one of these and I really loved its capability as a point and shoot. I ended up buying one for my parents and they LOVE it.

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures, Big Problem, Terrible Customer Support
Reviews.Author: MAX
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos and amazing high definition videos. But what good is that when the camera won't work? A lens error message is the result of every time I attempt to turn on this camera. And through what I've seen on the Internet, this is a common problem. And customer support gives you two options. Send them the camera and they will repair it for $130, plus shipping. Yeah right, it makes more sense to buy a new camera. Or you can sell it to them, and they will give you a ridiculously small credit to buy another one of Canon's defective cameras."Well, do you have any troubleshooting tips for me?""Nope. Just the two options I already mentioned."Once again this camera takes excellent pictures, but not for long.

Reviews.Title: good, as expected
Reviews.Author: tiniB
Reviews.Content: same great canon menu as i am used to. compact size, all the feature i need for quick snaps or pretty pictures. no surprises. happy w the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot
Reviews.Author: Suki524
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Pink)Has many of the features I was looking for.  It is a gift for my daughter and I'm sure she will love it!

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto
Reviews.Author: Alejandro Zumbado "MAKA"
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto muy buen precio excelente tiempo de entrega y enmpaque, realmente es igual al que se aprecia en la imagen.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: JENNIFER BASSETT
Reviews.Content: This is a really great camera and you can put it on several different settings including "kids and pets" for those action shots you'd really like to get. I can't tell you how many really neat pictures I have because I caught my kid in mid-face making! Great product for the money!

Reviews.Title: Fast Delivery!
Reviews.Author: Abby
Reviews.Content: I had a camera just like this that was stolen, so I ordered a new one online, knowing that it takes very clear pictures and is very easy to use. I also love the compact size and the sleek design.I ordered this product on a Monday afternoon and received my camera on Wednesday morning! I don't think I have ever received a product so fast before!I can't wait for the batteries to be fully charged so I can start using my new camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera but small part already broken
Reviews.Author: Amy P.
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before purchasing a new digital camera and feel like I made the right decision when I purchased this one. It is easy to use and takes great pictures...so much smaller and faster than my 10 year old Canon that finally died. The one bummer is that the little rubber flap that covers the opening where the battery and memory card go broke a few weeks into having the camera. And I am worried that the other flap that opens up to access the AV/digital port will break soon as it feels like it has to be bent back too far just to be able to plug in the cable.

Reviews.Title: Good camera!
Reviews.Author: Benjamin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a scuba diving trip in the Hawai. This is my first product review, but I was so impressed with this camera, I have to do one!! We bought the underwater case to go with it so we could take it diving with us.I like it

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: Renit
Reviews.Content: Not a camera person so went off the reviews, this is a great product, excellent pictures, clear, crisp images, no bright flash so childern don't close their eyes. Would recommend highly

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Michael T. Hibbs
Reviews.Content: I'm a pro photographer but wanted something just for kicks to carry around so I didn't have to lug around my slr. Great camera with a lot of effects but perfect for just on the go point and shoot

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: hailyn
Reviews.Content: excellent camera very nice shaped and easy to use.. excellent quality pictures as well. battery life pretty long... i wasnt sure which one i wanted to buy but i decided for this one because i know cannon make good stuff and it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this camera!
Reviews.Author: cme_red
Reviews.Content: I got this along with the underwater casing so I could take it on vacation with me and use it for scuba diving as well.  It takes great pictures both above and below the water!  Love the fact that even with the underwater casing its small enough to travel with.  Its a great basic camera to have, takes great photos and video and its small enough you can take it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Love this teency-weency camera!
Reviews.Author: 212girlatheart
Reviews.Content: I really do like this camera but was not prepared as to how small it was. Perfect for slipping into your evening purse or pocket but takes some getting used to in terms of size. It's about the size and weight of a Blackberry albeit a bit thicker. It takes good pictures and movies. I am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera!!! Has great features and its very easy to use! It also takes really great pictures. I love the color accent feature. I have had several people buy this camera cause they liked my camera so much. Once again Canon made another great product.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: C. Robertson "justsimple"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.  It automatically chooses the type of background you need, however you can also do it manually if you want.  Picture quality is great! Resolution is great, clarity is great, color is also great.  Just a great camera overall.  While on vacation recently my family member quit using her Kodak camera and just took pics on mine because they turned out so much better, then went and bought her own.  I also recommended it to a friend, she bought one and loved it to.  It is definately worth the money, great value.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400
Reviews.Author: Michael Ford
Reviews.Content: This camera is simple to use and produces quality images.  The only drawback is trying to capture action shots.  Capturing an image of a flying bird was almost impossible, with the shutter delay and no traditional view finder.  The camera has performed flawlessly, with the exception of action shots

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Krecord
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I has hoped it would be. The pictures are crisp and clear, the zoom is perfect, and it has so many fun features. I am 100% satisfied with the quality of this camera. I bought it in replacement of my Kodak Easyshare and it is so much more of a camera!! I would recommend this to anyone that enjoys taking snapshots.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Koala
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera and it came to me in amazing condition! It also got to me before the estimated ship date! I had owned one of these previous to this one, but lost it camping, I bought this one because it was better pricing than my original camera. The camera came to me in excellent condition and works amazingly! 5-star performance!

Reviews.Title: My favorite camera
Reviews.Author: L. M. Stinchcomb "Mimi in Georgia"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few years ago and lost it in D.C.  Got a different brand camera and within 6 months gave it away and ordered another Canon.  It is easy to use and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Sophia
Reviews.Content: So I have read an endless amount of reviews and things before choosing this camera. I was looking for an everyday camera to take pictures on vacations and stuff, and googled the best everyday digital camera. This was the answer to almost all the websites I looked at and I'm so glad I choose it. I ordered this camera recently and I'm so in love. The pictures are fantastic, I can pick out every hair on my dogs body in the photo. The different settings the camera has are amazing and fun to mess around with. If something about the picture doesn't look right, theres always a quick and easy fix. There were some reviews I read that said the pictures didn't turn out right and I believe the person must not have known how to use the many tools the camera has because I literally have not taken one bad picture yet. And the price for this camera is great for all it can do! Seriously, I'm just blown away and I say don't second guess this camera and just get it! All these good reviews are definitely right and I was second guessing them myself before I purchased this camera!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera and its features
Reviews.Author: Gillian
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and has so many features.  We bought it because of the color swap/color accent feature that is hard to find on a camera.  It takes incredible pictures.  Would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great purse camera!
Reviews.Author: Catharine
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to replace my previous purse camera, a Casio Exilim Z500. That was a good little camera, but this Canon blows it out of the water! The low light capability and the sharpness of the lens are amazing for this price point. If you want a snappy little camera that you can take to parties or on vacations and not worry about fiddling with lenses or carrying a huge bag, then I highly recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: A great family camera taking excellent pictures.
Reviews.Author: Sennix
Reviews.Content: From getting away to mountain to gathering around dinner with family, this Canon SD1400 has be a part of my family since the day I bought it. It won't give you an extraordinary picture like the Nikon D90 or Canon Rebel EOS i-Series, but it is good enough to give you a decent one without carrying out your "big monster". Truly a point-and-shoot camera, it is compact and easy to use; and, yes its PINK color makes it a standout and a start of "Where did you get that..." from people around you. I picked this one as a gift for my aunt, who was very skeptical about digital camera; and, it makes her changed her mind after the first shot by the clarity and colorfulness the camera gives.If you are a big man with big fingers, I would not recommend you this camera because its design is primarily for the mean of compact.Canon did a great job on its PowerShot series, which I'm sure that it has beaten up the Sony's Cybershot by a very far distance. Keep up the good work, Canon!

Reviews.Title: Started my photograpy courses with this camera; excellent choice!
Reviews.Author: Mary Mahaydik "Boardwalk Angel"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift for use in a beginner's photography course, and I couldn't have been more prepared for the course.  I sailed thru the course with flying colors and have moved on to more advanced studies.  However, even though I am now shooting with an entry level DSLR (yes..also a Canon..I'm officially Team Canon), the powershot is always with me when I am working on course work, and the powershot is the first choice of mine for leisure snaps as well.The only con I have regarding this camera is that it is very sleek in feel, and there have been a few times where if I wasn't using the wrist strap, the camera would have slipped away from me.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Bender in the Burgh
Reviews.Content: LOVE this camera!  My other cameras have been Olympus' but this Canon takes pictures that are just as nice.  It's nice and portable.  A good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great product!!
Reviews.Author: Jenny Lynn
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  It has many neat functions that are easy to use. Takes great shots & video. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: mei_gem
Reviews.Content: I love Canon cameras because the picture quality was great and it is very versatile in taking many different types of shots (action, low light, etc). After the battery on my old one died (10 yrs old), I bought this new one. It has high resolution and continues to have all the amazing qualities I like about Canon cameras. It's small and lightweight so easy to carry in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: wow.
Reviews.Author: Zyoder4
Reviews.Content: (keep in mind i am not a professional photographer, just a teenager looking for a good camera for a trip out west)wow. such great performance from such a little camera! i did all my research, looked at many other brands, and even checked out some dslr cameras, and i would have to say that this is the best for the money.screenpros: very nice full color screen, good response, very easy to use controlscons: in bright sunlight the pixels are somewhat visible, but it doesnt affect the picture qualitylensepros: small, sharp focuscons: not the best zoom, the autofocus is often non-existentcontrolspros: a bit small, but pretty easy to use, nice zoom lever, intuitive controls which are easy to seecons: buttons are a bit small, but are nice and compactpicture qualitypros: sharp, but not quite the 14.1 megapixels, great in dark conditionscons: lags between pictures, pretty easy to get blurry shots if you arent holding it absolutely stilloverallpros: great screen, great size, easy to use controls, takes nice pictures in the dark, auto mode is very handy, good videocons: a bit slippery, not the best zoom, not the best autofocusdefinitely recommend this to any amatuer photographer who wants a nice, easy to use camera. also goes nicely with apples camera cononection kit for ipad.

Reviews.Title: Small item, great buy
Reviews.Author: iguy
Reviews.Content: This camera not only takes great pictures but it is really thin and lite. Great pocket camera that even takes HD video! Make sure to buy extra SD cards, the videos take up a lot of space.

Reviews.Title: Small, compact, phenomenal!
Reviews.Author: bit912
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and I love it. It's compact, I can even fit it in my pocket. The picture quality is amazing for a point and shoot. There's a feature where you can take an all black and white picture and let one color, blue for example, stand out. Canon also sells a case, so you can take it underwater. Video quality is actually pretty good for it being a camera. And I like how they put a hdmi output on it too. I highly recommend it! 14mp, 4x zoom, 720p high-def video, great specs for such a small camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Wright "savebernards"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Its easy to use, compact and light.  I had a Nikon, and some of the pictures came out yellow, the color on these pictures with this camera are very true.  I am very pleased with it.  I bought a couple of extra batteries, and carry them with me, but the battery life is excellent.

Reviews.Title: I'm in LOVE with my camera
Reviews.Author: Bridgette Pagel "Bridgette Pagel"
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews on this camera before I purchased it. You have to admitt, some of the things said make it doubtful for one to even bother buying this. But to me, to each there own. I would never recommend buying something this expensive just to try it out, do your research!! Cannon has an excellent reputation, and thus far I am VERY happy with my purchase. I have not had any problems, it takes beautiful pictures, has amazing zoom capabilities, is light weight and compact... and lets face it, the color is stunning. I personally WOULD recommend this product, but if you look also there is a newer version of this camera available now. I personally didn't really like the looks of it, but thats just me. I hope this helps you!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD 1400IS
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I have been using Canon PowerShot cameras since 1974.  They havebeen improving more and more each time I look to purchase them.Since I am not a professional photographer but use photographsoften in newsletters that I edit for my senior center--and forpersonal use, I find that my latest purchase, the PowerShot SD 1400IS.exceeds my needs, along with the Canon photo computer programs which Igenerally use in conjunction with Microsoft Publisher.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Becca
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new camera and all the reviews seemed very good.  I see now why.  Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Definitely buy it.. but find cheaper price
Reviews.Author: Monkeydo
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera today as a birthday present/mother's day present.  I love, love, LOVE it.  Spend some time and look through the user guide on the CD-rom, as it gives you alot of tips on getting the best pictures.  I also recommend using the manual feature on the camera (camera icon settings), vs the auto feature.  Auto feature gives you an "ok" photo, specifically for things that don't move or don't need anything special, but you won't get the quality you can get by switching settings.  If you're willing to spend an hour reading the user guide, then this is a great camera for you... However, if all you want is to buy a camera, put it on the easiest setting and expect perfect photos right away.. Maybe you might invest in something more basic.Also - Do some shopping around... You may be able to find this cheaper, I know I did.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: kushvin
Reviews.Content: Was "upgrading" from a Casio Exilim 8 megapixel camera.  The auto setting on this camera is useless, it doesn't focus well or have good lighting detection.  A lot of blurry pictures.  Will be going back to the Casio, which had crisp, detailed shots.

Reviews.Title: The BEST camera I have owned so far
Reviews.Author: DancingLacey
Reviews.Content: I am very,very,very happy with this camera.  It's the perfect size for me and the color orange looks pretty cool.  Before I purchased the Canon, I owned a Sony and Olympus and I have to say that the Canon camera is far the BEST.  The picture quality is great and I love the features it has.  I am constantly using this camera and I am so happy with it.  I will sticking with Canon from now on. If you buy this camera, you will not be dissapointed. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Missie Schumaier - A Flurry of Ponderings "A ...
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Canon and this is my third in the Powershot series. I am a professional photographer, but use this camera for personal events. I love the camera and the quality! Definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Salamander_girl "Salamandergirl"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for people who want a good quality finished product, but want to relax and let the camera to do the work for them!  All i do is match the scenario settings (indoor, sunset, sport, etc) and everything comes out well.  I love the added feature of being able to choose one color from my subject matter to focus on and the rest of the image becomes black and white.  Very easy to use, and a small enough size to always keep in my purse. thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Excellent and good looking
Reviews.Author: David E. Sinkler "sinkler190"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this camera, in fact, I purchased one in black for my husband.  The only flaw is it is a little slow to "take the photo"  Once you push the button if the pet/person moves you only get a blur.  But overall a very nice camera.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: buddy's mom
Reviews.Content: I just purchased two of the canon sd 1400is yesterday 4-21-11.  My daughter who is nine took great pictures right out of the box. The quality of the photos is awesome.  We made a short video, it's quality was also good. The only problem we found was the volume isn't very loud. We are very pleased with our cameras and are happy we bought the sd 1400is. Someone with large hands might have a problem in operating this camera due to it's small size. Therefore, you might want to try one out before purchasing. However, we love ours.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera for the Price!!
Reviews.Author: Cutthroat
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a week before I left for a 2 week trip to Ireland and England.  This is my first camera ever.  I was very pleased with the 600 pictures I took while in Ireland.  I took photos both outdoor in dramatic landscapes as well as in poorly-lit pubs.  I was very pleased with the quality of the photos and even the video.  The only thing I wish this camera had was a more than 4x optical zoom.  That is being very picky though and if I wanted more zoom I should have bought a pricier camera.  Overall the camera is great and the battery lasts a long time.My only word of caution is to be careful when having strangers take picture of you.  The rounded edges make for a very surprising slick surface to handle for those not used to this camera.  I had more that one person almost drop it when passing it off.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME
Reviews.Author: kk's hot mama
Reviews.Content: This product is the best buy that you can get for your money...even takes good pics of me and other people on crappy junky lounge days!!! i have and always will buy canon cameras! I had my old powershot 4.1 megapixels for 6 years and it still worked great until my toddlet decided that she wants to become a photogapher :) The pics from this camera are clear, beautiful, and vibrant!!!!!!! BUY BUY BUY!!!! I now know 6 others with the same camera, three already owned it and three bought it after me and feel the same way !!!!

Reviews.Title: Not as good as Sony and Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Excalibur1952 "Utopian"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a basic point and shoot under $ 200 and after some research narrowed in on the Canon SD 1400is. This camera went on sale at Bestbuy for $149, so I grabbed it. The excitement was short lived. I took about 100 pics in various light conditions and environments, but all the pics seemed to lack sharpness and vibrancy. After reading the hundreds of good reviews for this product, I thought picture quality would be excellent, but I was disappointed. In low light, the camera was extra slow and produced somewhat dull and unfocused pics.  I compared this camera with a $ 179 Panasonic ZS5 borrowed from a friend and a $ 129 Sony W 530 to compare, and the Sony did well in all light conditions, producing warm, vibrant pics with clear focus, and the Panasonic did well in all light conditions, producing extra sharp pics even at 10 x zoom, though colors were not as vibrant as the Sony. I returned the Canon and kept the Sony.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: D. Lee
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. Best thing is it's size/weight. I carry this around with me when I don't want to lug my Canon 5dmkii and do not feel the pressure of needing to take professional photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera! (but doesn't stand well on its own)
Reviews.Author: K. Clark "GiddyK"
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of Canon cameras and have owned many of them.  This one follows the path of my previous Powershot cameras; lightweight, easy to use, big screen, comfortable in the hand...and of course great pictures! The one drawback I have found is that the camera does not stand well on its own (especially on the short end) to take time-delayed pictures. Other than that--it's a great camera and I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking the reviews I had read were correct. No they were not. The camera does take time to check it out and play with it. I am not happy with the zoom quality, very blurry with pixels. I had an old Powershot 940, that camera was great! I thought by now they would have improved things. I didn't want to spend a lot of money on a point & shoot camera. I guess you get what you pay for!Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Pink)

Reviews.Title: Small, Compact, Lightweight camera
Reviews.Author: Rajen Pandya "Rajen"
Reviews.Content: When I was in market for a good camera, first thing I was looking for was a camera with DSLR quality (or close to it) but not as bulky. I am not much photography enthusiastic but like to take good pictures when we are out. This camera definitely fits the bill. Picture quality is great, its really small and light weight so no need to carry in a case. I am not even planning to buy a case. Its smaller than my iPhone so whenever we go out I keep it in my pocket.Works like a charm.

Reviews.Title: good in general
Reviews.Author: Icheng Tsao "Star fruit"
Reviews.Content: Everything seems to be OK except the video recording stops at 10 minutes interval that is the only un-expected disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Not up to expectation
Reviews.Author: A. Lin "Loves to Read!"
Reviews.Content: My fiance bought me this camera in July of 2010 and I began using it in September of 2010.I used it only on 2 ocassions, once in September and once in October and during the second time that I used it, it broke!  It would not turn on.  So, I contacted Canon since it was under warranty.They gave me a work order, I shipped it to them and they sent me a refurbished one to replace my broken one. So, that was okay, as long as I got a working camera.Since then, I have used the camera for different events under different types of environment (night, birthdays, foliage, snow/mountain, indoor event, outdoor/park, etc) and I feel that this camera does not meet my expecations of a 1400is generation Canon camera. I've own two canon IS digital camera's prior to this one and those worked better than this one which was pricier and newer.I constantly get extremely blurry pictures even with the image stabilizer and auto focus option. It does NOT image stabilize as I have tried to take picturesThe zoom function is hard to control.I would not recommend this camera to anyone. Save your money and look for a better camera.

Reviews.Title: Amazing photos in a tiny package!
Reviews.Author: M. Starbuck
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera to take on a vaction.  I intended to use it as a "backup" when my larger, older canon was too large to take.  I ended up with 300 photos on this and only 4 on my other camera!  The light and color are all so nice!  I love this little camera!  The only negatives I would have is that it's very small, so bigger hands might have a difficult time with it and also the "door" for the a/v input seems flimsy to me. Great no-brainer point and shoot camera!

Reviews.Title: Not what expected
Reviews.Author: masha p landau
Reviews.Content: I was pretty disappointed with the camera.  Picture quality is low.  Pictures come out blurry and the audio sound is low.  Can't tell that it is 14 mega pixels.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: Maria C. Lopez
Reviews.Content: This is like the best camera so far from the ones ive bought it works soo well, and the good thing about it is that its pocket sized i could take it anywhere i want and capture some beutiful moments. :)

Reviews.Title: Sick cameras come in small sizes, at least Canons
Reviews.Author: Scopher
Reviews.Content: This camera is so small, but so sweet.  The HD video recording is unbelievable. The picture quality is great. The only thing I wish was better was nighttime picture taking, but I'm sure there are ways to tweak the settings to make it more conducive to that. Overall a great product. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: Skip
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small easily carried high quality point & shoot camera for my extensive world wide business travel. My digital SLR was just one more thing I always had to find room for and I was getting tired of it. This camera has exceeded my expectations, especially in low light situations (restaurants, meetings, museums, etc.). I seldom use the flash now; I select it "off" and I'm happy with the results. The face recognition feature was a pleasant surprise too. For the money, you can't beat it. Bottom line is I'm very happy with the cameras size and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Great quality in such a small package!
Reviews.Author: laurab
Reviews.Content: Love the huge viewing screen--especially considering that the camera is the size of a credit card! The quality of the photos is impressive. We've had older models of the powershot series over the years and this is by far the best we've had. I shoot with an SLR when I'm taking "serious" or "important" photos--but I find myself reaching for this little guy more and more often because of the convenience of the size and the fact that the quality really is great.

Reviews.Title: Elph is MIGHTY miniature
Reviews.Author: Charmer
Reviews.Content: While on vacation in Mexico I had the opportunity to do an unexpected photo shoot. The only camera I had with me was my trusty Canon Elph SD 1400. The customer viewed my photos online and decided to go ahead with the shoot. She loved the 110 stills and one minute movie, most shot in available light. She could not believe they came out of the little Elph. That resulted in another friend buying her first Elph and loving it. I recently tried the new touch pad Canon Elph for a week then returned it and got another SD 1400.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Richard Martini
Reviews.Content: It's a excellent camera with great features and easy to use also It has a great look and feel that complements its compact size. It's ideal for every ocasion

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have owned.
Reviews.Author: brentjroberts
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, especially if you want to carry one in your pocket. I hate bulky things in my pocket but this camera is the perfect size. It is small enough to fit comfortably in a pocket but still large enough to see the screen and hold it when using it. I have owned other canon camera and am very satisfied with the overall quality and ease of use. This is the best camera I have ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Erica
Reviews.Content: This camera is very light and easy to use for traveling. As far as point-and-shoots go, it makes very nice pictures. It has great battery life.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Josh S
Reviews.Content: I have been using a Canon powershot SD630 for about 4 years. Immediately after upgrading the differences stood out. Overall this camera is smaller and lighter, less bulky and easily fits in pockets. The screen, while being slightly smaller I believe feels much larger in part because the images on it are so much crisper than the previous camera and also because it has very little body "framing" it. I mean that the 630 had a lot of excess bulge around the screen whereas the 1400's screen pushes pretty much right up to the edges of the camera.the only real "con" I have is the zoom level is pretty small and the first week I used it was on a ski trip and I was trying to use it with gloves on. With that said I think it helped learning the feel of it with reduced dexterity because now I know exactly how to hit everything I want. The camera's auto setting is amazing, it picks up on things wonderfully and switches to exactly what you need for the conditions and does it quickly as it worked wonderfully snapping shots as I started downhill on the mountains.I couldn't be happier with this camera, video and sound are great as well and on top of all of that it comes in black which is always a great color on electronics.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great for everyday pictures!
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: I am no professional photographer, but I have been playing around with photography. I wanted something that wasn't as bulky or slow at taking more quality photos as my Sony. I love my Sony and wasn't ready to switch brands, but my friend had this camera and I had to give it try. I ended up buying it for myself. I love this camera for everyday pictures. It does the job and does it well. I love the Auto mode, it does an amazing job, most other cameras I used in auto mode did not come out as clean as this camera. I haven't had time to play around with all the features, but so far I love this camera and highly recommend it to anyone who wants an easy to use, awesome, compact, point and shoot camera! :)

Reviews.Title: Slow light meter is a disappointment
Reviews.Author: Snebold
Reviews.Content: I've bought several Canon cameras in the past and have been pretty satisfied with them except for their low-light noise. This new camera seems to be unusually slow when it's metering in preparation to use the flash. Feels like 3 seconds go by. Also, the auto focus is not very good many times.

Reviews.Title: Nice Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Staszek
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas present for the girlfriend. Its a solid point and shoot and does everything she wants it to. The HD video is nice but I wish it had more frame rate options. Its not my camera though, so I cannot complain!

Reviews.Title: Canon 1400 IS is a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: jerseylady
Reviews.Content: My husband loves to take pictures the old fashioned way, but I am not that technical, so this little point and shoot is perfect for me. It has wonderful features and is backed by the Canon name, so what more could you ask for? I am considering getting the photo printer as well to print on the go.

Reviews.Title: Good personal camera
Reviews.Author: nvnbk
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for personal use for indoor shooting & outdoor too. Indoor there are whole a lot of mode including night mode & even for very dark scenes which I liked a lot. Also modes for bright day, snow day. Overall perfect camera for people who would want to use camera on daily basis. I would definitely recommend to people who want to buy a camera for more of indoor shooting than for outdoor.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Samantha F.
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera about a week ago, so I haven't played with it too much but I do love it so far! It's no DSLR, but I wasn't expecting it to be at all (like some other reviewers seemed to). :) The quality is great, and even if I crop a picture to pieces there are enough MP to still keep the fantastic quality. I really love some of the creative modes offered, especially the fake tilt shift ('miniature') mode! There are many modes and settings that help you sort of 'edit' your photo without having to wait until you download it onto the computer, then open the editing program, work on it, resave, etc. A feature that I hadn't read before that didn't much attention was the ability to take widescreen pictures, which I think is pretty nifty. When people have seen the pictures, then seen the tiny pink camera I used to take the picture (it's smaller than my Blackberry!) they can't believe their eyes! I'm not using it for professional pictures - most are just for personal use and Facebook. For those uses, the quality is MORE than amazing.The auto mode is perfect for quick shots, or when someone else is using your camera. The manual setting is very easy to get the hang of, and it keeps the settings you've made for the next time you turn on your camera (even if you switch to Auto or Video mode). Very handy!My absolute favorite feature is the self timer. You can custom set it to however many seconds, and then set how many pictures you want it to take. If you set it at 10 seconds/20 pictures, it counts down to ten seconds and then every few seconds after that it takes a new picture. The light lets you know when a picture is about to be taken, and you can usually hear the shutter go off in between each one, too. It's great for taking pictures of yourself or with friends without making one friend be the cameraman. Just prop the camera onto a table or tripod, set the timer, and get ready to pose!As far as shipping was concerned, I got free 2-day shipping through Amazon Prime (student account). We had a terrible bout of snow the day before it was due to be at my doorstep, and it was enough snow and ice to cancel all the K-12 schools in the area and even my university (which rarely closes)! Amazon warned me that my package may be delayed, but it still came right on time! The packaging inside the box was very easy to open, and I didn't have to run and grab scissors/knife or struggle with hard-to-open plastic.I would definitely recommend this camera to a friend!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "majiggiday"
Reviews.Content: Exacty what I was looking for! Takes wonderful pictures and is very compact. I got this little gem to take pictures of my 3 month old...and due to it's short lag time between taking the picture and being able to take another I don't lose any moments!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING !
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: This cam is amazing, the best cam that I've ever bought !It's very slim, you can care it on your hand pretty easy.There are a lot of functions, you can take pictures in any place and the camera will find the best program to make your pic nice!The manual mode you can choose between a lot of pre defined options, like, Sunny day, Snow, Sports, etc... and it comes with some extra pre sets that make efects on the pic, like Sepia, Small Objects.The menu is really simple, you can navigate on it without any problems.The quality of the pictures are amazing, if you choose the correct function or if you are a pro and can put the correct set's manually, will result in a nice pic.There is a function to take wide pictures, where you can take up to 35 shots (making a 360º turn) and after you take, you just need to put the pics on your computer and there is a special software that comes with the cam that gets these pics and make just one, it's amazing the precision of this software.The movie is good to, you can make HD movies. The only bad thing about the movies, is that the mic doesn't make any correction/limit loudness to the sound. Ex. I am a DJ , when I try to record any video on any party (doesn't matter if I am close to the speakers or not) the sound comes totally bad.  If you are planning to record some dj parties, I do not recommend this cam ! parties like kids bday, company reunions, etc, are perfect fine, the problem is with big speaker and loud sounds.The cd comes with the softwares: for download the pics, make few ajustments (like crop, colors, etc...), to make the wide pics, nice pic browser like Picasa.I installed all of them on my Mac and they are working fine. for PC I guess would be the same case.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: This camera is small, light weight, and exactly what I was looking for. I sold my DSLR for a this little camera, and it was a great choice! This camera is great for everyday pictures, and special occasions as well. It is also great for traveling as it fits nicely in any pocket or bag. I would recommend this camera to someone looking for a nice affordable camera.

Reviews.Title: I like this camera!
Reviews.Author: Nancy K. Gammons "good woman friend"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading the reviews in Consumer Reports.  I had a Nikon Coolpix L100 before, but it was stolen out of my suitcase at the airport, so I decided I needed something smaller that could go in my purse, but a good level of clarity.This one is clear, easy to operate, and easy to load onto the computer.  A very  good camera in every way, and perfect for me, a grandma who forgets to take pictures unless the camera is close at hand.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Awesome for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Ruben Sanchez
Reviews.Content: i would have to say that for the price is pretty awesome. although ive noticed in low light area you will want to manually adjust settings accordingly for optimal shots.

Reviews.Title: Canon never fail me
Reviews.Author: MDD
Reviews.Content: This is such an amazing little camera.  It fits in any purse/clutch and when you are someone who gets annoyed a carrying heavy things in their purse, such as myself, that comes in handy.  I love the features, fish eye and the single color features are my favorite.  It also is very easy to use. I absolute love this camera

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: David R. Driesens "DD0191"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, takes great pics for a pocket camera, lots of features and easy to use.  This replaced a similar sized casio and is tons better in every way.  I bought one for my daughter earlier and this one is for my wife.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to post about this camera for a while. I did alot of research and went through a few other cameras in the process (Lumix, Samsung, Fuji). This Canon is by far the best. It has excellent picture qualities. Very easy to navigate. Looks awesome. And don't be fooled by the pics. It is a small camera, but it is very well built. Feels very solid. Takes pictures reasonably fast, and video comes out pretty good. Defintely a great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: kathy
Reviews.Content: I love that this camera is so compact!  More than ample viewing screen, great features, lots of fun ... but best of all, great quality and easy to use!  It snaps a picture quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Maria "Comfort Junkie"
Reviews.Content: I just gave this to my teenaged daughter for Christmas.  We are not techies, so this camera's ease of use very welcome.  Beautiful photos.  Nice small, compact size, will even fit in a pocket.  Came in record time!

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: Anna Lancaster
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this camera. This is the fourth pocket digital camera I have purchased and so far the best picture and video quality yet. I would direct you the the professional review internet sites if you need conformation. Small enough to have with you anytime and almost everywhere.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Alliel
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. The Canon Powershot SD1400Is product is stunning. It produces sharp images, and provides a lot of settings to use. a couple of my favorites are the color accent, and the miniature mode. Color accent allows you to take a picture, and focus on just one color. Miniature mode blurs the top and bottom to give a miniature effect (Like you're taking a picture of a model town or house)and The focus is great! Overall, this camera produces sharp images.

Reviews.Title: Good camera in most aspects except the most important one
Reviews.Author: Tracey Su "Tracey"
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot SD1400IS is as light as a mouse and very compact.  I love the feel of it.  Some of the buttons are so small they might be hard to press by people with fatter fingers.  The camera starts up fast.  Outdoor shots in bright daylight in "Smart Auto" mode are generally pretty color-accurate and vivid.  However, indoor shots are noticeably blurry.  I compared test shots of the same indoor scene with an old Canon Powershot A80 and S2 IS.  Both other (much older) cameras produced much sharper images and with much better color accuracy.  Also, the rubber flap covering the HDMI and mini-USB ports takes too much effort to move for the cables to connect.There are so many 5-star reviews of this camera.  It's possible the one I received was an abnormality.

Reviews.Title: Lots of blurred pictures
Reviews.Author: c
Reviews.Content: PROS:- Very good ergonomics design- Very sexy look and feel- Ultra compact- Solid construction- Good price pointCONS:- Very bad auto focus mechanism- Pictures are not really sharp- No zoom while recording videoWas very excited when I got the Canon SD1400. As it was my first Canon and read overall good reviews about the camera, I had high expectations. The camera is small and stylish and the orange color was great. Unfortunately, although this camera has a lot of pros including the price point that was excellent for the last two months, it has several negatives that are extremely important as they are IMO the core values of a digital camera. Tested the SD-1400 for some days at holiday activities with our toddler and the number of pictures that were blurred was so large that it was impossible to keep this camera. I was disappointed also with the video quality. To be clear, I'm not a professional and was looking for a good point and shot camera with and intelligent enough auto mode that will take good pictures. Shipment and return for a refund with Amazon was as always excellent.Update. Tested also the Panasonic Lumix ZR3 and the Sony Cybershot DSC-WX5. The Panasonic is a good camera, but the low light pictures were quite disappointing. End up choosing the Sony DSC-WX5 , that although it is a bit more expensive, has superior picture quality, extremely good low light performance and 1080i Stereo video with zoom in a smaller package.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, might be too small.
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. I haven't had the chance to use it much but love the features it comes with. I've taken recordings in low light and it's also done well. The only thing is the size of the camera. While small powerful technology is the trend, I wonder if this camera is too small. I'm a petite woman and find it the right size for me but a bit thin. It's the perfect size to jam in my pocket if I'm a hurry but not without a screen protector because I'm afraid of scratching it. And I can't lend this camera to my dad or my boyfriend because it's just too small for their hands. Basically, I like this camera. It's a nice replacement to my IXUS 60 but feel they should've kept the size.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Little Camera!
Reviews.Author: MamaA
Reviews.Content: After doing a ton of research, I finally decided to purchase this little camera. My old Canon point and shoot died. I am very very happy with my purchase. Canon comes through again! Very easy to use....large screen....shoots video. Pics are very clear and easy to download off of the camera. People always comment on my pictures and how crisp they are. Light weight and very easy to throw in your pocket. I bought a case from Amazon as well. This is great little point and shoot!

Reviews.Title: Canon SA1400 Camera
Reviews.Author: Greenthumbs "CAP"
Reviews.Content: Camera is everything I expected and wanted it to be in a very compact, light weight size.  Takes great pictures and is user friendly.  So far, I'd say the only negative is that the door/latch that houses the HDMI terminal seems flimsy and care has to be taken care not to break it off.

Reviews.Title: Conon SD770 IS vs. 1400 IS
Reviews.Author: Gaba Hey "Gaba Hey"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as an upgrade for the 770 IS, which I bought about 2 years ago. They have improved the auto focus. The LCD now shows you what it's focusing on with little green boxes on the LCD screen. It's more auto than ever. The 770, you had to switch to "close-up" mode for any close-up shots. With this one, it's all auto. Also, it's easier to view the photos you've already taken with the play button. The camera is slightly smaller, and looks more stylish with the rounded corners. And I like the orange! The 770 only came in blah silver. It's a shallow reason to like a camera, I know, but the color options are nice. As far as I can see, the picture quality is not much different than the 10 MP SD770. I've seen the pictures on a 60" LCD screen, and I don't see any difference in quality. But the extra 4 MP is an impressive status symbol none-the-less! Ha ha - my car has more horse-power, and my camera has 4 more mega pixels, so there.I would recommend this for anyone who wants to get decent quality pictures without the hassle of carrying around a bulky camera. It's the same size or smaller than a cell phone, and we all know cell phones take bad pictures. With this camera you can easily take it with you everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice - Excellent Performance
Reviews.Author: Jere W. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Having stupidly put my previous Casio EXLM 5.1 megapixels (wow!) in my back pocket and then sitting on it and ruining the LCD display, it was time to get a new camera.  I had really wanted to keep one feature that I loved - optical, see-through view finder.  But I couldn't find a model with all the other features I wanted, so I decided to sacrifice the optical view finder and go with the Canon PowerShot SD1400IS.Then of course, stupid me drops the new camera five feet to a hard wood floor the first time I held it in my hands.  No problem - the little baby wasn't the slightest bit fazed!  Not even a scratch.Pictures taken on auto-mode are excellent!  Shots that would have been blurry on the old Casio turn out great.  And using the other various manual modes is so easy even my wife can do it!  And the HD quality movie mode is awesome to see on an HD TV.Because our two young granddaughters are into pink - we bought the flaming pink model!  We love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Small compact easy-to-use camera
Reviews.Author: khoodlebrink
Reviews.Content: Camera was received about 2 weeks after order with normal delivery option (a little longer than I expected).  Picture quality is excellent.  Camera is simple to use.  Buttons are somewhat difficult to use with larger fingers.

Reviews.Title: Love It!
Reviews.Author: Crystal N. Bordeaux
Reviews.Content: I am definitely satisfied with my decision to purchase this camera. It does everything I wanted. It's lightweight, takes clear pictures, the zoom's great, and it has plenty of fun effects. I love playing with it. :]

Reviews.Title: CRAZY AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: L. Smith
Reviews.Content: I got this CAMERA from best buy and I fell in love immedietly. I pic quality is amazing and so is the vid. It is easy to use and very light, by the time the battery runs low your finger nails will be an inch long. It's got many cool adtions like a cable that can plug into your TV and you can watch the video in HD on the TV. The only thing is that the video likes to pick up noises in the backround but its not bad at all. This is a great camera and you should buy it right now.

Reviews.Title: Battery life
Reviews.Author: Martha
Reviews.Content: I haven't had my camera very long but love it so far.  The one problem I have is tha when I try to transfer my pictures to the computer, it keeps saying that the battery is low.  After the first time, I charged it over night but, the ne xt day it did the same thing.  I don't want to buy a new battery already as I have onlyused the camera for a short time.  Ccould there be something wrong with the camera that it is draining the  battery?

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Isa1
Reviews.Content: I first bought the $400 Sony DSC-TX7.  I have always been a Canon girl but the Sony blew me away with the large display screen and easy to use toch screen features.  I really wanted to love the Sony but ended up returning it.  I bought this little Canon 1400is and compared it side by side with the Sony.  The Sony oversaturated the colors and if it is low light at all, even with the flash, people came out very red in color, sometimes their faces would be okay but neck down very very red.  Also, the low light capabilties of the Sony were very dissapointing even with the flash.  I am reading these recent reviews of the Canon and many complain about the quality of the photos but I am just now seeing it.  I dropped and broke my old Canon, wish I still had it to compare side by side photos with this Canon.  I wish it came with a bigger viewing screen, that was a great asset on the Sony.  Love the Canon's black and white, sepia, and black and white with one color feature, very fun!  The ease of using all of the features takes a little time to adjust to, the Sony was a breeze.  All that said, I am still happy with my decision to keep this camera and return the other, even though I had to give up the large and fun touch screen on the Sony.  Picture quality is the most important thing on any camera as far as I am concerned and I feel this little Canon does a great job.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: great camera for the price. The only thing that is a little diffrent is the zoom switch. it is a little small and slow to find. but I would not take points from the camera for that. does a great job with taking pictures of the kids. considering they never realy hold still.

Reviews.Title: The Canon SD1400 is one of the most attractive ELPHs Canon has designed.
Reviews.Author: Murtaza Bhaila
Reviews.Content: I bought the SD1400IS for its compact size (the slimmest DigiCam around) and its plethora of features, all at a bargain price of $219.Initially I was disappointed with the image quality of the camera, as it is too noisy. But you can't expect a compact cam to capture noise-less images. The previous model - the SD1300IS is known to have better image quality than the SD1400IS, however, if you are not going to use the image for poster prints, and won't be needing to see each and every pixel of the 14MP Image, then you'll soon find the pictures to be Excellent.The New Smart Auto mode works quite well and surprisingly quickly.Macro images are sharp and clear.The HD Video (720p) quality is good, but don't compare it with a camcorder,The exterior has smooth and sleek rounded edges and feels nice taking pictures.Continuous shooting is slower than my previous model - SD790IS.Also I miss the Quick-Select Dial on the SD790IS. Selecting the desired Program Mode on the SD1400 does take longer.Face Detection Self-timer and Smile Shutter are good add-ons, though difficult to set giving the recessed buttons and lengthy menu selection using 2 buttons only.Its got a mini HDMI output, but Canon doesn't include the HDMI cable with it, correctly to reduce unnecessary cost.Battery/Memory compartment is nicer than before, and can take constant opening and closing for a long life. Battery Life is excellent as usual.Overall, the Camera is worth the price I paid for it, and I got what I really needed. An excellent compact DigiCam.But If you are one of those who like to print images on A4 size or more, I suggest you look at the SD1300IS or the Canon SX210IS.

Reviews.Title: Canon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: YCR "YCR"
Reviews.Content: Can't expect less from this product. It's awesome! Image quality worthy of a Canon camera. Excellent for carry on. Video quality is awesome for being such a small camera. Excellent for night time pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Light Weight, Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: LevitMan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after my old Olympus was ready to retire after roughly 10 years. Which is a testiment to the Olympus name years ago, I didnt feel the newer models were made as well. After researching for a camera that met my needs by today's technology standards, I choose the Canon. It is very easy to use, great response in bright and darker lighting while small enough to fit in your pocket. Although I havent had the camera too long, to date Im very happy with my choice and recommend to others..

Reviews.Title: AMAZING CAMERA!!!
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera yesterday. It was rated #2 on consumer reports. I looked at the reviews on many sites and decided to buy it. It is an AMAZING camera!!!! I previously had another canon powershot SD camera and I loved it, but it broke after I dropped it for the 8 millionth time ;). I am an amature photographer looking to expand my experience in photography. This camera has EVERYTHING you will ever need and it's crazy how smart it is! The picture and video quality is outstanding. The clarity and detail of pictures you get with this camera is better than ANY camera I have ever used! It is VERY small and light weight...PERFECT! :)

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: Fish Lady
Reviews.Content: I am not a advanced photographer by any means but I bought this camera specifically for the color swap and other fun options.  I found the camera to be intact, it was shipped right away, there wasn't any pixels on the screen missing or anything else wrong with the camera (based on other people's reviews).  All together I am happy with my purchase and found amazon to have the cheapest price.

Reviews.Title: Nice idea, poorly executed
Reviews.Author: William Hees
Reviews.Content: This camera looks like it ought to be good but it's not.  It has a lot of megapixels, 4x zoom, takes HD video, it's compact and stylish; great.  The lens extends with precision the moment you power it up, implying a high level of attention to detail; cool.  Unfortunately, once you try to use the camera it's another story.,Around 10-20% of my pictures come out unacceptable -- either out of focus or the lighting looks wrong (compare that to a nearly 100% success rate I had with my old PowerShot SD600, circa 2006).  Even on the "good" pictures, the huge number of megapixels doesn't add much detail compared to the 6 megapixels of the older PowerShot.  Operation of the SD1400IS is sluggish.  Everything seems to take a half a second too long -- all those megapixels come at a price.The image and HD video files this camera produces are huge and transfer slowly; slow enough that I cannot play the HD videos over my 802.11g wifi in realtime.  While this is a characteristic of 14 megapixels and HD video in general, not a fault of this camera specifically, it is something to consider.One annoying quirk of the SD1400IS: When you press the shutter button to take a picture you have to stop at the halfway down position and wait for it to focus, otherwise it may not take the picture.  This is ridiculous.  On most cameras stopping at the halfway position is optional, something you only need to be cognizant of if you want the extra control it gives you.  Even though now I'm used to this, it's hard to explain to anyone who I hand the camera to.  If I ask someone to take a picture with me in it, often they try but the camera comes back with no picture actually taken.  Using the self timer isn't a solution -- the camera body is too narrow and rounded for the camera to stand up by itself on all but the most flat level surface.  Yes, it has a tripod mount, but carrying a tripod around defeats the purpose of having a compact point & shoot.The video is a mixed bag.  It's HD, great, but you can't use the optical zoom while shooting.  Worse, it doesn't refocus while shooting video.  If your baby is taking his first steps and is walking towards you he will start out in focus then become out of focus as the distance changes.  With proper planning maybe you can get around this -- take your videos in a way where the distance to the subject doesn't change (like taking the baby walking from the side) -- but it's really not what you want.  Sometimes this forces you to shoot your video in several short clips instead of one long clip.  There is an in-camera tool for trimming videos but unfortunately nothing that lets you combine your short clips into the one long clip you actually wanted.  That said, in my usage there are a lot of times when I can work around these limitations and get a good result, so the video feature is usable.Overall the camera does basically work; I haven't tossed it yet.  If it was a cheap no-name camera it might get three stars on its actual merits, but I'm knocking off a star because it falls so far short of expectations.  It is very compact and stylish, so if these are your most important considerations then add a star or two.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, easy to carry
Reviews.Author: Rafa.el.Guerrero
Reviews.Content: This is a very light camera, before this one i tested canon sd3500 which i returned as it failed and the images of people were distorted. the nikon coolpix s4000 which was sloooow but good pics.This one gives great people/group shots, rendering good colors, is easy to set for beach mode, and I even tried low light with a ok pictures. It has a double stabilization making it better for those shaky hands.Is very easy to carry with you all the time. The controls are easy to use, and if you decide to read , play a biut more with the camera, you can have great long exposures shoots, color swapping (b&n; with a specific color showing up only).I loved this little camera.I upload some pics, one b&w; with color selection, one beach pic, one sunset, and one indoor.

Reviews.Title: Very Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I don't understand all the very positive reviews and should have returned this camera.  I waited a long time to upgrade to get a camera with image stabilization at a reasonable price because I found on my prior camera the photos would often blur just from the action of pressing the shutter and the shake from the shutter motor.  With this Canon, I find the image stabilization worthless and as if non-existant.  Almost everytime I want to take a night photo, I get the warning to use a tripod.  Sure why don't I just do that and by the time I set up the tripod, the photo opportunity is way gone.  Went out on a boat on Biscayne Bay to watch the New Year's fireworks over Miami last night.  The city looked wonderful in the display, but as another reviewer mentioned, everytime I pressed the shutter button halfway to shoot the skyline, it would totally darken out and be underexposed.  I tried adjusting the settings manually to no avail and missed much of the party fooling around with this camera trying to get a better shot.  When the fireworks started, I switched to the "Fireworks" setting.  Great idea to have this setting, but the camara takes so long to snap the photo, the fireworks would just about be gone.  Switched to "continuous shooting" to catch the fireworks, but it still just took single shots.  I have no idea why they have a continuous shooting option, if it doesn't work.  Finally switched it to the movie mode to get the fireworks.  That did a better job, but I wanted still shots, not a movie or I would have purchased a camcorder.  Tried taking some pictures of the people on the boat and all came out blurry.  Sure with the waves, the boat is rocking, but isn't that what the image stabalization should correct?  So, basically I had a camera with me and yet no decent photo memories of the evening.  Also when you start to take the photo, it frames subjects by its choice.  You can't move the frames.  It often doesn't frame what I think it should.  The door to open the cable connections dosen't swing open all the way.  To get it out of the way to insert a cable, you have to open upward instead of outward as the directions say and it feels like it is going to break off.  Get yourself a card reader for about $15 to avoid having to use the cables.  The wide angle takes very inclusive photos, but everytime I turn on the camera, initially everything appears so far away that I have to zoom in at least one setting.  Again this delays the shot and the moment could be gone.  When you turn off the camera, it dosen't keep the zoom level.  I went with Canon because of their reputation for quality products, but I might as well throw this camera in the trash.

Reviews.Title: Rough and Tough
Reviews.Author: Steve Chaney
Reviews.Content: Great camera with Great picture.  This camera is realitively small and takes an excellant picture.  I travel alot and take it everywhere,

Reviews.Title: Expensive Piece of Crap
Reviews.Author: A. Radford
Reviews.Content: The good:-It's small.The Bad:-It's Expensive.-A lot of your photos will be blurry.-Most of your videos will be blurry.-You will have random "lens errors" where the camera won't open or close.I regret having bought this camera and I would only recommend it to people that I really don't like.

Reviews.Title: It sucks,and is not very user friendly
Reviews.Author: NowTraveller
Reviews.Content: Out of focus shots,tedious scrolling to find the right setting for the shot,image stabilizer is a joke. The rest of the one star reviews are pretty in depth,but I thought I'd put forth a simple review and that is that this camera is a POS.

Reviews.Title: so so
Reviews.Author: dermres
Reviews.Content: I used to have nikon point and shoot that I was happy with, but it was only 6 MP and old (but still working), so I wanted to upgrade. I had heard a lot of good things about Cannon so I bought this one about a year ago. So far, I'm not impressed with this camera.  It's just way too slow. Takes forever to focus (so I frequently have out of focus pictures), takes forever to actually take a picture (so I miss photo ops). I'm not some guru so I'm not going to go fixing ISOs, tweaking setting, etc.  I've switched b/w some of the modes and found some modes better than others (I don't like the fully auto one). I'm not looking for SLR quality photography, just a good point and shoot, and this isn't it. Spend a little more money and get something else or you'll end up buying another camera like I'm doing now.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed!
Reviews.Author: Ellen F
Reviews.Content: When my old Canon digital camera finally spat out the bits shortly before I was to leave for a month in Germany as an exchange student, I knew I needed a camera that I could rely on to have a lot of battery life and the ability to take high quality pictures.  I didn't want to miss capturing any wonderful memories that I made while in such a beautiful country.My uncle works as a camera retailer and has always recommended Canon for their amazing picture quality and large, clear screens.  He said that for a point-and-shoot camera, he believes Canon to be the best.  I agree because I have always had a great experience with the quality of the images on both my Canon digital cameras -- especially this one!  I spent a long time looking at Canon's list of cameras and settled on this one for its features and affordability (when I purchased this camera, it was a new model, so it cost $325).  It was worth every penny and I have used it for the past year and a half with no problems whatsoever.  The image quality has never disappointed me; in fact, after a chance to use it, my boyfriend expressed he wanted to get one for himself because he was so impressed by the quality.I highly recommend this camera to anyone looking to get a camera with amazing image quality, HD video capabilities, and excellent battery life for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera ever
Reviews.Author: Amanda Myers "Amanda"
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this camera so much that I recommended it to all my friends and family.  I typically work with a DSLR and I just needed something small that I could carry around for every day use.  It's perfect in that is it small and portable and still takes a wonderful picture.  If you're looking for a good gift idea this is definitely something to look at.

Reviews.Title: Great camera terrible buttons
Reviews.Author: Akbersaeed
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge proponent of Canon point and shoot cameras. In fact I think you are stupid to buy any other brand. I always recommend wide angle pocket cameras, they are so much more versatile. This camera kinda sucks though because the buttons are really awkward and difficult to get used to.

Reviews.Title: Small camera with big results...
Reviews.Author: exjedi
Reviews.Content: As a Canon Digital SLR owner, I was in need of a small portable, pocket sized camera to compliment my full sized professional model.  Not only does the camera do exactly what it claims to do, it goes well beyond that and delivers a huge list of additional features that are not mentioned in the manual.One of the biggest complaints from consumers who purchase and review new cameras is "the pictures are all blurry".  After snapping hundreds of shots under a wide range of indoor and outdoor settings, my answer for those people having focusing issues with this camera would be to learn how to use a camera before you complain about what it does not do for you.  Every shot I have snapped has been crisp and sharp under all lighting conditions, but then again, I have been taking pictures for 20 plus years and was properly trained on how to use both film as well as digital cameras.In short, don't hesitate to pick this camera up, you will be amazed by the features, the picture quality and the functionality of a great little point and shoot for well under $200.  If you are having issues with blurry pictures, do yourself a favor and spend another $50 to take a digital photography class so you can learn how to use your new camera.

Reviews.Title: Yikes!
Reviews.Author: Rob Purdy
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I did plenty of research before choosing to purchase this camera.  I think the most important thing for consumers to realize is that a higher megapixel rating has increasingly little to do with actual viewable picture quality.  My 6mp canon digital elph that this camera was replacing blows this one out of the water.  I was simply looking for a low frills point and shoot that could "sort of" compete with the picture quality of my Canon DSLR.  I knew it wouldn't be as good, but I hoped for "adequate" at the least.  Picture quality was absolutely horrible!  I can't stess this enough.  I'm competent enough with shooting pics to know how to make necessary adjustments to the ISO, white balance, flash, etc.  - well, that made no difference.  The video is also awful.  My little flip camcorder takes much, much better video.  Also, the zoom in/ zoom out button on this camera is horribly placed and way too small.  It's a joke! The one thing this camera has going for it is the size and aesthetics.  So, if you want a beautifully crafted point-and-shoot that's small enough to put "anywhere" and couldn't care less about the picture quality, go out and buy the SD1400IS.  But if you have a crappy 2mp flip phone camera, save your money...

Reviews.Title: About what I expected.
Reviews.Author: Mike L
Reviews.Content: It seems from the other reviews of this camera (here and elsewhere) that people either like it or hate it!I have a Canon A560 that I have been satisfied with, but wanted a physically smaller camera with Image Stabilization and greater resolution. The SD1400 was well reviewed on Consumer Reports and CameraLabs.com, and had decent reviews elsewhere, so I decided to give it a shot.I am mostly pleased. The images produced are very good. Not great, but very good. I thought I would see more detail with 14.1 megapixels, but the images produced are not substantially better than my 7MP A560, as far as I can tell. I do sometimes experience an out of focus image - not often, but probably more than I did with the A560. I also prefer to use the 'P' (program) mode instead of the 'Auto' mode. Usually I find I have to reduce the exposure compensation a bit.The camera's controls and features work well.  The color swap and miniature modes are fun. The buttons are small, but that's the way it goes when the camera body is miniaturized. The camera's small size make it easy to carry anywhere, which is what I wanted.  My camera was made in Japan. I read elsewhere that Chinese made units may be of different/lesser quality, but I didn't find anything to verify that.I would recommend this camera, but check out the new Elph units that Canon is releasing soon!

Reviews.Title: i LOVE this camera
Reviews.Author: mp1227
Reviews.Content: This camera has the longest battery life, I swear. I took it on a ski trip and charged it Friday afternoon for about three hours (first time I was ever charging this camera). Used it alllllll Friday night on the 14th of the month (I'm 19, so you can only imagine how many pictures/videos were taken!), allllll Saturday day/afternoon/night, and Sunday in the day/afternoon. Since then, I've used it maybe three more times and used it to take photos at work. Today is the 30th of the month.. still haven't charged it after such long use. Still at 4 bars of battery life!My pictures come out clear and detailed. I could not have asked for a better camera at such an affordable price compared to others =]

Reviews.Title: One big downside.
Reviews.Author: ec
Reviews.Content: The Camera is beautiful with the color and design makes you want to take pictures all day.There in one downside and can get very annoying. You have to wait at least two seconds before you take the next picture, otherwise a great camera.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: DCLiveWork
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift---after a lot of not so subtle hints that I wanted a new digital camera!  I previously had another Canon model that was bigger and bulkier and took really poor low-light photos.  My girlfriend has a Sony that is compact but also takes really poor low-light photos.  I was finding more and more that when traveling or just being out and about in the area that it wasn't convenient to continually have to "unpack" my bulky camera and then be disappointed in the night shots (which seemed to be accounting for a pretty high percentage of the pictures I was taking).  So my goal was to have a true pocket-sized camera that takes great low-light photos.  After reading several reviews of the Canon Powershot SD1400IS here on Amazon.com and even in Consumer Reports it appeared that low-light shots were a strength for this model and of course it is very compact as well.After taking several shots at Disney in Orlando while on a recent vacation (including quite a few nighttime shots featuring Christmas lights) I can honestly say I am really impressed with the quality of the photos in general and the nighttime photos in particular.My only complaint (which keeps me from giving the camera a five star rating) is that the camera feels like it has to be handled with care.  The body appears to be made out of some sort of metal which means it's kind of slick to the touch---if dropped I'm sure the camera would shatter into a thousand pieces.  Canon should have made the body rubberized to protect it and make it easier to hold or at least used a strong plastic with some kind of grip (like my previous Canon).  It's great that the camera is so small but the catch-22 is that adult hands have to be extra-careful when handling it.Overall though--I am very happy with the camera and would highly recommend it to a prospective buyer.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera
Reviews.Author: GIFD
