Reviews.Content: I am a semi-professional photographer, and have been shooting with SLR's and DSLR's for years. However, the gear gets heavy to carry around on a daily basis for snapshots, so I was searching for a solid ultra-compact camera. The Canon SD1400IS fits the bill perfectly -- it's compact and light enough to be unnoticeable even in a pocket, yet consistent and reliable enough to feel good about.I carry it everywhere with me, and have whipped it out several times since I bought it earlier this month. it has delivered great results each time: group and single spontaneous portraits, macro shots and scenic views. I do not like to give up control over shutter and aperture normally, but the automatic program on this Canon exceeded my expectations and proved to be quick and efficient in the varying situations it was put in.Picture quality is very good, relatively to compact cameras, but of-course doesn't compare to my DSLR's.Overall, I am very pleased with this camera, it's small and sleek appearance combined with solid performance is the perfect combination for me.

Reviews.Title: Sleek, Handy but Delicate
Reviews.Author: crudbug
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after doing a lot of research on the camera. This camera is very sleek, very small, and takes good pictures. I was opening the slot to put memory card in and rubber on top came off. Tried to put it back but its not going in completely thats why I took a star off. Overall, like the picture quality but camera is delicate/not sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother with this cheap "toy" Canon
Reviews.Author: lazytime
Reviews.Content: This is the third Canon I've owned and the only dud of the bunch.  My old 7-megapixel Canon was, shockingly, a better camera.  Half of the pictures I've taken with this, even after trying various settings, have been terrible, blurry, dull.  While the camera is small and lightweight, it's difficult to get a grip on or prop up for timer shots as a result.  (And there is no way to stand it vertically either.)  The very worst thing about this camera for me, however, is the shutter lag.  I take a lot of candid shots of people at events or in bars, and with the shutter lag and blurriness, this just doesn't cut it at all.  Avoid this Canon and don't make the mistake that I did, thinking that 14 megapixels means anything -- spend a little more for a better lens.

Reviews.Title: ABSOLUTELY LOVED MY CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: BrenyGero
Reviews.Content: Everything about it is wonderful i didnt expect it to be so small, but it works for me, plus the color is amazing, it doesnt do it justice on your monitor. Excellent pictures and video are made possible with this camera. The buttons are a little bit smaller than i would like them to be. Since im going from a Sony to a Canon, its taking some time to get use to all the new features and differences between them. Overall, Great picture quality, Video is great too, and i just love this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Little Camera - Big Features
Reviews.Author: Jag151
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a compact, tough little camera that has a number of friendly features, this is the one.  I've put this  camera through the paces and the images are excellent in any number of light conditions.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: C. KEEFE
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews, I agree this is a very basic, very good camera for your money.  Quick, quality, color.  You will not have any issues. Buy the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Jesse Johnson
Reviews.Content: This is a great point in shoot camera. Although I can agree the quality could be better its still a really good camera. If you want a High quality camera you should look into cannon EOS cameras and not a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: It's all about color............NOT!
Reviews.Author: Rich's Property Services Freda
Reviews.Content: I bought this PINK camera for my daughter and within two weeks the camera would shut down due to an error code that eventually could not be solved. Tech support suggestions could not solve the problem. She had to send it in for repairs/replacement. Canon sent a new camera back, however it was an orange one. They refused to send a pink one to replace the one I bought. They basically said too bad, so sad, this is all you get. Amazon services were great, shipping was right on time and the packaging was superb. The camera is great.....when it works. Canon's service policy and customer service, however, is sub-standard. They did send the new (ORANGE) camera within a reasonable amount of time, but if I wanted an orange one I would have bought one. I will never buy a Canon product again because of the way they told us to kiss off and I will be all too happy to spread the word about Canon's take it or leave it attitude for their customers. Maybe they're comfortable with their current market share of Digital Cameras? But I now will start looking at the Nikon's and Panasonic's. Canon's technical quality is not that much better than the competition to have to sacrifice quality of service.

Reviews.Title: No Printed User Manual
Reviews.Author: Fallsbiker
Reviews.Content: Canon puts its user manual on a cd.  You have to print it yourself. Or carry your computer with you.  A real pain not to have the traditional pocket sized user manual.

Reviews.Title: Loved my Canon SD780 Camera but this is a horrible replacement, every shot is out of focus
Reviews.Author: Bryan E. Mayo "Travel Guy"
Reviews.Content: I have sworn by these little Canon cameras for work and play for the past 7-8 years but this camera is horrible, every picture is out of focus compared to my 780IS.  It is too late to return it so off to the donation pile it goes, I would like to believe that I just received a bad camera but this is the 2nd one of these small wide angle lens cameras I have purchased through Amazon.com in the past 3 years and both performed below expectation.  Every image was out of focus compared to my 780IS that still performs like a champ.Don't waste the extra dollars on the wide angle version if image quality is high on your list, stick with the Canon 780IS or equivalent or go with a different brand wide angle all together.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: azerm
Reviews.Content: Horrible quality pictures. I have had this camera for 18 months now and I really regret that I spent money on that piece of junk. It is a very slow camera, pictures quality is terrible unless you are taking a picture of a statue in daylight. You can also use it with people practicing Yoga. Any movement will destroy your picture quality.I apologize to the world for not having posted my opinion earlier.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but trouble
Reviews.Author: K. Fitzpatrick
Reviews.Content: This camera has not worked properly since the day I got it.  About a minute after turning it on, it powers off after reporting an E32 error.  After googling, it appears that this is a common problem with Canon cameras.  I'll never buy another Canon.I would have given this no stars if it had been an option.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: Ecrobey
Reviews.Content: I love canons, they have been the only camera I have ever purchased. I bought this one and it was sitting on my lap and fell, maybe a foot and a half and the case, back screen all shattered. It didn't even continue to take pictures. I mailed it it for warrantee and was told it could not be fixed so I could pay $140 for a new one...I was not happy with the auto focus either (before it broke)

Reviews.Title: Not as gr8 as I expected
Reviews.Author: anony
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera & it failed to live up to my expectations.I was debating between buying the SD1300IS & this one.But since this camera had the HD video I chose this model over that as I wanted to take video clips of my new born baby. Also this camera has this annoying "busy" status that it flashes after you take a pic & u need to wait till that status disappears to take ur next pic.I am still considering on whether or not I shud return it or keep it as this was an addition to my DSLR as my wife wanted a handy digital camera to carry in her diaper bag.

Reviews.Title: poor image quality using auto mode
Reviews.Author: eclectic collector "IEG"
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of product shots and accurate color and contrast are very important to me. To get a quality picture, you will need to use the manual mode. Even under ideal conditions the auto mode can produce fair to poor results. The manual mode is easy to use and produces good pictures, but it quickly becomes a pain when you just want to take a simple picture. The video quality is very good as long as you have excellent light and do not zoom. The size of the camera is great. I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Not the same as the Best Buy model
Reviews.Author: N. Howard
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that this is the 2nd Cannon SD1400 I have purchased.  I bought a black one from Best Buy first then a silver one from Amazon later.  I'm not sure if it's because of the color difference or if there has simply been a change in manufacturing locations.  The first black one I bought from Best Buy was actually made in Japan.  The silver one from Amazon is made in China.  Normally that wouldn't be a big deal to me, but I did notice differences between the two cameras.  The one made in Japan had a slightly better resolution screen on the back and was much faster moving through the menu system.  The one made in China had a lower resolution screen and doesn't move as quickly through the menu items.  I can't say that I notice a difference in picture quality so the important part seems to work the same.  You can definitely save a few dollars by ordering from Amazon, but be aware you may wind up with a little slower Chinese made model compared to if you bought it elsewhere.For the real review section here's what I think of the camera.  First the size is wonderfully small.  It's so easy to carry, it's a very compact camera and has no sharp edges on it.  Secondly are the buttons.  They can be somewhat hard to find and press because they are completely smooth next to the surface of the camera.  You can't necessarily go just by feel, you need to look at what you are pressing to make sure it's the right button.  Picture quality seems to be very good when the right picture mode is used.  In auto mode it does a good job of trying to guess and pictures usually turn out just fine.  However sometimes it doesn't do it properly and then you need to change it to manual mode.  You can adjust just about every setting you can think of in manual mode.  The one I have found most useful is Low Light mode.  You will always want to switch to this when shooting in low light conditions.  It makes a world of difference in how the picture turns out.So 4 out of 5 stars seems about right for this camera.  It's very good but not perfect at everything.  You only get 4x optical zoom because of the small form factor.  You do have digital zoom to go further if you really need to.  Overall if you need a small camera that can take great pictures this camera will work for you.  If you need more optical zoom or professional looking photos you will need to buy a bigger more expensive camera.  Overall I think this camera is a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: marcemars
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my sister. It does not take the best pictures when it's night time or in the dark. I think my iPhone 4 takes better pictures than this camera, but my sister uses it fine and for almost every occasion.

Reviews.Title: Nice and small, low quality images
Reviews.Author: Dr. Review
Reviews.Content: The size is very good, but the images and video are not very good.  This seems about the same quality as my iphone 4, and not as good as my iphone 5.  If you want good quality, I would suggest getting a dslr camera, and if you are worried about size, get a good camera phone like iphone or a nokia.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Z.
Reviews.Content: Now it's over two years since I purchased this camera, I didn't use it often. It has been kept well. However, it has a big problem that it doesn't work unless I pull out and insert the battery repeatedly. Weird! It's a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Only good thing about this camera is that it fits in your pocket
Reviews.Author: J. Weiner
Reviews.Content: We loved our old Canon Powershot and when it finally died we bought theCanon PowerShot SD1400 without bothering to do any research. It is the worstcamera we've ever had! The pictures are always blurry, it's terrible in lowlight and the lag time is awful. We're giving it to my 4 year old as a playcamera.  Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent but crud prone when carried in pants pocket.
Reviews.Author: Carl F. Schlanger "Topgunner"
Reviews.Content: For the money, it's impossible to beat this camera capability, versatility, and availability. It's just always there and handy. I wish it had an optical zoom greater than 4X but that's what you get when the camera is so very, very small/thin. My only criticism -- not really the camera's "fault" -- is that unreachable dirt particles tend to gather on the lens the way I carry it -- always in my left front pants pocket. Sure, I could wear it in a belt-clip holster, or always slip it into a sleeve of some sort -- which would slow me down -- and I may do that. But I love having the camera  on my person at all times and quick to draw. That way, I get many shots that I would otherwise miss. And I consider a shot gotten to be infinitely better than a shot missed. Besides, the dirt is only dramatically visible when fully zoomed in. Also, if dirt potentially ruins a must-keep shot, I can always Photoshop it away. I own two 1400s. Both have dirt in lens that I can't get to but work perfectly otherwise. I'm about to buy a third.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Rivero "dog lover"
Reviews.Content: I'm a big Canon fan. I currently have the Canon 50D with many lenses...but I find myself using the Powershot more often! Its easy to use, lightweight, long lasting battery, takes photos and video. I carry it in my purse at all times. I've taken some great shots with it, most of the time I can't tell which photos came from this camera or the Canon 50D. Unbelievable quality at 14MP.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: CarolJ
Reviews.Content: bought item for my daughter as a Christmas gift.  My daughter-in-law (a photographer by trade) thought it looked good as a nice starter camera.  She took a few picks and they looked nice.  fairly good price, too

Reviews.Title: Compact and Sharp
Reviews.Author: jmeister8
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift last year, and I am completely satisfied with it. I wanted a compact point and shoot so that I wouldn't have to carry a lare DSLR around. This fits right into the palm of your hand, and takes a wide variety of shots. No issues after several months of use.

Reviews.Title: Shipped with wrong power cord
Reviews.Author: Carefreelynn
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this camera came with a European plug which is difficult to use in Florida.  So, the battery charger is unusable until I get a plug converter. This was an unexpected additional expense and a bad surprise at Christmas.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Pavan Kollipara
Reviews.Content: Everything is good but the picture are not so good when taken in some dull light...flash is not so good.. other than this I didn't find any defect in using this cam for normal photography ...

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Camera works perfectly.  Super fast and helpful customer service.  Kate answered all of my questions and was very prompt.  I look forward to doing business in the future.

Reviews.Title: too small, poor focus
Reviews.Author: Angora "Angora"
Reviews.Content: I loved my old Canon Powershot A590 IS and was excited about getting this new model.  I am disappointed in it for several reasons.  First of all it is too small to use all the settings, turn on and off and focus.  It has no view finder so you have a hard time judging shots, especially on a sunny day.  The worst problem is the macro focus, or the lack thereof...  I can take excellent close-ups on my old camera, but almost all my close-ups of flowers, etc. on the new SD1400IS are blurry.  This makes no sense to me.  My older camera can take close-ups of the inside of a flower while this new one goes blurry if you even move closer than a couple of feet.  I am very disappointed in this camera.  I have the settings on the highest resolution too and enlargements are poor.  Either I am not using it properly or it's a step down for Canon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for small size
Reviews.Author: harrison24
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera to take out with me or on vacation.  This is a great upgrade to the older version I had.

Reviews.Title: It's an okay camera, but I think you can do better for the price
Reviews.Author: christine a. melanson
Reviews.Content: This camera actually was accidentally broken.  It is so small and light my husband forgot to remove it from his swim trunk pocket and it wound up wet with ocean water.  It was in a non waterproof case but no luck drying it out.When it did work it was okay.  Pictures were not as sharp as I would have liked but they still came out okay.  Simple to use, can figure out the basic functions just by fiddling with it.  Not very sturdy though. The camera didn't really get that wet and it went pooft!  We had a spare battery and it still didn't work.We have replaced it with the panasonic camera.  Cheaper and looks sturdier.

Reviews.Title: A real bargain
Reviews.Author: R. Startzman "Wood Chief"
Reviews.Content: Canon has kept the price of this little gem reasonable.I bought it over a year ago and use it more than any other camera. It fits nicely in my shirt pocket so I frequently have the camera with me on trips. I always carry an extra battery with me because the battery indicator is not very reliable when it falls below full charge. It seems to go from half full to zero in no time. Canon needs to work on this. I have a DSLR of comparable megapixels that takes slightly better pictures, but it's hard to tell without looking at a large print or screen view. Color reproduction is as accurate as I can tell. Outdoor especially. Skin tones are the best I've seen.I don't mind the lower level high definition video. Videos look pretty good on a large TV and, unless you are after an academy award, you probably won't miss the full 1080 HD.It could use an optical viewfinder because you almost can't see what you are shooting in full sun unless you shade the display. But the optical viewfinder would come at the expense of the ultra compact size and I'd rather have the small size. Also, because of the size, the controls are tiny and you have to get used to this.Eventually smart phones will have these photo and video capabilities. Unless there are large advances in ultra compact digital cameras I think most people will use smart phones instead so they won't  have to carry around two gadgets. In the meantime I'll use this little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Father of Four
Reviews.Content: I had one of these and lost it so I bought a new one. Works like charm. Intuitive controls and nice form factor. Battery life is fine.

Reviews.Title: More than I hoped for
Reviews.Author: Daniel Talley
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a replacement of my Canon SD 1100is and I decided to get this one because of reviews and because it was on sale for $99.97 Memorial Day 2011! It is so much better than the 1100is, and I couldn't be happier with the ease of use and quality of photos it takes. It makes taking pictures even more fun now because it automatically detects the type of image whether it be portrait or macro. Also it is much better than the 1100is in low level lighting which is a huge need for me seeing as most of my images are taken of my kid inside the dim lit home. All in all, great camera for the price and purpose.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: hns
Reviews.Content: Despite my shipping mix up Amazon did very well getting my issue resolved due to the recommended optionhowever i got this camera in no time and i love it the pictures come out great the flash is amazing you will not be disappointed this is worth the money . i recommend that you please please please purchase a carrying case so you can have this camera for ever happy shopping !

Reviews.Title: Fatally Flawed
Reviews.Author: ibc "icoleman"
Reviews.Content: Works fairly well as a still camera, but not as well as some of the older cameras in this line.  Video is quite decent.  The killer though, is the incredibly common "Lens Error" issue, that Canon has never successfully addressed.  It may take a week, it may take a year, but your $200+ camera will fail to turn on, and you'll have to either throw it away, or pay Canon $150 to fix it.  Pay a bit more, and get a Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS7 instead.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because the lens and screen on my SD900 were damaged and carrying my Rebel XTi isn't appropriate for all occasions. In comparison to the Rebel (which isn't a fair comparison since the SD1400 is certainly not a DSLR) the colors aren't as accurate and vibrant and the focus isn't as sharp. In comparison to the SD900, the images are not as sharp. The indoor photos I took just all seem bland. It's not as apparent as it should be which areas are in focus and which are just a bit off. Compared to my older SD550, the image quality is about the same. Perhaps a little less quality.I expect Canon Powershot cameras to be simply outstanding. I expect very good image quality and a level of sharpness which makes the difference between stunning and typical. This camera is disappointing in these aspects compared to previous Canon cameras I have had and I will be returning it.As far as compactness and looking sleek, this camera does stand out, however. Also, there are a lot of features and shooting modes which complement the overall package. One discouraging thing is that the low-light shooting mode (which does an excellent job in limited light) reduces the resolution to 3.5 megapixels. I forgot how spoiled we all are by 10MP+...

Reviews.Title: The camera is an awesome everyday point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Jose N. Morales
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great everyday camera. I've had bigger and better cameras but for a camera that fits in my pocket it was awesome. the video quality is great but could be a little better. looked fine enough on my 60" Led DLP. the pictures were great and the battery life was also very good. the camera is light enough to not be cumbersome but heavy enough to not feel cheap (crappy). everything is in past tense because i lost the camera last Halloween. I've tried a few other cameras that i've had to return because they just didn't match up to the experience i had with this camera. trial with other cameras was because my wife wanted a cheaper camera and cheaper turned out to be just that. she finally broke and decided to get this camera again, it makes me more than happy.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have not had good luck with cameras in the past.  I just wanted a simple to use camera with awesome picture quality that i could use to scrapbook my family.  I definitely received that with my Canon!!!  I love it!! The size is great, too.  It fits easily into your pocket.

Reviews.Title: love powershots but only like this camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly Behan
Reviews.Content: This is my second Powershot camera, and I loved my old one (purchased in 2006).  This one is very similar to my old one which is nice because I understand the features and can use my old rechargeable battery as a backup.The value for the money and the picture quality are good, and it is easy to use.  My main complaint is the shocking slowness of the photo review feature.  My 2006 Powershot quickly shifted through photos, but this camera is painfully slow.  It may not irritate others as much as it irritates me...but it was almost a dealbreaker.  My second complaint is minor, but the zoom button is very small and is a bit tough to operate.I would buy this again because I love the convenience of Powershots, but the product could definitely be improved upon so you may want to wait for the next release.

Reviews.Title: good little camera
Reviews.Author: DB
Reviews.Content: Very fun little camera, and high quality.  The only time it needs to be worked with is when there are low light situations but it can still take good pictures.  The zoom is also in a akward place as well. Overall it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera crummy pictures
Reviews.Author: Bogey's Dad
Reviews.Content: I researched the camera before I bought it. Read all the reviews.  It had all the attributes I was looking for.  What it didn't do is take good pictures.  Indoors, without the flash, all of the pictures had an orange-ish glow. With the flash, every picture had red eye and the colors were all washed out from the extremely bright flash. The flash options were on, off or auto, that's it, no way to soften it.  The image stabilization mode which is supposed to compensate for shaking or moving objects did not work at all resulting in blurry pictures.  The only decent pictures were outside on a bright clear day.  I originally thought it might just be the particular camera i was sent so I exchanged it for another.  Exactly the same results.  Needless to say, I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: t
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera. My friend already has it and she really likes it as well. I like the color accent and the screen display most. The size and weight are an extreme plus so I can carry it around in a smaller bag. The only part that I don't like it some of my pictures come out blurry so I have to keep changing the setting which can be annoying (even with the auto on)

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: LoveToShop
Reviews.Content: I got is for my husband as a Christmas gift.  He's enjoying it and is taking more photos than he has in years.  My only complaint, and a small one at that, is that he had to wait until the stores re-opened after Christmas so he could buy a battery.  I didn't see in the item description that the battery wasn't included.

Reviews.Title: Solid Pocket Power
Reviews.Author: Jeff "Adalta"
Reviews.Content: If it's not broke don't fix it.  This line of cannon is my favorite and a definate girlfriend pleaser .  Solid upper mid class camera with a no BS feature line up. Priced accordingly.

Reviews.Title: Anyone notice a Yellow Cast or Tint to the Camera's LCD?
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Been a Canon fan for years.  This camera is incredible with all of its intelligent and maunal functions.  However, I notice that the LCD does not show true image color, i.e., it has a yellow tint when in Auto mode and under lower light conditions.I have read of this happening with other Canon cameras.I am wondering if any other owners have seen or experienced this.Thanks.Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Clifford R. Saucier
Reviews.Content: I should have paid more attention to the negitive reviews before purchasing this 1400-IS.  I find the camera slow in catching shot, to the point of missing the moment.  It is not good when there is movement from the subject, even with the flash, and it is slow in recovery for the next shot. Not good with action shots either. The metering does not do well when there is back lighting.  There is no "fill flash" capability, or if there is, the manual does not mention it.  The manual gives the basics but little more.  On the plus side, it does take good picture as long as the subject does not move and it is a nice size to carry around.  I paid twice as much for this camera as I had for my Casio and had better results with the Casio; too bad I had dropped it.

Reviews.Title: Very poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Jim Hoffman
Reviews.Content: Tried every possible setting for this camera and the pictures are just not good.  They are very soft/fuzzy...not what I expected from this camera.  Any motion at all and the image is blurry.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Steve Johnson "8 Mile"
Reviews.Content: Impressive in every way - especially when put side by side with others in its price range - sturdy and lightweight - simple to use - takes GREAT pictures - and the HD video is AWESOME!!...this was the primary reason I picked this one when researching and not only does it shoot HD...the end product you shoot looks fantastic!! GREAT camera would recommend all the way (especially if you are close to buying it)

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect.
Reviews.Author: Megan Dehne
Reviews.Content: The only real problem I had with this camera after buying it was that it does not come with a memory card, and the lack of one is not something apparent to a customer without close examination of the box.Memory cards aren't expensive, but it was a bit of a let down to know that I'd have to wait to use my camera until a card arrived in the mail a few days later, or I went out to buy one.

Reviews.Title: very well
Reviews.Author: Denis
Reviews.Content: I like how much small the camera is and i try just 3 times it make real nice pictures but i gone to see in longuer time.thanks.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money! And easy to use!!
Reviews.Author: Nathan Berglund "bergy2k"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for indoor use. I wanted a camera that would take excellent indoor (mainly low light) shots. This camera rocks for indoor shooting. It is quick and the "low light" setting is awesome. It can be a bit smeary for quick movements indoors, but generally it takes excellent pictures. When the whole family is together and everyone has their tiny digital cameras out for pics of the grand kids they all end up putting them away and using mine. The screen is huge and the settings are easy. Both grandmas have been handed this camera and used it without instructions right away. The buttons are not hard to use. I have even used it with full mittens and not really struggled too much. It seems hardy and hard wearing. My son, 4 yrs, can use it and get excellent shots. The video quality is unbelievable. Love it. I was going to buy a digital camcorder too, but there is really no need. I don't tape full concerts or anything. I just want to catch 5 minutes of my son here and there. The battery life is amazing too! When fully charged it lasts forever.The zoom is not the best, but who cares. I didn't buy it for that. I wanted something I could slip in my purse and have with me all the time. This was an excellent choice for me. Just make sure you buy the recommended memory card. ;)

Reviews.Title: Easy to use camera with good quality photos
Reviews.Author: Stowaway
Reviews.Content: Pros:Long Battery LifeNice looking picturesEasy to useVery compactConsVideo is a little grainyNo 1080p videoNot as many "neat-o" features as some of the competitionWe previously owned a Canon SD790is and were looking for a replacement. We tried the Canon PowerShot SD4500IS 10 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3.0-Inch LCD, Brown, but were very disappointed in the poor quality of the pictures and extremely short battery life. We returned that and got this camera instead.So far it's been great!The battery life is amazing - we have gone days with hundreds of pictures between charges.The pictures look great - sharp focus and crisp details. Does a good job with macro shots as well.It's very easy to use - The "Auto" setting is suitable for most situations.It takes the pictures quickly (not DSLR fast, but decent for a point and shoot).It's also lightweight and compact - it fits easily in my purse. Construction seems sturdy as well.The video we've shot was okay. It's a little grainy, even under good lighting conditions, but it's passable. No 1080p though.Overall, we're very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Auto mode lacks, beware of "lens shadow"
Reviews.Author: Portland
Reviews.Content: Overall, the camera seems well built and stylish.  I was happy with the size, weight, and battery life.  There were plenty of options to choose from, although the menus weren't very intuitive or easy to navigate at first.In general, the resolution, color, and clarity of photos was good... except for in a small handful of situations.The auto mode didn't do a great job indoors.  The white balance was usually a bit off, altering the hue of the shot.  Additionally, about half the photos we would take of the kids playing indoors turned out blurry- so we made sure to take twice as many.Lastly, I ended up returning the camera because I could not get past one thing- the "lens shadow".  Every time I wanted to take a close up shot indoors, I ended up with a funny dark corner in the lower right of the shot.  I tried using several different modes, but the shadow would appear in the lower right corner the majority of the time.I thought it was just my camera that was defective, but I found another user who demonstrates the same thing on his Powershot SX210IS camera.  Read and watch his review:http://www.amazon.com/gp/cdp/member-reviews/A12VUB77Q48XI4/ref=cr_cm_rdp_pdp_see_all?ie=UTF8&sort;_by=MostRecentReviewTo sum it up: if you will be taking most of your pictures outdoors, this camera is good for the price.  If you will be taking very many indoor shots (especially low light or close-ups), keep shopping.

Reviews.Title: good little camera
Reviews.Author: Northwind
Reviews.Content: Bought this after my last pocket camera got dropped one time too many. Shopped around, read lots of reviews, and bought my first Canon. So far I've been very happy with it. For me the me big test was taking shots of sporting events. Passed football & hockey with flying colors. Having some fun with some of the special effects too, like selective color. Liked that so well it made the photo for our Christmas card very easy.

Reviews.Title: small size good pictures
Reviews.Author: Dogbone
Reviews.Content: I used to have the 780 but the condensation from a cold water bottle broke it.  I needed to replace it quickly so I picked up this camera.  The picture quality is very good and compares favorably with other point and shoot cameras.  I'm not a professional photographer just someone that wants to take a quick picture with as little fuss as possible.  I wanted a small camera, something that would fit in my pocket and smaller than my cell phone.  The SD1400 did just that.  The LCD screen is bright and a high enough resolution that shows off the pictures nicely.  Obviously they are better when downloaded onto your computer.  Recently took it on vacation and a single charge on the batter provided over 100 pictures, most with flash.  All in all, I'm happy however my next camera will be one that provides a better lens quality.  I am worried about the sensitivity to moisture since my last canon camera broke with just the smallest amount of condensation.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite New Toy
Reviews.Author: K. Smith
Reviews.Content: I'm unable to get into the technical aspects of the camera as I'm not familiar with the jargon. However, I love this camera. It is the perfect size and all of the features such as bubble eyed lense and color switch are fun and make for great pictures. I've owned three other canon cameras before this one with a Sony break in between. Owning my fourth Canon is like coming home. It is easy to use and the HD video is an added bonus. The quality of both photos and video are amazing. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a point and shoot that fits perfectly into any pocket.

Reviews.Title: Compact, high quality, easy to use
Reviews.Author: J. A. Connolly "jalex7"
Reviews.Content: I lost my 4- 5-year-old old Canon PowerShot and needed a new one asap for our vacation. I agonized over various models and decided on the SD1400IS. (I researched on Amazon and Consumer Reports websites.)The Panasonic Lumix is better for someone who wants to have more control over the camera. It has more bells and whistles and things to adjust. I was turned off by the Nikon Coolpix because once you drop it, it's $100 to repair, and I know I'll drop this at some point. (Thank you to the reviewers that let me know about this issue!) I had a Canon before so I knew I'd be basically familiar with the new one.My old camera was metal (I think), easy to hold, so very easy to use, and the quality was very good. I was apprehensive with the new one--would it be too small, too difficult to turn on, to hold, to move out of the way of the flash? Well, thanks to all of the reviewers, I knew what to expect.It is a very thin camera and therefore a little awkward for the first week, trying to make sure it didn't fall out of my hand (I'm a one-hand photographer [not one-handed; I just like to use one hand]). But I got used to this very quickly. The on-off button is flush with the camera's body and must be pressed _below_ the body, but again, I knew about it and it's not that big a deal--unless you have big or calloused fingers. The flash location is another known issue, but it's been an easy adjustment to train myself to get my hand out of the way.The buttons on the back of the camera are similar to my old camera and so were intuitive when figuring out what they did. So far, everything is similar. I haven't had to open the manual. The battery door looks delicate, but I know about it, so I'm careful.The LCD is much bigger than I'm used to, and it's great. Even in the sun I can see the image pretty well. 14.1 MP rocks!

Reviews.Title: A Bit Slow
Reviews.Author: Clef Qian
Reviews.Content: My teenage son, the expert in these sorts of things in our household, says that this new Canon PowerShot SD1400IS, which we bought about a month ago just before a trip, is actually NOT as good as our previous Canon PowerShot SD800IS Digital ELPH.His main gripe is the slowness of the camera.  The previous PowerShot (our first digital camera) was already quite slow compared to the film SLR cameras we were used to and we missed all sorts of shots because of the delayed reaction time. We're not even taking action shots, just normal subjects, at times in motion.  Now my son is saying the new PowerShot is even more sluggish, which is frustrating.Also, the new PowerShot is even smaller than the previous, and its smooth black finish makes it hard to handle and manipulate the controls.  My son has dropped it once or twice as it slipped through his fingers, but fortunately he always puts the wristband on.  Unfortunately, as others have mentioned, the wristband is not adjustable, so hangs there as a huge loop.We hope Canon will address these issues in the future.

Reviews.Title: Defective units 2 out of 2
Reviews.Author: Gibby
Reviews.Content: The first one lasted a whole week. The second one 4 months.Picture quality is actually worse than an old is900's.Battery lasts only a few days at most.A piece of junk in a pretty box.

Reviews.Title: Avoid it like a case of the flu!
Reviews.Author: Happy Cooker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in October, shortly after it was introduced.  I wish we had never met.  The battery lasted for 10 photos and not the 200 that they claimed.  Called Canon in November and they sent a new battery to me and if that wasn't the cause, then I would need to return the camera for repair or a new one.In January, I was still experiencing the same problems, insured the camera for $200, ($13) dutifully returned the 3 batteries that I paid for ($65),and their tech support said I would receive a new camera within 7 days and that a ticket would be issued - and be sure to send in my proof of purchase from amazon.com.I called their office and someone who didn't seem to know the war was over told me to fax a copy of my proof of purchase - explained that I already had sent that, the batteries, etc.  She had no clue.  I promptly hung up and called customer no service and they dug around and came up with a ticket number.  They told me that it might be a refurbished camera, they weren't sure.  I asked to speak to a supervisor and told him that I paid for a new camera and that's what I expected to receive.  I called yet another office and the rep said that a new one had been shipped.  It arrived - refurbished and without the batteries that I had sent them.I wrote a 9 page fax to the supervisor that I had spoken to, explaining that I refused to accept a refurbished camera, along with all the pertinent information.  Hearing nothing from him, I faxed it again.  I surfed around and came up with their President & CEO's name and telephone number.Called their New York headquarters and sent their President & CEO the 9 page fax.  Never heard a word.  Sent it again the next week, asking for assistance.I filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and two weeks later, I received a phone call from a sheepish person who offered no apologies,other than to tell me that if I sent my refurbished camera to them, she would send me a new one, along with three new batteries.  As a 'good will' gesture, she asked if I would accept a free case.  Sure, why not, I had already purchased two and one more would add to my collection.I looked at amazon.com's cameras again and spotted a Nikon that is coming out, 16 megapixels for the same price that I paid for this POS I have;this one has 14 megapixels.  I have no complaint with the pictures - just that their batteries won't hold their charge, their USB cable connection to my Mac isn't recognized and neither is the USB card reader.  The little flap is so flimsy where you plug in the USB connection - I can see that falling off any day.  One reviewer already had that happen....and put Scotch tape over it!  What a design whiz these people are!Doing business with Canon has been a nightmare and I wouldn't do business with them again no matter what they were selling.  They just don't care.I'm on camera #3 - we'll see how this one holds up - don't expect much.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD1400IS
Reviews.Author: Kristin Radesca
Reviews.Content: I am a HUGE Canon fan - I had a Canon SD850IS, which I absolutely loved, but unfortunately it took a nasty spill and the lens broke. I was looking for a replacement and looked at reviews for this Camera. It had a lot of the features the SD850IS had, such as Color Accent, Maco Mode, Kids and Pet, Underwater etc. It was also a nice looking camera and supposedly shot in 720p HD, which I thought was a plus - and being 14.1MP compared to the SD850's 8, I figured this was a sure thing. I WAS WRONG!I played with the camera for hours and hours testing the various functions and video. The video quality is TERRIBLE! It is grainy and has a lot of noise (when I say noise, I mean the quality of the picture) for something which claims to be HD and the microphone is super sensitive so good luck shooting video outside if there is any wind at all. It shoots at 720p with a 30 fps refresh rate, which you would think was ok....When I uploaded the video to my computer, it looked even worse - I was totally disappointed.The camera's picture quality was also not that great! It may be 14.1 mega pixels, but the only thing that lets you do is print bigger, crappier photos. I feel like none of the pictures were clear - the best photos it took were only outside but even then, I was still not impressed. The low light feature wasn't that great either - the pictures were very grainy. The SD850 took better quality photos and it's only 8 mega pixels! Auto mode is also terrible - I'd say about 90% of the pictures taken in Auto mode were blurry and not focused well at all. The Auto Macro...ugh - always out of focus or blurry. I have to say the new Miniature Mode feature was pretty cool,  the larger LCD display was nice looking, and it was cool you could pick from a few different colors as well, but those were the only features this camera had which I liked.The buttons are also super small! - I have small hands and still found it a little tedious to press the buttons. I do understand that this is not a professional camera, but that is no excuse. The SD850IS shot amazing photos compared to this one and the video quality wasn't too shabby. After using this camera, it has prompted me to just send the SD850IS off for repairs. It would have been a wiser decision to spend $179 on repairs, than to have wasted it on this camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: CamsMomma
Reviews.Content: I have an 8 month old daughter and take professional pictures with it! its great. i recommend this to EVERYONE.

Reviews.Title: I simply love this handy camera!
Reviews.Author: fiesty2011
Reviews.Content: Saw this in stores prior to purchasing in Amazon. Got better deal here 'coz it's same price in stores, but in Amazon there's no additional tax, with free shipping, plus you can search for accessories such as extra battery, camera case, without the hassle of walking around the store (which is very tiring).  This camera is very efficient, lightweight, and with good quality pictures with every shot, even during the night. Canon is really really good in lenses, but should improve on battery because the battery lasts for only a day.  But that's alright as long as you have a back up battery. :)

Reviews.Title: Not worth $200
Reviews.Author: Ponskippa
Reviews.Content: i picked this little camera up at Best Buy today. i normally buy stuff here on amazon, but i had a gift card for best buyso i put it towards this camera because i wanted a small point and shoot to carry around with me.ill say straight up that this camera takes "Ok" pictures. Don't let the 14mp label fool you. picture quality is not determined by megapixels. anyway, i usually shoot with a 4 year old Nikon SLR camera. i know you cant compare SLR's to Point and shoot's. But this camera cost's almost half of what a low end SLR costs. This camera performs poorly in low light,there is lots of "noise" aka fuzz, white fuzzy annoying stuff. It does good outdoors and in well lit rooms. I was also disappointed with the HD recording of this camera. There is quite of bit of noise in low light. The most annoying part of the video recording is that whenever you come across light, such as lamps, street lights, reflections, the sun lol, anything that shines light into the video, you will see a blue line appear in the video. completely across the screen. Not good. horrible actually. My 4th gen ipod touch has a tiny tiny lens and sensor, and probably records video just as good, if not better than this camera, without the blue streak across the video. i havent tested many other point and shoots so i dont know if its beter or worse than other brands. I have gotten a chance to play with the Nikon S8100 which greatly outperforms this canon.if you're gonna spend $200 on a point and shoot, save up a little more and get something with a better lens and sensor.I will be returning this camera first thing tomorrow.I'm sure most people will be happy with the SD1400, but if you're picky about photo and video quality, Stay Away.

Reviews.Title: No sharp images. quality of the images sucks.
Reviews.Author: rsr
Reviews.Content: Pros:light weighthandylooks very nicebattery life is goodCons:it lacks sharpness.the quality of the photos are not that much expected.if you use zoom, the sharpness is much worse.If you are really looking at more sharp and crystal clear images, i dont recommend this one. my old 5MP panasonic lumix LZ2 gives much sharper images.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality compared to previous Poweshots...
Reviews.Author: miket
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have owned (and in some cases still own) several Canon PowerShot cameras going all the way back to the S100, SD20, S60, SD400, SD800is, and most recently the SD1400is.  The SD1400is was intended to replace our older SD800is 7.1Mpix, which still works perfectly.  Well, the SD14000is underperformed our old SD800is in about every way you can imagine.  While the SD1400is "looked" pretty, it was very slippery and difficult to hold.  The buttons were very cheap feeling and the zoom switch was a joke.  It was more like a toggle switch than a variable zoom.  The USB port access door was also poorly designed and made removing it very difficult and expect it would eventually fall off.  Even with all these issues, we would have kept the camera if the image quality was good - but it wasn't.  Side by side comparisons of images taken with our old SD800is vs. our new SD1400is showed the SD800is was the clear winner.  The SD1400is images did not have the clarity, sharpness, or depth of color that our SD800is had.  The SD1400is images just looked washed out.  I have since read other reviews of the SD1400is that claimed that Canon is now using plastic lenses on their PowerShot lineup instead of glass.  If this is true, maybe that would explain the difference in image quality.  After being a loyal Canon PowerShot customer for over a decade, I will now turn to other camera manufacturers to replace our SD800is when it finally does stop working.  In the meantime, we have returned the SD1400is for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Horrible... plain and simple
Reviews.Author: Rampage2112
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my SD750 as I wanted a HD video option. This is a pile as the quality of the pictures were moderate. I returned it and got the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS6. The Panasonic ROCKS! Quality lense...

Reviews.Title: Worth $100 but not more.
Reviews.Author: Arianelle
Reviews.Content: First of all, the shape is no good. It is very rounded at all corners and super narrow, so if you're planning on setting this down somewhere for timed pictures, don't get this camera. It will fall over guaranteed. It is also hard to grip with tiny buttons. Make sure you wear the wrist strap.Also, for some reason under indoor lighting without flash, the camera cannot focus properly (especially close-up pictures). Every single picture I tried to take came out blurry. When I do add the flash it does come out 'okay' though. I didn't bother trying to take pictures outside. I'm going to return this product today. Our 8.1 MP sony cybershot and canon powershot cameras from 4 years ago take better pictures than this, which is sad.Go with the S95 if you want good quality pictures both indoors, outdoors and for all the modes your camera comes with. Because...well that's what we pay for right? We don't purchase a product and have it work beautifully in some ways and not in others.

Reviews.Title: Ok if you have steady hands
Reviews.Author: Kevin Chan
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for about a month and decided to return itthe main issue i had was blurry picturesIF your hand is steady then this camera takes fantasic pictures, very sharp.however if your hand move ever so slightly during the shot, your shots can get blurry.The shutter speed is probably longer than averageHD filming is also subparI can only recommend this camera if you use a tripod with it

Reviews.Title: Best camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: brannant2
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic! I got it because it can easily fit in my back pocket when going out. I have been surprised the level of quality from each photo, and have found myself taking more pictures since I can always fit it on me. My favorite feature allows you to select one color and make everything else black and white. The color enhancers for foliage take beautiful pictures. Since I am 21, and not a photographer by any means I am excited when my pictures appear artistic- when really it's just the camera's handy work. I have had a few people from work buy this same camera after testing mine out and friends that have given up taking pictures on their cameras- only to use mine for gatherings. Price online is amazing- we paid $220 for it and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: You need a camera? Not anymore!
Reviews.Author: Bob Mackie!
Reviews.Content: It's 2010. You want a new point and shoot camera.You want it small -- like fit in pocket without a bulge small. Like shirt pocket small. Like little purse small. Like cell phone small. Or even smaller than these new sidekicks.You also want simplicity. A simple camera. Point and shoot, baby. Like giving it to Grandma to take a photo of you wearing her moo-moo. Like hanging-out-in-Missouri-and-you-want-the-yokel-next-to-you-to-take-your-picture simple. Yeah, that simple.But you want quality, too. 12 megapixel quality. Not have to worry about blurry photos quality. Print quality.And, you think to yourself, wouldn't it be cool if it shot video. Like real usable video. Like HD video.Well, here you go. This canon fits these qualifications.Stop yakking on and asking questions. It doesn't do flippin' tricks, people. It isn't going to make your marriage any better. (But you can take cool pictures of yourself on your couch.) It's not going to make your kids look any cuter. Trust me, they be ugly. But at least you can print out the photos yourself on a Canon Pixma and nobody has to look at that creature you call a kid.It's just a damn good camera.Postscript: I bought this camera after I lost my 780is. If you are wondering about the two cameras, my opinion is this one is better, but only slightly. The extra Megapixels really are unnoticeable, but I think the low light is slightly better plus this one comes with a fishbowl effect which really pisses your friends off when you use it. Ha!

Reviews.Title: Very cool
Reviews.Author: Thunderstruck3
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool little camera. It's easy to use and the photo quality is terrific.

Reviews.Title: Given as a Gift
Reviews.Author: H. S. Sinclair
Reviews.Content: My sister was thrilled to get this Canon as a birthday gift. She tells me the pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: I expected S series performance...
Reviews.Author: cipura
Reviews.Content: I lost my many year old Canon S70 and needed a cheaper replacement urgently; after seeing all the new advancements in digital cameras, I thought SD1400IS would live up to my expectations (wide-angle lens, fast shutter, low light no flash shooting, lightweight etc.) Unfortunately, I couldn't get the shutter speed work for me and got too many blurry indoor pictures. Even though I need not to spend that kind of money, I am going back for S90.But, I have to say this; I needed the camera to take some building elevation photos and it indeed did a decent job. Canon at least did not fail me getting the job done. (however, images wasn't as detailed as my S70).ProsSurprisingly great video.Smaller and lighter than many smart phones, yet feels solid.Somewhat intelligent detections and features.

Reviews.Title: camara
Reviews.Author: Luis
Reviews.Content: I used to have an SD 800 and got better picture quality than this one, ofr some reason I can get pics bigger that 3.5 megapixels which was really easy with my SD800, I expected to have a better or heavy pictures in order to print them with better quality.The plus of this camara is the lightness.

Reviews.Title: Almost!
Reviews.Author: stratcat63
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed initially with the SD 1400 Canon, great features, and good picture quality for such a small package!! I used the camera for about 2 weeks before the E32 Lens Error became a frequent occurance. This Error makes the camera unusable by shutting the camera down, so it must then be reset by turning it back on.  After some internet research, it appears that this is a fairly common occurance in the SD 1400 camera. Camera lens alignment is a critical issue, and with the zoom being so broad, the chance for dust, debris, etc. to work its way into the lens mechanism is common.  Canon makes top quality cameras, and I've had several, but I would stay away from the SD 1400. This camera is manufactured in China, which is not necessarily a bad thing, as they show steady product improvement.  However, after more research I purchased a Panasonic Lumix ZS6 which I've had for 2 weeks with no problems so far. For an extra $50, this is a much better camera - period.  More features, better pictures, fast flash, better lens (Leica), better zoom, better made (Japan). In comparison, the canon seems like more of a toy, while the ZS6 is slightly larger, it seems more professional grade.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: The Bandit
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything it says and it's smaller then I expected, which is even better. Canon has outdone themselves with this one.

Reviews.Title: Pink Little Thing
Reviews.Author: Kim T. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera awhile back because I never seen a pink camera. It was different with a little girly twist to it. It wasn't so special anymore when I seen a couple of girls had it. Anyways, this small camera is very handy and a great beginner camera. One thing I do not like about the camera is that the screen is not fully spread out. As you can see in some of the pictures, there is a space of the right side of the screen that is black. That really bugs me for some weird reason. I mean why does it has to be there? Why not make it a full 3.0" screen. Personally, I like big screens to look at pictures. As far as quality goes, it gets a bit shaky here and there. It's hard for me to take motion pictures of kids and sports environment. Also, this is the second canon powershot that the lenses messed up on me. Do not touch the lenses or else they can get stuck and made this weird cracky sound. Overall, decent point and shoot small camera.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality images. Terrible Flash control
Reviews.Author: M.B.
Reviews.Content: I expected so much more for my money.I lost my $120 A series Canon a month or so ago.  It was an old camera (5 years) but had served me well.  I decided to upgrade to this guy and I'm sorry I did.  For the increase in cost, I got some "features" I will never use and the images are less than impressive.DETAILS:  (1)  The flash timing on this camera is terrible.  It routinely blows away fair skinned people, leaving them ghostly white blurs.  Furthermore, the camera actually ends up with after-images on many of the flashed shots.  I had a minolta 35mm 20 years ago that did not do this -- why the regression Canon???  I'm tempted to put a piece of scotch tape over the flash to ease it up a bit -- the thing is just too bloody "hot".  (2)  The AV door is nearly impossible to open with long sharp fingernails, a knife, or something small and pointy.  The way it rotates also makes it difficult to hook up an HDMI or USB cable.  I'm very very very tempted to just bust off the door and improve the functionality of the camera in this regard.  (3)  The Image Stabilization doesn't seem to work.  My old A series (without image stabilization) performed better than this camera.  (4)  The colors are -- interesting.  Out of the box this camera seems to really like to bleach out skin tones -- it's almost a bit "cold" and bluish.  Sure, I could photoshop every image, but why would I buy a point-and-shoot for that?  It would be nice to simply have the camera's colors close to real instead of interpreted by a fancy Digic4 image smasher.  (5)  This camera misses more shots than it takes.  Once again, comparing to a 5-year old A series that's half the cost.  I find that it's time-to-shoot-after-button-press is quite a bit delayed, even for a point-and-shoot.So, for those reasons, this is a 2 star purchase.  Sure, it's one of their flagship models and it is small - but small is only worth so much if the images are consistently thrown out!!!My suggestion:  Buy this camera and some scotch tape and remove the AV door and you might be coming close to what a $100 A-series can do.

Reviews.Title: usual
Reviews.Author: bisa
Reviews.Content: The shots look great on LCD screen, but once you transfer it in to computer the quality of the pictures are not that satisfying.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but battery drain is pretty quick
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, but battery drain is pretty quick.I own this and a Canon SLR camera and the SLR has much beteer battery life.  I just suggest you buy an extra battery for this camera.  Other than that it has great features and simple point and shot.  Also does good video too.

Reviews.Title: Wife just didn't like it-Too small & no view finder
Reviews.Author: T. Dees
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife to replace a "tired" Kodak Z612. Has lots of features for such a small camera. Its truly a shirt pocket camera. Just about the size of my Palm Centro. We took over 1500 photos over Christmas & New-years. No matter what mode we used photos were no better than the Kodak. Very slow to cycle between shots and flaky flash operation. It also had trouble focusing when making a group shot. The LCD screen was bright and clear but outside in bright sun it was difficult to compose your shot. My wife kept going back to her Kodak with the view finder. The little camera seemed to be well built and heavy for its size. It may work out for some folks just fine, however my wife pretty much thought it was a joke. Sorry Canon! She's "just saying"....I'm looking at a Lumix DMC-FZ35 or FujiFilm S2550 or the S1800. I have already returned the Canon and recieved credit. Thank you Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Not What I Expected
Reviews.Author: SamBlog
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for my gf as a xmas gift.  This camera has a 14mp but I'd say it has many years to catch up to my 12mp Panasonic Lumix ZS3 quality. This camera takes poor/off color indoor and low light pictures.  Five stars for Amazon for fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot SD1400IS is underpowered
Reviews.Author: Ravindra Prakash
Reviews.Content: I found that the camera is underpowered and when you snap the picture it takes a while to take the take the picture, you need to keep the hand steady during this time.  In low light condition it causes pictures to become out of focus or degrade in quality.

Reviews.Title: I am not sure about htis seller
Reviews.Author: rao
Reviews.Content: I saw the description of the item as new. However, I think the item was opened at the least. There are couple of signs. The plastic wrappings on the screens that normally attached to camera screen is missing. The battery is fully charged. The battery from the manufacturer is never charged fully. I did not return the item. However they should have sent a new item to me when they advertized it as a new item. The camera is OK.The funciton wise, it takes more time to write into the SD card than my previous canon. I guess it is an OK product.

Reviews.Title: Nice and small but grainy results
Reviews.Author: Ellen A. Wilson "ellwilson"
Reviews.Content: The overall structure and quality of the camera physically is top notch! It has a very sleek design. However - the quality of the pictures is not all that. They are grainy and more often then not the pictures turn out blurry especially in low light, when using the zoom, or if the subject matter is moving. Unlike other popular models the Elph does not have a sports mode. My Fuji EXR 10mp has crisper, clearer pictures. This is unfortunate as the Elph is a perfect size to toss in your pocket. If you are looking for ease of use and size then this camera is for you. If you want a crisp, clear image then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera!
Reviews.Author: kno-it-all
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little point-and-shoot camera.  I bought this to replace an older PowerShot that finally died (had it for 6 years).  If you've owned a Canon in the past, this camera is very similar to other Canons so you'll know what you're getting.  Here's some Pros and Cons:Pros:--Very small, makes it easy to take anywhere--Great lense--Has a lot of picture features (like fisheye, sepia, color swap, party, reduced lighting...just to name a few)--Large LCD screen--Easy to figure out how to operate--Takes pictures faster than my older Canon, even has the option for fast photography (for use at a sporting event)--So far, the battery life is pretty good.  I'm sure it's not the longest battery life around, but I was able to use it for a full day of touring around (in freezing cold weather), and the battery was only half used up.  Of course, as the battery gets older, the charge gets shorter (but that's with any battery)--The battery charger folds up to a small square that is easy to carry around, and has an indicator that tells you when it's done chargingCons:--No viewfinder (but, really, when do you ever use that thing with a point-and-shoot anyway?)--(Although not a problem for me), the buttons are a little small, so if you don't like small buttons, you might not like these.--They don't give you the USB chord to connect the camera to your computer, but it's one of those standard fire-wire chords which I already own about 5 of, so it's not a big deal, just kind of odd...Overall, I highly recommend this camera.  It's a geat deal and you won't be dissapointed (unless those cons really bother you).

Reviews.Title: $30 less one week later
Reviews.Author: Douglas B Worrel
Reviews.Content: Nice small camera for the money but its now being sold for $30 less one week later. Too bad they don't have a price guarantee program.....

Reviews.Title: First time that Canon failed me...
Reviews.Author: Gene
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 2 weeks ago specifically for my family trip to Mexico.Last time I was there I used my good old Konica Minolta Dimage A200 - great quality but bulky.Canon SD1400 fits in a t-shirt pocket, looks stylish, and is loaded with features.On a good side - HD Video is OK, natural colors and natural movements, sound quality is good too.On a bad side - all pictures I took have an unexpectedly soft focus, and a light situation or indoors/outdoors does not seem to matter.Pictures taken at night time, especially at presence of a bright light, are terrible.On the top of it - dreadful "lenses calibration error, restart the camera" message showing intermittently and taking 10 to 15 "restarts" to get fixed.I am returning this camera today.One reviewer pointed out that Canon is now using some low quality lenses - this can explain the soft focus and lenses calibration issues.Canon, get back to your senses while it's not too late, you still have a loyal audience, get things fixed!

Reviews.Title: Dead pixel in 2 months
Reviews.Author: Shop0h0lic
Reviews.Content: I didn't drop my camera or anything but there was a dead pixel on the screen after two months. I had to call Canon to fix it, but I haven't had the chance to ship it in. It's just a pain in the butt when I always need to carry around my camera. Also, the video quality's great, however I hate the picture quality. So yellow and grainy. I like my 8 year old Sony Cybershot better. Also, I get a lot of blurry shots.

Reviews.Title: Truly a fine product for the cost of this unit.
Reviews.Author: Volkan Akkurt "Layka"
Reviews.Content: I have been playing with it for the last few weeks. Essentially, it is truly a fine product for the cost of this unit. I agree with the following statement "1400 seems to use the entire frame to determine how to auto-focus. So if you're taking a macro pic of something that fills the entire frame, you're golden. But try to take a macro pic of something that DOESN'T fill the entire frame, you're screwed". Besides that little detail, it should be fine for 2-3 years of usage. Volkan Akkurt.

Reviews.Title: Great "tiny" camera
Reviews.Author: KrossXC
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome, I was amazed how small it is compared to the sd1200.Darkness:Only flaw is that it sometimes blurs photos in the dark. However, its important to remember that this is NOT THIS CAMERAS fault, it's just a problem for all point-and-shoots. The sensor is too small to take in enough light. You want great photos in the dark, buy a DSLR camera for 500+ and no chance its going in your pocket.Love this camera. great buy. very happy with the pics!

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: E. Jordan "Good Ear"
Reviews.Content: Just setting up the Canon PowerShot DS1400 IS, and it's nifty right out of the box.  The size, weight and form factor are extrememly attractive.  The included accessories are generous in a way that other digital camera manaufacturers don't offer and the camera's features are well concieved. The controls vould be a bit more 'intuitive', but I still ain't complaining, and the video and still shot results are a cut above the rest. Canon knows it's customer and the point and shoot market, in general and they aim high.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Y. Hadad
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot series is definitely the best series of compact camera.It is small, fast and takes amazing pictures. This model is also very cool looking.The only disadvantages in my opinion are that it doesn't have lapse videoand that it cannot take a video with high rate of frame per sec (the highest is 30).But except for that - It is an AMAZING camera! Very recommended!

Reviews.Title: Good but not impressive
Reviews.Author: Mohammad Shamsai
Reviews.Content: The camera takes good pictures in day time. The pictures are not very good in low light conditions. The video is good quality, unfortunately the video quality reduces when zooming in. Overall a good camera but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Denise "Denise"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it a whole lot, but so far I think it is a great little camera with a lot of nice features.

Reviews.Title: Paint chips off...
Reviews.Author: Laura Sirikulvadhana
Reviews.Content: I use my camera every day.I put it in my purse and just let it mix with my stuff.I've had it for over a year and nearly the paint has chipped off the body - now it is silver and pink. It's probably been dropped 3 times but not enough to have the paint chipped off a 40% of the camera.16X zoom... my photos get blurred when I take photos at concerts. You need to do NO flash and have your arm VERY VERY still to take a clearish photo. It gets grainy after 11X.See my photos from the concerts. Don't do flash when you take photos.battery life is great tho. I constantly take photos at concerts... so a four hour concert... I would need two batteries but the first one would last me for about 2.5 hours (constantly on). Video is different. That can suck the life out of it.Lag time: There is lag time when you have to take with flash.Overall: Not bad. Does it's job of taking decent photos.

Reviews.Title: Now I know why it was on sale!
Reviews.Author: Granma
Reviews.Content: This is my third Canon Power shot digital camera.  Only reason I was replacing my second one was it has the old fashioned battery that needs charging too often. Also when taking a close up some of the photo's were coming out slightly blurry. Which meant I had to take several before getting a good one.But this new camera seems to be pretty good on close ups. I do get maybe one or two blurry closeups.But when I took video's for the first time they came out jerky ( not me) and what I consider washed out. The video was not sharp, crisp or good color. A lot of the first video's were taken on the zoom at the 4 level. But my old Canon had no problems using the zoom or taking videos. So guess I will return this Camera and grumble as I have to keep charging my regular battery camera.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is the worse.
Reviews.Author: Coben
Reviews.Content: 14 megapixel means nothing if the pictures all come out bad, unless I'm always outside my house and even then, not as clear as the camera it was supposed to replace. The worst autofocus camera I ever bought....at any price range.

Reviews.Title: disappointing IQ
Reviews.Content: The image quality is disappointing, my Samsung Focus smart phone takes photos and shoots videos, which are just as good as this Canon 1400IS.

Reviews.Title: Light and easy to carry!
Reviews.Author: Linda A. Marty
Reviews.Content: I have not really had a lot of chances to use the camera for what I purchased it for, live concerts.  I did try using it at a basketball game but don't know how to take pictures of people moving.  I need to read the instruction book more to find out how to use more of the functions.  So far I like the quality of most pictures I've taken just practicing.  On Auto in low light it is difficult to hold the camera still and not get blurry pictures.  I am still learning the camera so can't give a true satisfaction review.  After the new year will be better able to do this.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointing camera
Reviews.Author: K. Nichols
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on numerous sites and was excited to receive this camera.  However, only about 10% of the photos I took are decent.  Almost every picture I took in auto mode in low light and day light turned out blurry.  I e-mailed Canon, and their advice was to take the battery and memory card out for 20 minutes and see if that improved the image quality.  Not surprisingly, it did not help.  I returned the camera and am going to get a Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS5 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver) that I tested and found to be much faster, better zoom and crystal clear photographs.I admit that I'm baffled by all of the great reviews for this camera.  It took a long time to focus and take the picture, even without flash.  The low light pictures in a gymnastics facility were terrible for anything outside of a few feet.  The colors were too saturated on the images that were not blurry making skin tones appear oddly colored.  If you have children, you know that you need a fast camera to capture all of those special moments, and this camera is not it.

Reviews.Title: OUT OF FOCUS
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Attorri
Reviews.Content: Most of the videos, and some of the still shots, are grossly out of focus.  I loved the Canon 780IS .... Canon really fumbled the ball on this camera!

Reviews.Title: Incorrect product
Reviews.Author: ISRAEL N.
Reviews.Content: The camera that I bought came diferent, because it came gray(and I bought it's black)  The battery did not come and battery charger was damaged.

Reviews.Title: revisions by manufacturer imperative
Reviews.Author: jan
Reviews.Content: Always loved Canon since my first SLR in the 1960's so my disappointment is very intense.  Buttons for use need to be sized for human sized fingers. Brochure for use accompanying camera tell you NOTHING.  I push buttons and find a menu with lots on it but no explanations. This extensive menu listing is not itemized in the booklet. For example I find a menu listing titled simply "Set" and of course I question "Set What"?  It's not explained in the booklet. This shiny, slippery, itty-bitty camera is designed without any handhold indentations. Taking pictures after a snowstorm it almost flew out of my hands into a snowbank.  Actually, if it had I would have left it buried there. I have a problem determining the top from the bottom and the front from the back. Absolutely the worse purchase I ever made in a camera.

Reviews.Title: lightweight, but image stabilizer sucks
Reviews.Author: Online Buyer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for taking pictures and videos during trips and also for shooting video while flying aerobatics.  I found out to my dismay that the camera was completely useless for shooting the aerobatics, because the image stabilizer mechanism was not able to withstand the slight vibrations of the airplane, and amplified them, whether it was turned on or off.  The resulting image was very choppy. A much simpler camera without a stabilizer produced a clean and stable picture when connected to the same mount on the same airplane.  I assume that you will run into similar problems with this camera if you try it with bikes, cars, etc.  As far as shooting video from the ground, I could not see any difference between the stabilizer turned on or off.Other than that, the sound recording quality is pretty good, and the video, if you shoot it from the ground, is reasonably good.  Single shots are also good.  The rechargeable battery lasts a long time.  I didn't measure, but several hours for sure, and replacing a battery, in case it does run out, is a snap.  The camera is small and easily fits in the pocket, and has a pretty good and intuitive user interface.  Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Overall good shape but camera did not function as advertised
Reviews.Author: Carissa N. Nation "Rissa"
Reviews.Content: I received the camera in good time.  The camera was in overall really good shape but when I turned it on the screen remained black, even when pointed at an image it remained black.  I had to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Canon1400is is not high quality
Reviews.Author: Carl E. Muonio "C"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a cheap money maker for Canon.  It is not good quality, nor is it high performance.  The zoom is little or nothing, the feel of it in your hand is cheap, the "zoom" button is hard to use, requires two hands to hold while useing, and there is a long delay/pause in between taking pictures.  The video play back when down loaded to your PC then played with Quick Time Player is TERRIBLE!  The video quality is "jerky and pauses" rendering it almost unwatchable.  In fairness if you connect the camera directly to your TV, the pictures and video watching are good.  The camera takes fairly good quality pictures inside the house where flash is required but you can't have flash on due to sensitive eyes. All together I would not recommend this product, and it does not possess the valve/quality of a two hundred dollar camera.

Reviews.Title: I REALLY hate this camera
Reviews.Author: T. Dugan
Reviews.Content: I only rate things on Amazon when I really like it or when I really hate it.  I REALLY hate this camera.Unfortunately I lost some of the packaging so I can't return it.What can I say, ALL pictures are washed out and/or blurry, the video is jittery (as in missing frames), the little flap you must open to synch your media with a PC must be forced open and will likely break off.I had a cannon elph for years before I bought this one and was very happy, but this one is a real stinker.

Reviews.Title: Poor Camera
Reviews.Author: EAH
Reviews.Content: I was a loyal Cannon camera owner until I purchased this camera.  Poor quality all the way around.  The shutter speed was very slow, it had a difficult time focusing and the low light shots were terrible.  Ended up purchasing a Fuji from a local camera shop.  I wouldn't recommend buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: excellent light weight camera
Reviews.Author: SHindawy
Reviews.Content: the camera is excellent .. it's very very light  and small can fit ur handthe pix are great and the settings are very easy to usebattery stays for a long time

Reviews.Title: I am a cannon lover but I say DO NOT BUY THIS CAM all of the new Cannons are BAD focus issues and video quality issues.
Reviews.Author: Jesse R. Berger
