Reviews.Content: I have professional cam's and I have point and shoots.  I pre-ordered this.  I currently use a Cannon Powershot SD890 IS, before that I had the 870 and before that I had another.  SO I need to upgrade I ordered after looking at all the reviews and test photos from users the Cannon Powershot SD970 IS - RETURNED IT.  The quality of the photos, the pixels, sharpness and color where all OFF.  I figured ok give it another shot, returned the 2nd one.  Then I figured maybe it was just that model. NO. I ordered the Cannon Powershot SD 1400 in this orange color.  Straight out of the box comparing photos of the SD890IS which is TEN (10) megapixels and has a dig 3 proc.  where as this model as the next processor up and is suppossed to be FOURTEEN (14) megapixels.  Megapixels alone the quality sharpness of the photos should be better then my old less megapixel cam NO!!!!hand!!!! in the same place in the same EXACT lighting seconds apart at the same range ........MY OLD CANNON SD890IS which is TEN (10) megapixels took a SHARPER photo I could zoom in on the photo and see my fingerprints and so forth with this cam the SD1400IS everything was LACKING detail, sharpness completely.  I could not see my any detail at all it was like someone went into adobe and did Gaussian blur on the whole photo.  ALSO in video, there was a dead pixel, which shows up as a white pixel in playback ruining ur video.I have already printed out the return label.  I know how to change settings and adjust photos and do all the tricks....however if you do NOT HAVE a photo that has definition, sharp pixels and basically in simple terms a decent editable photo.......why would u own that cam? YOU WOULD NOT.  I will be more then happy to send ANYONE sample photos which are electronically tagged by the cam so you know which cam took which photo of the same subject in the same lighting.OH and this cam says it is good for low light ya right if you want to have what looks like an overexposed shot and lack all detail.I do not know what is wrong with cannon I have been a customer of their video cam and point and shoot for over 15 years and now at 32 years old I have to change brands bc the quality of their product is SO AWFUL and frustrating for someone who is an avid hobby photographer I am just..beyond upset bc after years of hard use my SD890IS is on its last limbs I have had to pop the case and repair it after dropping and do not know how much longer it will last. I can say with a heavy heart CANNON is NO LONGER the company to trust ur memories to.  so depressing.  If you want to see the sample photos please let me know and I will send you a copy.I had such high hopes again I am just ..I know I am repeating myself but I just CANNOT BELIEVE HOW AWFUL nearly every cam in their line is poor in terms of photo quality and video quality....I tried to dif ones...now I have to look elsewhere GOOD BYE CANNON I want good clear quality photos not blurry bad ones.

Reviews.Title: butterfingers
Reviews.Author: Gonzo F. P.
Reviews.Content: Heads up: this review is purely on the physical design of the camera.It comes down to this: wear the wrist strap thing AT ALL TIMES. This thing will make everyone who touches it wonder if they've got butterfingers. I had the misfortune of using it briefly and nearly dropped it at least a dozen times, whether trying to take a picture or fiddling with settings. That's another problem, the buttons are hard to use.Can't speak for how it shoots, though it seems to work OK for my mom. My dad won't touch, for the reasons outlined above.I have to wonder: what was the point of this design?

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this camera if you want to shoot concerts!
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be the newer version of the Canon Powershot SD780 IS.  I purchased this camera after being told the sound quality in movie mode would be comparable to the 780IS. That could not be FURTHER from the truth.  When they updated this model Canon must have done something to greatly reduce the sound quality on the camera.  I took this camera to a music festival and all videos from the music festival sound horrible.  Every time the song had any kind of bass in it, the sound just fizzled out.  I could not be more disappointed in this camera.  Canon please bring back the good sound quality of the 780IS!!

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: Ranjith2133
Reviews.Content: I dont have complaints but i didn't like that much - bought this for my parents they seem to be happy carrying this thing around

Reviews.Title: Defect
Reviews.Author: UB
Reviews.Content: The camera seem great. It takes good pictures it has a hard time focusing though. It either focuses on the object or the background. Does that great pictures in dark lighting of objects.The one complain I have is the camera arrived with the plastic slide cover being lose. It so happens that I lost it the first day I used the camera. Unfortunately I did not use it till after 30 days of purchase not I have a new camera that is missing a piece.

Reviews.Title: Technical Information. Video modes HD720 VGA QVGA. SD class.
Reviews.Author: Charles Lohr
Reviews.Content: My first Canon SD1400 HD720 (1280x720) video stuttered, so I needed to investigate. The unique frame rate was about 18.  The frame rate was 29.97 but there were many duplicate frames.  My SD card is a SanDisk 8GB class 2, which is not fast enough for the HD720 mode.  The Canon manual says to use a class 4 card or better.Here are the data for three sample videos taken at HD720, VGA and QVGA.  The metrics come from KMPlayer and other sources.The MOV file data rates, in Bps (Bytes per second), for HD720, VGA and QVGA are 3.245E6, 1.438E6 and 0.4166E6, respectively.  1.0E6 is 1000000.  Your results might differ.  A class 2 SD card will work for HD720 but the video stutters because the card cant keep up.  A class 2 card works fine for the VGA and QVGA.  A class 4 or faster card should work for all modes.AUDIO - The audio is the same for every mode: PCM, mono, 768 Kbps, 48.0 KHz, 16 bitHD720 (1280x720)General - Complete name : MVI_0032.MOV, Format : MPEG-4, Format profile : QuickTime, Codec ID : qt, File size : 1.81 GiB (1,947,408,981 bytes), Duration : 9mn 59s, Overall bitrate:26.0Mbps (25.96E6 bps, 3.245E6 Bps).  The camera stops the video at 10 minutes.Video -  Format : AVC, Format/Info : Advanced Video Codec, Format profile : Baseline@L4.1, Format settings CABAC:No ReFrames:1 frame, Codec ID : avc1, Codec ID/Info : Advanced Video Coding, Duration : 9mn 59s, Bit rate mode : Variable, Bit rate : 25.2 Mbps, Width : 1280  pixels,  Height : 720 pixels, Display aspect ratio : 16/9, Frame rate mode : Constant, Frame rate : 29.970 fps, Resolution : 24 bits, Colorimetry : 4:2:0, Scan type : Progressive, Bits/(Pixel*Frame) : 0.914, Stream size : 1.76 GiB (97%)VGA (640x480)General - Complete name : MVI_0034.MOV, Format : MPEG-4, Format profile : QuickTime, Codec ID : qt, File size : 1.74 GiB (1,872,041,190 bytes), Duration : 21mn 42s, Overall bit rate : 11.5 Mbps (1.438E6 Bps)Video - Format : AVC, Format/Info : Advanced Video Codec, Format profile : Baseline@L3.1, Format settings CABAC:No ReFrames:1 frame, Codec ID : avc1, Codec ID/Info : Advanced Video Coding, Duration : 21mn 42s, Bit rate mode : Variable, Bit rate : 10.7 Mbps, Width : 640 pixels, Height : 480 pixels, Display aspect ratio : 4/3, Frame rate mode : Constant, Frame rate : 29.970 fps, Resolution : 24 bits, Colorimetry : 4:2:0, Scan type : Progressive, Bits/(Pixel*Frame) : 1.165, Stream size : 1.63 GiB (93%)QVGA (320x240)General - Complete name : MVI_0039.MOV, Format : MPEG-4, Format profile : QuickTime, Codec ID : qt, File size : 8.07 MiB (8465704 bytes), Duration : 20s 320ms, Overall bit rate : 3333 Kbps(0.4166E6 Bps)Video - Format : AVC, Format/Info : Advanced Video Codec, Format profile : Baseline@L2.1, Format settings, CABAC:No ReFrames:1 frame, Codec ID : avc1, Codec ID/Info : Advanced Video Coding, Duration : 20s 320ms, Bit rate mode : Variable, Bit rate : 2562 Kbps, Width : 320 pixels, Height : 240 pixels, Display aspect ratio : 4/3, Frame rate mode : Constant, Frame rate : 29.970 fps, Resolution : 24 bits, Colorimetry : 4:2:0, Scan type : Progressive, Bits/(Pixel*Frame) : 1.113, Stream size : 6.21 MiB (77%)

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Viginia Couple
Reviews.Content: Canon makes the best camera.  I'm so glad I got this.  I had an older version of the same thing.  Then sold that and got a Sony Cybershot, which is crap.  I regretted it greatly.  So, I got this canon again and I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: I've purchased many new cameas, what went wrong?
Reviews.Author: Evelyne J. Chezum "Evey AKA Missy's Mom"
Reviews.Content: I've just had this camera arrive today, so I cannot really rate the item, but I'm rather shocked with the outcome so far.  I am CERTAIN I purchased this camera from Amazon, since it was in stock, etc...  The package came a day later than expected, and the instruction package had already been ripped open by a previous buyer? For spending his amount of money, I expect brand spanking new. UNOPENED packages. Other items were not in their original packaging as well.  This is leading me to believe that I am NOT having a brand new camera, but perhaps a refurbished one at a "new" price? Just for the heck of it, I looked the vendor that it DID ship from (it was supposed to be Super shipper, no S/H fees, but there were!) and the previous customers had 100% wonderful things to say about them!!  What on Earth happened?  I need to call Amazon. This is not acceptable.  Also, an item that was in my order, that WAS verified as going to be shipped, is now no longer available...is this all customary?? Any reply/advice would be appreciated...THANK YOU.

Reviews.Title: Canon have gone 10 steps backwards
Reviews.Author: J Hickson "J Hickson"
Reviews.Content: I have been a big canon powershot fan for the last decade, buying a new canon camera each year, sadly canon has taken 10 steps backwards and its camera quality has fallen dramatically. getting a clear picture in auto-mode has become near impossible, the speed of the camera and the quality of the photos has gone downhill.Canon you have lost me as a loyal customer, its time to move on to a different brand that cares about the quality of its products.

Reviews.Title: Does it have a timer?
Reviews.Author: conrad
Reviews.Content: Does this product have a timer. I want to be able to take pictures with my wife and I but sometimes no one is available.

Reviews.Title: Does not come with memory card
Reviews.Author: practice "makes perfect"
Reviews.Content: Hi.  I am SURE this cute little camera will work nicely when the memory card arrives.  It was not at all clear to me that the memory card was not included.  Ir=t was nice of Amazon to suggest I buy one, which I diod, but I thought I was uprgading what it came with.  Not so.

Reviews.Title: 1400is - Disappointed
Reviews.Author: V. Mathur "VM"
Reviews.Content: Brought this to take pictures of my newborn. Got mixed results, some pictures were fine and some were blurry. I did not get sharp pictures as well. Apparently the auto mode has some issues. I was hoping that this new canon model would be great as I loved my old 870is. Returned the product and very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: investments
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures; however, it was dropped from about 4 feet, and the camera broke.  It would be nice if it was more durable.

Reviews.Title: Not the best canon of its kind, even when is a newer model
Reviews.Author: C. Cirigliano "Amazon Buyer"
Reviews.Content: I've always had Canon Digital Cameras, but this model is a disappointment. A lot of pictures are out of focus or lacking detail.Don't buy this model, it seems like a defectuos design.I don't even know if I should buy another Canon after this, since I've seen reviews where people say that all of these new models have the same defect.

Reviews.Title: Don't be deceived. Read Carefully. No SD Memory Card Included.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If I based my number of stars solely upon how I predict this camera will work, I probably would have given it 5 stars.  However, I'm giving it only 4 stars because I feel that it should have included the SD memory card.  I'd like to try this camera out, but because it didn't come with a memory card, I can't.  I should have read the contents of the box more carefully, but, instead, I read about all the neat things it does.It does NOT come with an SD memory card, so now I have to buy that separately in order to actually take a picture.  My son bought this same camera and his purchase included the memory card, so I just "assumed" that mine would come with it, too.  So  make certain that you read the ad more carefully than I read the ad.  You're buying JUST the camera --WITH NO memory card, and you will need the memory card to take pictures.Disappointed -- but it's my fault for not reading the contents description more meticulously.

Reviews.Title: receive the camera, but no Memory Card
Reviews.Author: annelbert
Reviews.Content: I received the camera today and quite pleased with the pink color. However, there's no memory card which supposed to be sent together !

Reviews.Title: LCD broke right away, now it's worthless!
Reviews.Author: V. Putin
Reviews.Content: The LCD on this camera broke within the first 2 weeks.  It was somehow damaged while in my PC bag, which I can't imagine was too traumatic on the camera.  I question the product quality.  Also, of the few pictures I did manage to take before it broke, some were really blurry.  You need to carefully push the button slowly until the camera focuses properly before taking the photo. This isn't practical when you're traveling and asking others to take your picture.Overall I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Made in China....?!!
Reviews.Author: C. HAN
Reviews.Content: I wonder anyone got this camera is made in china?Its serial# 0420600XXXXBtw, I felt it got cheap material with battery cover.

ProductInfo.Features:
14.1-megapixel resolution; 2.7-inch PureColor System LCD
28mm wide-angle lens; 4x optical zoom and Optical Image Stabilizer
720p HD movie shooting capability plus HDMI output
Smart AUTO intelligently selects from 22 predefined settings
New scene modes such as Miniature Effect and Fisheye Effect; Low Light mode for dimly-lit situations.
ProductInfo.Name: Canon PowerShot SD1400IS 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Orange)
